English: Inasmuch as many have taken in hand to set in order a narrative of those things which have been fulfilled among us
Bahnar: Ơ Theophil, đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei đei lơ bơngai chă chih roi gah dôm tơdrong Yêsu oei hơdai păng bơ̆n tơ ala teh âu sơ̆.

English: just as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered them to us
Bahnar: Lu sư chih dôm tơdrong bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng lu bơngai mă 'bôh tôm tơdrong Yêsu đơ̆ng tơm hmơm sơ̆, khơ̆ Sư tŏk tơ plĕnh. Lu bơngai 'bôh tơdrong Yêsu sơ̆ sư ră roi tơdrong noh kơ bơ̆n.

English: it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write to you an orderly account, most excellent Theophilus
Bahnar: Na inh kư̆m chă jet pơnhên đe gah tơdrong Yêsu đơ̆ng tơm hmơm sơ̆, na inh kư̆m wă roi ăn kơ ih mă đơ̆ng tơm truh tơ wĕch

English: that you may know the certainty of those things in which you were instructed.
Bahnar: wă kơ ih băt mă tơpă gah tơdrong Yêsu.

English: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah. His wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
Bahnar: Kơplah pơtao Hêrôt pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđê sơ̆ đei minh 'nu 'bok soi anăn sư Sachari. Sư khŭl 'bok soi mă đe anăn khŭl Abia. Anăn akăn sư Êlisabet. Akăn sư ei kon sâu Arôn mă pơm 'bok soi tơm hmơm sơ̆.

English: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
Bahnar: Bre sư pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng rok kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both well advanced in years.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre sư ưh kơ đei hơ'lơ̆p yua kơ Êlisabet bơngai hơwŏng. Bre sư kư̆m kră ngăl boih.

English: So it was, that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division
Bahnar: Minh năr ei 'bok Sachari jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem yua kơ trŏ năr lu khŭl sư jang tơ noh.

English: according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi juăt kơ pơpơn dih băl wă kơ băt bu gơh mơ̆t lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm noh soh 'long pơgang 'bâu phu yua wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na năr ei đe pơpơn dih băl na trŏ kơ 'bok Sachari gơh mơ̆t soh.

English: And the whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of incense.
Bahnar: Kơplah Sachari mơ̆t soh 'long pơgang lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei na lu kon pơlei pơla oei krao khan tơ 'ngoaih.

English: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
Bahnar: Na blư 'bôh hloi linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur dơ̆ng gah 'ma kơ chơnang soi soh 'long pơgang 'bâu phu ei.

English: And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
Bahnar: Sachari 'bôh sư, na hli.

English: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zacharias, for your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.
Bahnar: Mă-lei linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ sư: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli. 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ih krao khan apinh sư wă kơ đei kon. Na akăn ih ning-mônh gô tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo. Na ih anăn sư Yôhan.

English: And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.
Bahnar: Ih gô hiôk tơpă păng kư̆m đei lơ bơngai nai hiôk yua kơ đei sư.

English: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink. He will also be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
Bahnar: Yua kơ ning-mônh sư gô pơm tih 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư ưh kơ gơh et sik dah dôm tơmam kiơ pơm ăn suai. Sư 'bĕnh blai Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă đơ̆ng đe tơpŭ kơ sư truh tơ ning-mônh.

English: And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.
Bahnar: Sư gô tơgŭm lơ bơngai Isơrael wih tơ Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơ̆n wă jê̆ jur na kon ih ei gô năm hơdrol kơ Kră Yang. Sư đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ sư jing pran kơtang tơpă kư̆m thoi Êli sơ̆. Sư gô tơgŭm kon pơlei Isơrael 'mêm mơnat kơ lu kon sư. Sư gô tơgŭm lu bơngai ưh kơ lui tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch na wă kơ đei đon 'lơ̆ng. Yua kơ thoi noh na sư hơmet ming kon bơngai adrol kơ Kră Yang truh.”

English: And Zacharias said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”
Bahnar: Na Sachari jet linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei: “Lơliơ inh gơh băt tơdrong noh gơh sĭt yua kơ inh kră tơpă boih păng ŭnh om inh kư̆m kră mơ̆n?”

English: And the angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and bring you these glad tidings.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan: “Inh âu boih Gabrel. Inh ling-lang oei hơdai 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư wơh inh jur pơtruh ăn kơ ih tơdrong noh

English: But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day these things take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time.”
Bahnar: mă-lei ih khan ưh kơ lui kơ inh. Ning-mônh ih gô 'bôh tơpă. Yua kơ ih ưh kơ lui na ih jing ưh kơ gơh pơma đơ̆ng dang ei truh kơ năr ih 'bôh tơdrong inh roi ăn kơ ih hei.”

English: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marveled that he lingered so long in the temple.
Bahnar: Kơplah linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei oei pơma dơnuh kơ sư, na lu kon pơlei pơla chang gô sư lĕch ră. Kơna kon pơlei sơleng kơ đon yua kơ tơdrong kiơ Sachari ngôi lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei đunh dêh.

English: But when he came out, he could not speak to them; and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, for he beckoned to them and remained speechless.
Bahnar: Lăp Sachari lĕch sư ưh kơ gơh pơma kơ đe na lu sư băt kơ Sachari 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch lăm noh. Na sư pơma kơmlo ăn kơ đe đĕch.

English: So it was, as soon as the days of his service were completed, that he departed to his own house.
Bahnar: Lăp trŏ kơ năr sư pơdơh kơ jang lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei boih na Sachari wih tơ hnam.

English: Now after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived; and she hid herself five months, saying
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh akăn sư jing akâu kơhioh, na akăn sư oei lăm hnam pơđăm khei ưh kơ đei lĕch ôh.

English: “Thus the Lord has dealt with me, in the days when He looked on me, to take away my reproach among people.”
Bahnar: Akăn sư khan thoi âu: “Dang ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm inh boih, đe huay pă pơma kơnê̆ kơ inh dơ̆ng boih.”

English: Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth
Bahnar: Lăp Êlisabet akâu kơhioh tơdrâu khei boih na 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư, anăn sư Gabrel, jur tơ Pơlei Nasaret lăm dêh Galilê.

English: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei năm tơ minh 'nu adruh sơkơ̆t boih păng minh 'nu tơdăm, anăn sư Yôsep. Yôsep sư adrĕch adrung pơtao Đawit sơ̆. Na anăn adruh ei Mari.

English: And having come in, the angel said to her, “Rejoice, highly favored one, the Lord is with you; blessed are you among women!”
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei truh tơ Mari khan hloi thoi âu: “Kơkuh kơ ih, duch. 'Bok Kei-Dei wă yua ih păng Sư lăp đon kơ ih boih.”

English: But when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying, and considered what manner of greeting this was.
Bahnar: Mari kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư mah chrêu kơ đon yua kơ sư ưh kơ băt wă đei tơdrong kiơ, mah kơkuh kơ sư thoi noh.

English: Then the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Ơ Mari, ih 'nĕ kơ hli yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ ih tơpă.

English: And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bring forth a Son, and shall call His name JESUS.
Bahnar: Ih gô anăp, klaih kơ noh tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo. Ih anăn Sư Yêsu.

English: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tih păng đe krao Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang mă tih hloh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ Sư pơm pơtao iĕm, kư̆m thoi 'bok pơtao Đawit iĕm sơ̆.

English: And He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of His kingdom there will be no end.”
Bahnar: Sư gô pơgơ̆r adrĕch adrung kon sâu Jakôp ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.”

English: Then Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, since I do not know a man?”
Bahnar: Na Mari khan kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei: “Lơliơ tơdrong noh gơh đei yua kơ inh oei adruh ưh tam đei klo?”

English: And the angel answered and said to her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Highest will overshadow you; therefore, also, that Holy One who is to be born will be called the Son of God.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Gô đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur tơ ih, tơdrong mơsêh mơyang mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ ih. Thoi noh na kon nge mă ih tơpŭ noh, Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Now indeed, Elizabeth your relative has also conceived a son in her old age; and this is now the sixth month for her who was called barren.
Bahnar: Ih lăng kơtum ih, Êlisabet. Sư kră tơpă boih, na sơ̆ đe khan kơ sư bơngai hơwŏng, mă-lei dang ei sư akâu kơhioh, đei tơdrâu khei boih.

English: For with God nothing will be impossible.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.”

English: Then Mary said, “Behold the maidservant of the Lord! Let it be to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.
Bahnar: Na Mari khan: “Inh âu jơ̆ đĭch đam Kră Yang, inh mơ̆ng kơ Sư ăn kơ inh thoi ih khan kơ inh hei.” Na linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei wih hloi đơ̆ng sư tŏk tơ plĕnh ti.

English: Now Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, to a city of Judah
Bahnar: Lăp đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Mari năm tơ pơlei đe kiơ̆ kơpal groi kông lăm dêh char Juđê.

English: and entered the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.
Bahnar: Na sư mơ̆t tơ hnam Sachari na kơkuh kơ Êlisabet.

English: And it happened, when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, that the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Lăp Êlisabet 'bôh Mari kơkuh kơ sư, nge lăm klak sư adrŏ hloi. Na Êlisabet hơloh 'bĕnh blai Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng

English: Then she spoke out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
Bahnar: păng pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ Mari khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ ih hiôk hloh kơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu drŏ-kăn đe nai. Sư ăn kơ kon mă ih wă tơpŭ ning-mônh kư̆m hiôk thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ inh na sư mah athei mĕ Yŏng inh năm ngôi tơ inh?

English: For indeed, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
Bahnar: Lăp inh kơtơ̆ng ih kơkuh kơ inh hei, nge lăm klak inh hiôk dêh na sư mah adrŏ.

English: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord.”
Bahnar: Ih hiôk tơpă yua kơ ih lui kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ ih gô đei kon.”

English: And Mary said: “My soul magnifies the Lord
Bahnar: Na Mari khan: “Jơhngơ̆m inh bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang dêh

English: And my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.
Bahnar: jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih inh.

English: For He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant; For behold, henceforth all generations will call me blessed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư mơnat kơ inh bơngai đam Sư, na đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon bơngai gô khan kơ inh đei pŭn hiôk tơpă.

English: For He who is mighty has done great things for me, And holy is His name.
Bahnar: 'Noh yua kơ dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ngăl.

English: And His mercy is on those who fear Him From generation to generation.
Bahnar: Sư mơnat kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mă lui yom kơ Sư, mă đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ ning-mônh.

English: He has shown strength with His arm; He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
Bahnar: Sư yua tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư wă blah pơpuh tŭk lê̆ lu bơngai mă pơang akâu kơdih hăm pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe.

English: He has put down the mighty from their thrones, And exalted the lowly.
Bahnar: Sư tơjur tŭk đĭ lu bơngai mă pơm tih sơ̆, na atŏk dơ̆ng lu bơngai mă pơm iĕ hloh kơ đe.

English: He has filled the hungry with good things, And the rich He has sent away empty.
Bahnar: Sư 'me lu bơngai pơngot rơwĕt tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng, mă-lei lu bơngai mơdrŏng noh Sư tơbrŏk ti hoh đĕch.

English: He has helped His servant Israel, In remembrance of His mercy
Bahnar: Sư tơgŭm lu bơ̆n bơngai Isơrael mă đĭch Sư, yua kơ Sư pơkă đơ̆ng sơ̆ khan wă mơnat kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: As He spoke to our fathers, To Abraham and to his seed forever.”
Bahnar: Sư pơkă kơ lu 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆, đơ̆ng Abraham truh kơ lu kon sâu sư ning-mônh, khan wă tơgŭm bơ̆n ling-lang.”

English: And Mary remained with her about three months, and returned to her house.
Bahnar: Mari oei hơdai păng Êlisabet dang lăp pêng khei. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh sư brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih.

English: Now Elizabeth’s full time came for her to be delivered, and she brought forth a son.
Bahnar: Truh kơ khei 'năr Êlisabet boih na sư tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: When her neighbors and relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy to her, they rejoiced with her.
Bahnar: Lu bôl buăl hăm kon pơlei pơla kơtum kơtŏng 'nhŏng oh sư kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ sư tơpă ăn kơ sư kon, na lu sư kư̆m wang hiôk chơt mơ̆n.

English: So it was, on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him by the name of his father, Zacharias.
Bahnar: Lăp kon sư ei truh tơhngam năr boih na đe năm kăt tơdra akar kon sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt lu bơngai Isơrael. Lu 'nhŏng oh đe mĕ 'bă sư wă anăn sư Sachari kư̆m lei-lăi thoi anăn 'bă sư mơ̆n yua kơ sư juăt anăn thoi noh.

English: His mother answered and said, “No; he shall be called John.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei mĕ sư khan: “Ưh ôh, bơ̆n anăn sư Yôhan đĕch.”

English: But they said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan: “'Nhŏng oh bơ̆n, adrĕch adrung bơ̆n ưh kơ đei bu anăn Yôhan, na liơ bơ̆n gơh anăn sư thoi noh.”

English: So they made signs to his father—what he would have him called.
Bahnar: Na lu sư pơma pơtao păng ti jet 'bă sư wă anăn kon sư bu.

English: And he asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, saying, “His name is John.” So they all marveled.
Bahnar: Na 'bă sư athei lu sư chă gơ'bang iĕ wă chih. Na Sachari chih thoi âu: “Anăn sư Yôhan.” Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư sơleng kơ đon.

English: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he spoke, praising God.
Bahnar: Na 'bă sư Sachari gơh pơma hloi, na sư ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then fear came on all who dwelt around them; and all these sayings were discussed throughout all the hill country of Judea.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu bôl buăl păng kon pơlei pơla wang kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na lu sư chrêu kơ đon păng năm chă roi kơ đe dôm tơdrong noh jơ̆p kơ tơring kiơ̆ kông dêh char Juđê ei.

English: And all those who heard them kept them in their hearts, saying, “What kind of child will this be?” And the hand of the Lord was with him.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh pơwao lăm đon sư kơdih khan: “Nge âu ning-mônh sư wă pơm kiơ kơnh?” Lu sư tơchĕng thoi noh yua kơ lu sư 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư tơpă.

English: Now his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying
Bahnar: 'Bă sư Sachari 'bĕnh blai Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng na sư roi lê̆ hơdrol thoi âu

English: “Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, For He has visited and redeemed His people
Bahnar: “Bĕ bơ̆n ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang wei-lăng bơngai Isơrael bơ̆n, yua kơ Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n tơpă na Sư huai iŏk bơ̆n.

English: And has raised up a horn of salvation for us In the house of His servant David
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n minh 'nu 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih mă đei tôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang. 'Bok 'noh Kon Sâu Đawit mă đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: As He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, Who have been since the world began
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư sơ̆ kư̆m khan thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: That we should be saved from our enemies And from the hand of all who hate us
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng dôm lu bơngai areh arĕnh ayăt kơ bơ̆n.

English: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers And to remember His holy covenant
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong noh wă kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Sư pơkă kơ 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆, khan gô wă tơgŭm bơ̆n tơpă.

English: The oath which He swore to our father Abraham
Bahnar: Na Sư pơkă kơ 'bok Abraham bơ̆n tơdrong noh

English: To grant us that we, Being delivered from the hand of our enemies, Might serve Him without fear
Bahnar: wă kơ pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng dôm lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ bơ̆n. Na Sư wă kơ bơ̆n jang tơdrong Sư huay kơ hli

English: In holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life.
Bahnar: păng pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng Sư păng kon bơngai mơ̆n tơ anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ ning-mônh.

English: “And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest; For you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, gah ih âu đe gô anăn ih bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mă Kră Yang Tih Hloh, yua kơ ih gô năm hơdrol kơ Kră Yang wă hơmet ming kon bơngai hơdrol kơ Sư truh.

English: To give knowledge of salvation to His people By the remission of their sins
Bahnar: Na ih gô bơtho lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng wă kơ lu sư gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, wă oei hiôk păng 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Through the tender mercy of our God, With which the Dayspring from on high has visited us
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang mơnat kơ bơ̆n tơpă, na Sư ăn 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih ei jur tơ bơ̆n. Sư thoi măt 'năr pơchrang tơ'bôh tơdrong hơdah kơ bơ̆n mă bơngai oei lăm măng mu, wă lôch hiong ră, mă-lei Sư gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ bơ̆n tôm tơdrong hiôk-hian.”

English: To give light to those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death, To guide our feet into the way of peace.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang mơnat kơ bơ̆n tơpă, na Sư ăn 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih ei jur tơ bơ̆n. Sư thoi măt 'năr pơchrang tơ'bôh tơdrong hơdah kơ bơ̆n mă bơngai oei lăm măng mu, wă lôch hiong ră, mă-lei Sư gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ bơ̆n tôm tơdrong hiôk-hian.”

English: And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm noh 'bok pơtao tơm đe Rôm, anăn sư Ôgut, chih hla bơar athei đe chă chih măt rim kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ tơring sư pơgơ̆r.

English: This census first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria.
Bahnar: 'Nâu mă blŭng-a đe chih anăn tơ lăm hla bơar, kơplah Krinus oei pơm 'bok tih lăm dêh char Siri.

English: So all went to be registered, everyone to his own city.
Bahnar: Lu đe wang brŏk tơ pơlei sư kơdih wă chih tơmơ̆t anăn lu sư.

English: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David
Bahnar: Yôsep yak đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret, dêh char Galilê, năm tơ Pơlei Betlehem, dêh char Juđê, pơlei Đawit sơ̆, yua kơ sư kon sâu adrĕch adrung Đawit.

English: to be registered with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was with child.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư năm chih tơmơ̆t anăn sư tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơdai hăm Mari bơngai mă sơkơ̆t hăm sư, sư oei anăp.

English: So it was, that while they were there, the days were completed for her to be delivered.
Bahnar: Lăm năr bre sư oei tơ noh, truh kơ khei 'năr Mari boih

English: And she brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in swaddling cloths, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
Bahnar: klaih kơ noh sư tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon kơdră sư. Sư tơsu kơ kon sư minh blah khăn, klaih kơ noh tơ'bĭch kơpal 'nhĕt kro tơ lăm war rơmo yua kơ ưh kơ đei anih boih lăm hnam 'bĭch tơmoi.

English: Now there were in the same country shepherds living out in the fields, keeping watch over their flock by night.
Bahnar: Jê̆ pơlei noh đei lu bơngai wei triu kral kơmăng wei-lăng triu sư tơ bri.

English: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood before them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were greatly afraid.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang năm tơ'bôh kơ lu sư. Tơdrong mơsêh mơyang pơchrang hơdah tăp dăr kơ lu sư. Lu sư hli tơtey.

English: Then the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid, for behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy which will be to all people.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, yua kơ inh wă roi kơ iĕm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong mă đĭ-đăng kon bơngai 'nă hal.

English: For there is born to you this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
Bahnar: Măng 'nâu tơ pơlei Đawit, đe tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih, 'Bok Kră Yang, Krist.

English: And this will be the sign to you: You will find a Babe wrapped in swaddling cloths, lying in a manger.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nâu wă tơbăt kơ iĕm chă Sư: Iĕm gô 'bôh minh 'nu kon nge tơsu khăn, tơ'bĭch kơpal 'nhĕt kro lăm war rơmo.”

English: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư 'bôh blư bla linh jang 'lơ̆ng lơ tơpă dơ̆ng hơdai păng buăl sư mă jur hơdrol. Lu sư hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu

English: “Glory to God in the highest, And on earth peace, goodwill toward men!”
Bahnar: “Ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ plĕnh ti. Sư wă ăn hiôk-hian kơ lu bơngai mă Sư lăp đon tơ ala teh âu.”

English: So it was, when the angels had gone away from them into heaven, that the shepherds said to one another, “Let us now go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has come to pass, which the Lord has made known to us.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng hơri păng wih tơ plĕnh đơ̆ng lu sư, lu bơngai wei triu ei pơma tơduă lu sư: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm tơ Pơlei Betlehem chă lăng tơdrong mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nao roi kơ bơ̆n.”

English: And they came with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the Babe lying in a manger.
Bahnar: Na lu sư kơdâu brŏk tơ Pơlei Betlehem. Lu sư chă na 'bôh Mari hăm Yôsep păng 'bôh kon nge oei 'bĭch kơpal 'nhĕt kro.

English: Now when they had seen Him, they made widely known the saying which was told them concerning this Child.
Bahnar: 'Bôh thoi noh boih lu bơngai wei triu ră roi đêl tơdrong linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơbăt kơ lu sư gah kon nge 'noh.

English: And all those who heard it marveled at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
Bahnar: Lu đe wang hlĭch hlăch kơtơ̆ng lu bơngai wei triu ră roi tơdrong noh.

English: But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart.
Bahnar: Mari 'blŏk hơdơ̆r tơdrong noh, klaih kơ noh tơchĕng lăm đon sư kơdih.

English: Then the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei triu wih, bơnê kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ lu sư kơtơ̆ng hăm 'bôh tơdrong noh lei-lăi thoi linh jang 'lơ̆ng đei khan kơ lu sư.

English: And when eight days were completed for the circumcision of the Child, His name was called JESUS, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.
Bahnar: Lăp nge Yêsu truh tơhngam năr boih na đe kăt tơdra akar Sư păng anăn hloi Sư Yêsu kiơ̆ kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng pơkă ăn kơ sư hơdrol kơ nge sư tam đei lăm klak mĕ Sư sơ̆.

English: Now when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were completed, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord
Bahnar: Truh kơ năr mĕ Sư wă hơmet akâu kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă sơ̆, na mĕ 'bă Yêsu anhăk Sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Sư kư̆m wă pơyơ̆r Yêsu kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ ei mơ̆n.

English: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the LORD”)
Bahnar: Bre sư pơm thoi noh wă kơ kiơ̆ thoi đe chih lăm tơdrong juăt Kră Yang thoi âu: “Rim kon gơgơ̆l, iĕm athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang ngăl.”

English: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
Bahnar: Na bre sư kư̆m soi sơmah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ đe chih lăm tơdrong Kră Yang sơ̆ khan: “Iĕm soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei minh agrop sem kơmuŏl dah 'bar tŏ kon kơtơp.”

English: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was just and devout, waiting for the Consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ei đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Simiôn. Sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kư̆m lui kơjăp păng chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh 'Bok Krist dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai Isơrael. Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei hơdai păng sư.

English: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơbăt ăn kơ sư, hơdrol sư lôch sư gô 'bôh 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơklaih kon bơngai bơ̆n.

English: So he came by the Spirit into the temple. And when the parents brought in the Child Jesus, to do for Him according to the custom of the law
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei Simiôn mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Lăp mĕ 'bă Yêsu anhăk Yêsu mơ̆t tơ noh boih wă pơyơ̆r Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt Kră Yang pơkă

English: he took Him up in his arms and blessed God and said
Bahnar: na Simiôn iŏk pôk Yêsu, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu

English: “Lord, now You are letting Your servant depart in peace, According to Your word
Bahnar: “Ơ Kră Yang, dang ei Ih ăn kơ inh mă đĭch Ih âu lôch achăng lê̆ teh đak âu hiôk-hian. Kiơ̆ thoi Ih khan kơ inh sơ̆

English: For my eyes have seen Your salvation
Bahnar: na dang ei inh 'bôh boih bơngai mă Ih wơh wă dŏng pơklaih đĭ-đăng kơ khŭl kon bơngai nhôn.

English: Which You have prepared before the face of all peoples
Bahnar: na dang ei inh 'bôh boih bơngai mă Ih wơh wă dŏng pơklaih đĭ-đăng kơ khŭl kon bơngai nhôn.

English: A light to bring revelation to the Gentiles, And the glory of Your people Israel.”
Bahnar: Sư dang pơchrang tơdrong hơdah kơ đĭ-đăng kơ khŭl bơngai tam mă lui kơ Ih, 'noh wă tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong Ih. Sư gô ăn kơ lu đe Isơrael, bơngai mă kiơ̆ Ih, jing hiôk tơpă.”

English: And Joseph and His mother marveled at those things which were spoken of Him.
Bahnar: Na mĕ 'bă Yêsu kơtơ̆ng Simiôn roi gah tơdrong Yêsu hơdrol na bre sư hlĭch hlăch kơ đon tơpă.

English: Then Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary His mother, “Behold, this Child is destined for the fall and rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which will be spoken against
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Simiôn apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bre sư. Sư kư̆m khan kơ Mari thoi âu: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n kon nge âu wă tơgŭm lu bơngai Isơrael jing hiôk, mă-lei lu bơngai kuă kơ lui kơ Sư jing răm. Sư bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă tơgŭm bơ̆n ră mă-lei đei lơ bơngai gô pơjĭp pơjăm Sư. Yua kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n gô băt jơhngơ̆m lu đe ei kơnê̆ tơpă.

English: (yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul also), that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”
Bahnar: Păng ih kư̆m gô tơ'bơ̆p lơ tơdrong sơ'ngon tơpă mơ̆n ning-mônh, yua kơ dôm tơdrong đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ kon ih.”

English: Now there was one, Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age, and had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu yă kră khŭl bơngai Isơrael. Sư kư̆m juăt kơ pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. Anăn sư Anna, kon Phanwel. Sư adrĕch adrung Aser. Sư kră tơpă boih. Sơ̆ sư oei hơdai klo sư tơpơh sơnăm, klaih kơ noh klo sư lôch.

English: and this woman was a widow of about eighty-four years, who did not depart from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
Bahnar: Na sư adro oei oăi minh drô̆ truh kơ sư tơhngam-jĭt puăn sơnăm boih. Na sư ưh pă đei lĕch ngôi đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm boih. Sư oei lăm noh, sư ơ̆t kơ por krao khan măng năr.

English: And coming in that instant she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of Him to all those who looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Na sư kư̆m năm tơ mĕ 'bă Yêsu mơ̆n. Sư bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng roi lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Yêsu kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: So when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.
Bahnar: Lăp mĕ 'bă Yêsu pơm tôm tơdrong kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă boih, na lu sư brŏk tơ Pơlei Nasaret, pơlei sư kơdih tơ dêh char Galilê.

English: And the Child grew and became strong in spirit, filled with wisdom; and the grace of God was upon Him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu rai đunh rai wơ̆ kư̆m đei jơhngơ̆m pran. Sư kư̆m 'bơ̆r đon hlôh wao tôm tơdrong. 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ Sư tơpă tơgŭm Sư ling-lang.

English: His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm trŏ kơ năr giĕng mă đe anăn Giĕng Năm Brih na bre mĕ 'bă Yêsu juăt kơ năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And when He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm boih Sư kư̆m hơdai kiơ̆ mĕ 'bă Sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơ pơm rok kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Năr Giĕng Năm Brih ei.

English: When they had finished the days, as they returned, the Boy Jesus lingered behind in Jerusalem. And Joseph and His mother did not know it
Bahnar: Lăp đe pơm giĕng đang boih na mĕ 'bă Yêsu pơtơm brŏk tơ Pơlei Nasaret, mă-lei Yêsu oei ngôi tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: but supposing Him to have been in the company, they went a day’s journey, and sought Him among their relatives and acquaintances.
Bahnar: Na mĕ 'bă Sư ngêh kơ Yêsu kư̆m brŏk hơdai păng lu bôl buăl 'nhŏng oh Sư. Na bre sư yak prăt năr rok trong brŏk tơ pơlei. Truh kơsơ̆ boih bre sư chă ră Yêsu tơ buôl buăl sư

English: So when they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking Him.
Bahnar: mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh. Na năr dơning bre sư hơlơ̆k năm chă tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: Now so it was that after three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them and asking them questions.
Bahnar: Na lăp năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng na bre sư 'bôh Sư tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Sư oei hơdai păng lu 'bok thây wă kơ mơ̆ng lu sư bơtho, na Sư kư̆m jet lu đe noh mơ̆n.

English: And all who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and answers.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei 'bơ̆t ei mơ̆ng Yêsu sơleng kơ đon yua kơ Yêsu tơl lu sư hơgei tơpă.

English: So when they saw Him, they were amazed; and His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You done this to us? Look, Your father and I have sought You anxiously.”
Bahnar: Lăp mĕ 'bă Yêsu 'bôh Sư tơ noh na bre sư chrêu kơ đon, na mĕ Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Ơ dăm, yua kơ kiơ Ih pơm kơ nhi thoi âu? Nhi 'bă Ih chă Ih tôch đon hli kơ Ih hiong.”

English: And He said to them, “Why did you seek Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father’s business?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ mĕ 'bă Sư: “Biĕm chă kiơ kơ Inh jơ̆p-jang? Biĕm ưh kơ băt kơ Inh wă hăt kơ jang tơdrong 'Bă Inh âu dah kiơ?”

English: But they did not understand the statement which He spoke to them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre sư ưh kơ hlôh Yêsu wă pơma kiơ.

English: Then He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was subject to them, but His mother kept all these things in her heart.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'nei na Yêsu brŏk kiơ̆ mĕ 'bă Sư tơ Pơlei Nasaret. Sư chu yom kơ mĕ 'bă Sư ling-lang. Na mĕ Sư oei tơchĕng 'blŏk ling-lang kơ tơdrong noh hei păng dôm tơdrong đe khan lê̆ hơdrol gah kon sư, mă đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt kơ Yôhan mă kon Sachari nơ̆r Sư tơ char glă sơ̆. Kơplah noh sơ̆ 'bok Tiberi pơm pơtao tơm lu bơngai Rôm đei mơjĭt-pơđăm sơnăm boih. Bonsơ Pilat pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđê, na Hêrôt pơgơ̆r dêh char Galilê. Đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng 'bok Philip, oh Hêrôt, sư pơgơ̆r dêh char Itur păng dêh char Trachônit. Na 'bok Lisan pơgơ̆r dêh char Abilen. Kơplah ei sơ̆ 'bok Ana păng 'bok Kaiphe oei pơm 'bok soi tơm đe Juđê.

English: while Annas and Caiaphas were high priests, the word of God came to John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt kơ Yôhan mă kon Sachari nơ̆r Sư tơ char glă sơ̆. Kơplah noh sơ̆ 'bok Tiberi pơm pơtao tơm lu bơngai Rôm đei mơjĭt-pơđăm sơnăm boih. Bonsơ Pilat pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđê, na Hêrôt pơgơ̆r dêh char Galilê. Đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng 'bok Philip, oh Hêrôt, sư pơgơ̆r dêh char Itur păng dêh char Trachônit. Na 'bok Lisan pơgơ̆r dêh char Abilen. Kơplah ei sơ̆ 'bok Ana păng 'bok Kaiphe oei pơm 'bok soi tơm đe Juđê.

English: And he went into all the region around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins
Bahnar: Na Yôhan năm jơ̆p kơ tơring kiơ̆ krong Jôrđăn. Na sư bơtho athei đe tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch na iŏk 'batem wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch sư.

English: as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying: “The voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way of the LORD; Make His paths straight.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'blep trŏ thoi Êsai, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, sư chih 'măn lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar sư thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai bơtho tơ char glă chơngue ning-mônh khan: ‘Bĕ bơ̆n hơmet trong kơ Kră Yang păng pơm trong Sư mă tơpăt. Wă khan lu bơ̆n tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: Every valley shall be filled And every mountain and hill brought low; The crooked places shall be made straight And the rough ways smooth
Bahnar: Dah teh thŭng thong, bơ̆n choh 'bŭ mă mơnglei; kiơ̆ kông lôk bơ̆n athei choh waih wă kơ sư mơnglei dang ăi; kiơ̆ trong wing bơ̆n kư̆m hơmet ming mă tơpăt; kiơ̆ trong kơnê̆ sơgol sơgônh bơ̆n athei choh ming mă tơhnă.

English: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’ ”
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô 'bôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch tơpă.’ ”

English: Then he said to the multitudes that came out to be baptized by him, “Brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan kơ lu bơngai tơpôl wă năm iŏk 'batem ei thoi âu: “Iĕm âu dang lĕ kơ 'bih. Iĕm băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak iĕm ning-mônh na iĕm mah năm tơ âu wă iŏk 'batem đĕch khan gô klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong phak noh hă?

English: Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei tŭk lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ na pơm mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt wă kơ đe băt kơ iĕm tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch tơpă boih. Iĕm 'nĕ pơhơi khan kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, pơm khan sơđơ̆ng kơ Abraham bơ̆n tơbôl hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư gơh pơm kơ tơmo âu jing kon sâu Abraham lei-lăi thoi iĕm mơ̆n.

English: And even now the ax is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang kon bơngai, Sư pơlong lăng thoi âu: Sung Sư, Sư 'măn hiă rim kơ tơnơm 'long boih. Dah 'long ayơ ưh kơ đei plei 'lơ̆ng lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô kăl tŭk 'long noh klơ̆m tơ ŭnh.”

English: So the people asked him, saying, “What shall we do then?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai tơpôl ei jet Yôhan: “Lei ih wă kơ nhôn pơm thoi yơ?”

English: He answered and said to them, “He who has two tunics, let him give to him who has none; and he who has food, let him do likewise.”
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan dơ̆ng: “Dah bơngai bu đei 'bar blah ao lei sư athei asong minh blah ao sư kơ lu bơngai mă hoh kơ đei. Dah bơngai bu đei tơmam sa rơkah, lei sư athei chă asong kơ đe lei-lăi mơ̆n.”

English: Then tax collectors also came to be baptized, and said to him, “Teacher, what shall we do?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai juăt iŏk jên thuê̆ đe, sư kư̆m năm iŏk 'batem mơ̆n, na lu sư jet Yôhan thoi âu: “Ơ 'bok thây, ih wă kơ nhôn pơm thoi yơ?”

English: And he said to them, “Collect no more than what is appointed for you.”
Bahnar: Na sư khan: “Iĕm 'nĕ pơlơ̆m sa jên đe.”

English: Likewise the soldiers asked him, saying, “And what shall we do?” So he said to them, “Do not intimidate anyone or accuse falsely, and be content with your wages.”
Bahnar: Lu linh kư̆m jet sư mơ̆n: “Bĭ gah nhôn, ih wă kơ nhôn pơm thoi yơ?” Na Yôhan khan kơ sư: “'Nĕ pơgŏ iŏk tơmam đe, 'nĕ jâu ngơ̆r wă sa tơmam đe păng 'nĕ kơ mơmơnh kơ jên khei iĕm đei.”

English: Now as the people were in expectation, and all reasoned in their hearts about John, whether he was the Christ or not
Bahnar: Lu kon tơring tơrang chang gô 'Bok Krist truh, na đĭ-đăng lu kon bơngai tơchĕng lăm jơhngơ̆m đon sư kơdih khan: “Yôhan âu dah kiơ 'Bok Krist?”

English: John answered, saying to all, “I indeed baptize you with water; but One mightier than I is coming, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yôhan khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Inh pơm kơ iĕm 'batem păng đak đĕch, mă-lei đei minh 'nu Sư gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh noh Sư 'Bok tih tơpă, dah Sư athei inh iŏk ăn pôm chơkhŏ Sư, inh chu iŏk đĕch, ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng Sư ôh. Sư ei gô pơm kơ iĕm 'batem thoi âu: Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơm kơ iĕm tŭk lê̆ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ kư̆m thoi ŭnh soh lê̆ hla đuih đăm.

English: His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean out His threshing floor, and gather the wheat into His barn; but the chaff He will burn with unquenchable fire.”
Bahnar: 'Bok ei sek tơlang kon bơngai thoi lĕ kơ Sư chĕp minh hlak kơđum wă um tŭk đĭ dôm lu 'ba bo. Na Sư iŏk lu 'ba liĕng wă tah lê̆ lăm kŭ 'ba Sư. Na dôm lu 'ba bo noh Sư wă soh tŭk đĭ tơ ŭnh mă ưh kơ layơ păt.”

English: And with many other exhortations he preached to the people.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yôhan oei bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, sư kư̆m đei bơtho khan lơ tơdrong nai mơ̆n.

English: But Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him concerning Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done
Bahnar: Yôhan khă pơtao Hêrôt yua kơ sư tơgar iŏk Hêrôđia, akăn oh sư păng Hêrôt kư̆m pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ nai dơ̆ng.

English: also added this, above all, that he shut John up in prison.
Bahnar: Na Hêrôt kư̆m pơm kơnê̆ kơ Yôhan tah hloi sư lăm hnam phak.

English: When all the people were baptized, it came to pass that Jesus also was baptized; and while He prayed, the heaven was opened.
Bahnar: Kơplah đe tam mă phak Yôhan sơ̆ sư pơm 'batem kơ lu kon tơring tơrang. Đơ̆ng noh sư kư̆m pơm kơ Yêsu 'batem mơ̆n. Lăp Yêsu iŏk 'batem đang boih na Sư krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na plĕnh tơpơih.

English: And the Holy Spirit descended in bodily form like a dove upon Him, and a voice came from heaven which said, “You are My beloved Son; in You I am well pleased.”
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng thoi lĕ sem kơtơp jur oei tơ Yêsu. Păng kư̆m đei nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh khan: “Ih boih Kon Inh mă 'mêm kơeng tơpă. Inh lăp đon kơ Ih tôm tơdrong.”

English: Now Jesus Himself began His ministry at about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, the son of Heli
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu pơtơm wă jang tơdrong Sư, kơplah noh Sư dang pêng-jĭt sơnăm. Đe ngêh kơ Yêsu kon Yôsep. Yêsu kon sâu Hêli.

English: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Janna, the son of Joseph
Bahnar: Hêli kon Matthat. Matthat kon Lêwi. Lêwi kon Mênchi. Mênchi kon Janê. Janê kon Yôsep.

English: the son of Mattathiah, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai
Bahnar: Yôsep kon Matathia. Matathia kon Amôt. Amôt kon Nahum. Nahum kon Êchli. Êchli kon Nagê.

English: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathiah, the son of Semei, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah
Bahnar: Nagê kon Maat. Maat kon Matathia. Matathia kon Sêmêin. Sêmêin kon Jôsêch. Jôsêch kon Jôđa.

English: the son of Joannas, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri
Bahnar: Jôđa kon Jôanan. Jôanan kon Rêsa. Rêsa kon Serupbabel. Serupbabel kon Sealtien. Sealtien kon Nêri.

English: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er
Bahnar: Nêri kon Mênchi. Mênchi kon Ađi. Ađi kon Kôsam. Kôsam kon Enmađam. Enmađam kon Êrơ.

English: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi
Bahnar: Êrơ kon Jôsuê. Jôsuê kon Êlisê. Êlisê kon Jôrim. Jôrim kon Matthat. Matthat kon Lêwi.

English: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim
Bahnar: Lêwi kon Simiôn. Simiôn kon Juđa. Juđa kon Yôsep. Yôsep kon Jônam. Jônam kon Êliakim. Êliakim kon Mêlêa.

English: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattathah, the son of Nathan, the son of David
Bahnar: Mêlêa kon Menna. Menna kon Mattatha. Mattatha kon Nathan. Nathan kon Đawit.

English: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon
Bahnar: Đawit kon Jesê. Jesê kon Ôbêt. Ôbêt kon Bôas. Bôas kon Salmôn. Salmôn kon Nasôn. Nasôn kon Amminađap.

English: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah
Bahnar: Amminađap kon Atmin. Atmin kon Arni. Arni kon Hêsrôn. Hêsrôn kon Pêres. Pêres kon Juđa.

English: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor
Bahnar: Juđa kon Jakôp. Jakôp kon Isăk. Isăk kon Abraham. Abraham kon Tharê. Tharê kon Nakô.

English: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah
Bahnar: Nakô kon Sêruk. Sêruk kon Rêgâu. Rêgâu kon Phalek. Phalek kon Hêbê. Hêbê kon Sala.

English: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech
Bahnar: Sala kon Kainan. Kainan kon Abaksat. Abaksat kon Sem. Sem kon Nôê. Nôê kon Lamek.

English: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Cainan
Bahnar: Lamek kon Matusêla. Matusêla kon Ênŏk. Ênŏk kon Jarêt. Jarêt kon Mêlêên. Mêlêên kon Kainan.

English: Then Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu wih đơ̆ng krong Jôrđăn, Yêsu Sư 'bĕnh blai kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng anhăk ba Sư

English: being tempted for forty days by the devil. And in those days He ate nothing, and afterward, when they had ended, He was hungry.
Bahnar: truh tơ char glă chơngue. Sư oei tơ ei puăn-jĭt năr. Na kơplah puăn-jĭt năr ei đei yang Satan năm pơhlŭ Sư. Kơplah noh Yêsu ưh kơ đei sŏng sa ôh. Lăp truh kơ puăn-jĭt năr ei boih na Sư pơngot.

English: And the devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đei yŏng yang kơnê̆, anăn sư Satan pơhlŭ Sư khan: “Dah Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă Ih kuă kơ kiơ sơkat kơ tơmo âu jing 'bĕng?”

English: But Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ưh ôh, yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đei chih khan lê̆ sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei arih đơ̆ng tơmam sa đĕch ôh.’ ”

English: Then the devil, taking Him up on a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
Bahnar: Yang Satan anhăk Yêsu tŏk tơ kông kơjung na tơ'bôh ăn kơ Sư jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char hloi.

English: And the devil said to Him, “All this authority I will give You, and their glory; for this has been delivered to me, and I give it to whomever I wish.
Bahnar: Na yang Satan khan dơ̆ng kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ih lăng deh teh đak âu. Na inh gô ăn kơ Ih pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng kơ teh đak âu rŏ dêh. Đe pơjao ăn kơ inh đĭ teh đak âu boih na inh kư̆m gô wă pơjao ăn kơ bơngai nai dơ̆ng, 'noh gô mơ̆ng kơ inh ăn đĕch.

English: Therefore, if You will worship before me, all will be Yours.”
Bahnar: Na dah Ih chu drap tơ teh kơkuh kơ inh, lei inh gô pơjao ăn kơ Ih đĭ-đăng teh đak âu hloi.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to him, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only you shall serve.’”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ yang Satan ei thoi âu: “Đe chih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Bơ̆n athei kơkuh kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă kơ bơ̆n kơkuh kơ yang nai ôh.’ ”

English: Then he brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
Bahnar: Yang Satan kư̆m anhăk ba Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na sư anhăk ba Yêsu tŏk tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam akŭm tơm. Na yang Satan ei khan: “Dah Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, lei Ih kuă kơ kiơ kơtah đơ̆ng kơpal âu tơ teh sŭng

English: For it is written: ‘He shall give His angels charge over you, To keep you,’
Bahnar: yua kơ đe đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư wei-lăng Ih,’

English: and, ‘In their hands they shall bear you up, Lest you dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
Bahnar: ‘lu sư gô drơng iŏk Ih lăm tơpang ti lu sư wă kơ Ih huay kơ huŏng hơtat kơ tơmo tơ ala.’ ”

English: And Jesus answered and said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the LORD your God.’”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ yang Satan ei thoi âu: “Ưh ôh. Yua kơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đe đei chih khan thoi âu: ‘Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơlong Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.’ ”

English: Now when the devil had ended every temptation, he departed from Him until an opportune time.
Bahnar: Lăp yang Satan ei pơhlŭ Yêsu tôm tơdrong boih na 'bơ̆t ei sư weh tơ nai 'mơ̆i.

English: Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and news of Him went out through all the surrounding region.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu wih tơ dêh Galilê. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm hloi Sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang. Na đe chă roi pơư pơang tơdrong Sư jơ̆p kơ tơring kiơ̆ ei.

English: And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho tơ lu hnam akŭm đe Galilê na đĭ-đăng bơngai ư-ang kơ Sư.

English: So He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu wih tơ Pơlei Nasaret, pơlei Sư kơdih. Lăp truh kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat Sư năm akŭm tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlei Sư kơdih, yua kơ rim năr pơdơh Sa'bat Sư juăt kơ akŭm ngăl. Lăp truh tơ ei Sư iung wă đŏk kơ đe sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And He was handed the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written
Bahnar: Đe ăn kơ Yêsu sơ̆p hla bơar Êsai, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei adrol sơ̆. Na Yêsu plơ̆ lăng sơ̆p hla bơar ei 'bơ̆t mă đei chih thoi âu

English: “The Spirit of the LORD is upon Me, Because He has anointed Me To preach the gospel to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, To proclaim liberty to the captives And recovery of sight to the blind, To set at liberty those who are oppressed
Bahnar: “Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai Inh. Sư rơih Inh wă năm bơtho ăn tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin păng pơlung lu bơngai ơh sơ'ngon. Sư wơh Inh roi tơdrong Sư wă tơlĕch lu bơngai đe phak, păng pơklaih lu bơngai măt tol. Sư wơh Inh pơklaih lu bơngai mă đe pơjuă pơđep

English: To proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD.”
Bahnar: păng roi kơ đe tơdrong Kră Yang wă pơklaih kon bơngai dang ei.”

English: Then He closed the book, and gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of all who were in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu đŏk lăng tơdrong noh đang boih na Sư đơ̆p lê̆ hla bơar noh pơdrĕo ăn kơ bơngai wei-lăng lăm hnam akŭm ei. Đơ̆ng noh Sư tơoei wă bơtho thoi đe noh juăt sơ̆, na đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơngai oei lăm hnam akŭm ei pơglăn lăng tơ Sư.

English: And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng ei Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Tơdrong mă Êsai khan lê̆ hơdrol noh sơ̆, năr âu boih iĕm 'bôh tơdrong noh truh tơpă.”

English: So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư lăp đon kơ Yêsu păng lu sư kư̆m sơleng kơ đon mơ̆n yua kơ Yêsu bơtho kơ lu sư 'bơ̆r đon hơgei tơpă. Na lu sư khan: “Bơngai âu kon Yôsep dah kiơ?”

English: He said to them, “You will surely say this proverb to Me, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm wă jô̆ kơ Inh tơdrong đe juăt kơ pơma thoi âu: ‘Ơ 'bok thây pơgang, pơklaih tơdrong jĭ ih kơdih 'mơ̆i, yua kơ pơlei âu pơlei Ih kơdih na Ih athei pơklaih đe tơ âu kư̆m thoi nhôn kơtơ̆ng ang Ih pơklaih đe tơ Pơlei Kapernum ki.’ ”

English: Then He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai pôm pơlei hăm bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư ưh kơ wă sơng iŏk sư ôh.

English: But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a great famine throughout all the land
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh roi pơtih gia kơ iĕm tơdrong noh: Kơplah Êli pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ dêh char Isơrael âu sơ̆, kơplah lăm pêng sơnăm ưh kơ đei 'mi jơ̆p kơ dêh char Isơrael. Na đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt tơpă. Kơplah noh sơ̆ đei lơ yă adro tơ dêh char Isơrael.

English: but to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wơh Êli năm tơgŭm lu sư ôh. Sư wơh Êli năm tơgŭm minh 'nu yă adro tơ Pơlei Sarepta lăm dêh char Siđôn đĕch, noh kư̆m dêh char tơmoi.

English: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, kơplah Êlisê pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ dêh char Isơrael âu sơ̆ đei lơ bơngai jĭ chin lăm dêh âu. Mă-lei Êlisê ưh kơ đei pơklaih lu sư ôh. Sư pơklaih pôm 'bok Naman, bơngai đơ̆ng dêh char Siri đĕch, sư dêh char tơmoi mơ̆n.”

English: So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai oei mơ̆ng lăm hnam akŭm ei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư hil areh kơ Yêsu tơpă.

English: and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff.
Bahnar: Lu sư gruih graih iung rôp hloi Yêsu anhăk tơlĕch Sư đơ̆ng pơlei ei năm tơ kông 'bơ̆t jê̆ pơlei sư ei wă hiŏng hơtat Sư đơ̆ng kơpal jih nak 'nei ră.

English: Then passing through the midst of them, He went His way.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu klĕnh hloi yak kiơ̆ tŏk-bŏk đe, lĕch jăk hloi tơ nai.

English: Then He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbaths.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Kapernum lăm dêh char Galilê ei mơ̆n. Na kơplah năr pơdơh Sa'bat Sư bơtho kon pơlei pơla tơ noh.

English: And they were astonished at His teaching, for His word was with authority.
Bahnar: Lu đe ei mơ̆ng mah chrêu kơ đon yua kơ dôm nơ̆r Sư bơtho gơh hơgei tơpă.

English: Now in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon. And he cried out with a loud voice
Bahnar: Lăm hnam akŭm ei đei minh 'nu bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t, na sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan

English: saying, “Let us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
Bahnar: “Êi, Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret, Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ khŭl nhôn? Inh băt mơ̆n Ih năm tơ âu wă pơrăm khŭl nhôn lah. Inh băt kơ Ih, Ih 'Bok 'Lơ̆ng Tơpăt đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him in their midst, it came out of him and did not hurt him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khă yang kơnê̆ ei thoi âu: “E 'nĕ pă pơma. E jah lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư âu wăi.” Na yang kơnê̆ ei hơloh glơ̆m bơngai yang mơ̆t ei 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl, na lĕch jăk hloi đơ̆ng bơngai ei. Na bơngai ei kư̆m huay kơ jĭ ôh.

English: Then they were all amazed and spoke among themselves, saying, “What a word this is! For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits, and they come out.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'bôh Sư pơm thoi noh, lu sư sơleng kơ đon na sư tơjet dih băl khan: “Thoi yơ bơngai âu pơma thoi noh đĕch ră mă-lei yang kơnê̆ mah lĕch hloi?”

English: And the report about Him went out into every place in the surrounding region.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Yêsu pơm thoi noh na đe kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong Sư jơ̆p kơ tơring sư kiơ̆ ei.

English: Now He arose from the synagogue and entered Simon’s house. But Simon’s wife’s mother was sick with a high fever, and they made request of Him concerning her.
Bahnar: Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm ei năm tơ hnam Simôn. Na tơnei Simôn bơlŏ kal dêh tơpă, na đe apinh Yêsu pơklaih sư.

English: So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and served them.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu năm tơ sư pơklaih hloi tơdrong jĭ sư 'nei. Na sư klaih hloi. Sư iung chă awih awăn kơ đe Yêsu.

English: When the sun was setting, all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr mơ̆t adrơ̆m kơsơ̆ ei, dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn, bôl buăl sư anhăk ba tơ Yêsu. Na Sư pel hloi kơ̆l lu đe ei păng đĭ kơ lu sư klaih hloi kơtă ei.

English: And demons also came out of many, crying out and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” And He, rebuking them, did not allow them to speak, for they knew that He was the Christ.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu kư̆m pơpuh lơ lu yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu đe. Na yang kơnê̆ ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Ih boih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.” Mă-lei Yêsu khă lu yang kơnê̆ ei kuă ăn pơma, yua kơ lu sư băt kơ Yêsu 'Bok Krist gô wă tơbăt ăn Sư kơ đe.

English: Now when it was day, He departed and went into a deserted place. And the crowd sought Him and came to Him, and tried to keep Him from leaving them
Bahnar: Lăp pơgê hrôih năr đơ̆ng rŏng na Yêsu lĕch hloi đơ̆ng pơlei ei năm tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆. Na lu kon pơlei pơla chă Sư. Lăp chă Sư 'bôh boih na lu sư khan hloi kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ih 'nĕ achăng lê̆ pơlei nhôn hŏ.”

English: but He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to the other cities also, because for this purpose I have been sent.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh athei chă bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r bơ̆n âu jơ̆p kơ pơlei nai mơ̆n. 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư wơh Inh wă kơ Inh jang thoi noh yơh.”

English: And He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu năm chă bơtho jơ̆p kơ hnam akŭm dêh char Galilê.

English: So it was, as the multitude pressed about Him to hear the word of God, that He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret
Bahnar: Minh năr ei Yêsu oei tơ jih đak dơsĭ Galilê mă đe kư̆m anăn dơsĭ Gênêsaret, na lu đe tơpôl hmĕt hmot Sư yua kơ wă mơ̆ng Sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and saw two boats standing by the lake; but the fishermen had gone from them and were washing their nets.
Bahnar: Na Sư 'bôh 'bar tŏ thŏng-nan tơ jih đak dơsĭ ei, na lu bơngai chă ka ei ưh pă đei hao thŏng-nan lu sư, yua kơ lu sư hăt kơ pih jal lu sư.

English: Then He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu apinh tŏk thŏng-nan Simôn ei, na Sư athei Simôn wơ̆r thŏng-nan ataih 'biơ̆ kơ đơ̆ng jih đak. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu tơoei bơtho lu đe tơpôl ei đơ̆ng thŏng-nan.

English: When He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho lu đe ei đang boih, na Sư khan kơ Simôn thoi âu: “Bĕ bơ̆n wơ̆r thŏng-nan bơ̆n tơ jrŭ 'biơ̆ wă traih jal.”

English: But Simon answered and said to Him, “Master, we have toiled all night and caught nothing; nevertheless at Your word I will let down the net.”
Bahnar: Na Simôn khan: “Ơ 'Bok, nhôn măng hei traih ră jal prăt măng hloi, mă-lei 'nhŏ kơ đei minh găr. Dah traih jal kơ'năr rai lŭch mă-lei dang ei yua kơ Ih athei na inh chu Ih mơ̆n.”

English: And when they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was breaking.
Bahnar: Truh tơ đak jrŭ boih na bre Simôn păng bôl sư traih hloi, ka puh jal bre sư lơ tơpă, na jal sư mah wă hiah hloi.

English: So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.
Bahnar: Na bre ei kuơch krao hloi 'bar 'nu bôl sư đêl hơdai sư thŏng-nan mă 'bar ei năm tơgŭm sư. Na bre sư năm hloi. Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư hiŏng atŏk hloi ka ei tuh tơ 'bar tŏ thŏng-nan ei, mlưi mah wă 'bĕnh tôm, thŏng-nan kư̆m mah wă krăm hloi.

English: When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord!”
Bahnar: Lăp Simôn mă đe kư̆m anăn Pêtrôs 'bôh Yêsu pơm tơdrong mơsêh thoi noh boih na sư hơloh 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu kơkuh kơ Sư khan hloi: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih weh đơ̆ng inh đĕch wăi, inh hli kơ Ih, yua kơ inh bơngai yoch.”

English: For he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken
Bahnar: Simôn pơma thoi noh yua kơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư sơleng kơ đon đơ̆ng lu sư rôp ka lơ dêh noh hei.

English: and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid. From now on you will catch men.”
Bahnar: Bôl mă jang hơdai sư ei kư̆m sơleng kơ đon mơ̆n. Anăn bre sư ei Yakơ păng Yôhan, kon Sêbêđê. Na Yêsu khan kơ Simôn: “Ih 'nĕ pă hli. Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp kơnh ih gô krao chă kon bơngai wă kơ sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: So when they had brought their boats to land, they forsook all and followed Him.
Bahnar: Na lu sư wơ̆r thŏng-nan ei truh tơ jih đak dơsĭ achăng lê̆ dôm tơmam sư ei, na kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: And it happened when He was in a certain city, that behold, a man who was full of leprosy saw Jesus; and he fell on his face and implored Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei Yêsu năm tơ pơlei đe tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai jĭ chin jơ̆p-jang kơ akâu sư. Lăp bơngai ei 'bôh Yêsu na sư drap hloi kơkuh kơ Sư păng apinh Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok, dah Ih wă, Ih gơh pơklaih inh.”

English: Then He put out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” Immediately the leprosy left him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu chro hloi ti pel bơngai ei păng khan: “Inh wă tơpă pơklaih ih, Inh pơklaih ih dang ei.” Na bơngai jĭ ei klaih kơtă hloi.

English: And He charged him to tell no one, “But go and show yourself to the priest, and make an offering for your cleansing, as a testimony to them, just as Moses commanded.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơkă kơ sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ chă roi kơ đe hŏ. Dang ei ih klaih boih na ih năm tơ'bôh akâu ih kơ 'bok soi păng soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ thoi Môis pơkă sơ̆ wă kơ đe băt tơdrong jĭ ih klaih tơpă boih.”

English: However, the report went around concerning Him all the more; and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by Him of their infirmities.
Bahnar: Yêsu kuă ăn kơ đe băt tơdrong Sư pơklaih bơngai noh hei ră, mă-lei đe kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong noh jơ̆p-jang hloi. Na đei lơ bơngai năm wă mơ̆ng Sư bơtho păng wă kơ Yêsu pơklaih jĭ jăn lu sư mơ̆n.

English: So He Himself often withdrew into the wilderness and prayed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei hơtai noh Yêsu wă năm krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ anih kueng, na Sư năm hloi.

English: Now it happened on a certain day, as He was teaching, that there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every town of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal them.
Bahnar: Minh năr ei Yêsu oei bơtho đe na đei lu bơngai Juđê mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê oei mơ̆ng Sư. Lu sư năm đơ̆ng rim pơlei lăm dêh Galilê păng lăm dêh Juđê păng đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem mơ̆n. Na Yêsu đei tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: Then behold, men brought on a bed a man who was paralyzed, whom they sought to bring in and lay before Him.
Bahnar: Na blư 'bôh đe tung ba minh 'nu bơngai hơwen hơwo kơpal anhŭn. Lu sư wă mơ̆t tơ hnam ei wă tơ'bĭch sư 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu ră

English: And when they could not find how they might bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the housetop and let him down with his bed through the tiling into the midst before Jesus.
Bahnar: mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t ôh yua kơ đei lơ bơngai dêh lăm hnam noh. Na lu sư tŏk tơ bơbŭng hnam, bơbŭng ei đe pơm păng găch. Na lu sư yuih tơklă Yêsu hloi, tơjur bơngai hơwen ei păng anhŭn 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu lăm lu bơngai tơpôl ei.

English: When He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu 'bôh lu sư đei đon lui thoi noh, na Sư khan kơ bơngai jĭ ei thoi âu: “Ơ ma, tơdrong yoch ih Inh pơklaih đĭ boih.”

English: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
Bahnar: Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi kơtơ̆ng Sư pơma thoi noh na lu sư mơmơnh lăm to khan: “Bơngai bu âu pơm pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dêh? Bu mă gơh pơklaih yoch bơ̆n? Pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch gơh pơklaih yoch bơ̆n.”

English: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answered and said to them, “Why are you reasoning in your hearts?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt hloi kơ lu sư pơma mơmơnh lăm to, jô̆ kơ Sư tơdrong noh na Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm pơma mơmơnh lăm to iĕm thoi noh lĕ?

English: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise up and walk’?
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo âu tơdrong yoch sư Inh pơklaih đĭ boih; tơdrong 'noh dah iĕm 'bôh Inh athei sư iung yak, na sư iung yak hloi, 'noh iĕm kư̆m băt kơ Inh gơh pơklaih yoch sư mơ̆n.

English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins”—He said to the man who was paralyzed, “I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh wă pơklaih jĭ sư, wă tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm băt kơ Inh Kon Bơngai gơh pơklaih tơdrong yoch kon bơngai ala teh âu.” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo ei thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ ih, dah iung bĕ, chĕp ba anhŭn ih brŏk tơ hnam.”

English: Immediately he rose up before them, took up what he had been lying on, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
Bahnar: Na bơngai hơwen hơwo ei iung hloi 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl, na chĕp ba anhŭn đêl đe tung sư ei wih hloi tơ hnam. Sư pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today!”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei kiơ̆ ei sơleng kơ đon tơpă na pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư kư̆m hli dêh na khan: “Bơ̆n 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch tơpă năr âu iih?”

English: After these things He went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu lĕch yak ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng ei, na Sư 'bôh Lêwi oei jang 'bơ̆t hnam thuê̆. Na Yêsu pơtơm sư khan: “Bĕ kiơ̆ Inh.”

English: So he left all, rose up, and followed Him.
Bahnar: Na Lêwi ei gruih iung kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu, achăng tŭk pơđĭ tơmam sư 'bơ̆t ei.

English: Then Levi gave Him a great feast in his own house. And there were a great number of tax collectors and others who sat down with them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Lêwi pơtơm Yêsu sŏng sa tih lăm hnam sư. Na đei lơ bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ păng lu bơngai nai sŏng sa hơdai păng sư mơ̆n.

English: And their scribes and the Pharisees complained against His disciples, saying, “Why do You eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu thoi âu: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm sŏng sa hơdai hăm lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ păng lu bơngai pơm yoch?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lu bơngai mă liĕm akâu ưh kơ kăl kơ 'bok pơgang ôh. Pôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn đĕch kăl kơ 'bok pơgang.

English: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
Bahnar: Inh jur tơ âu ưh kơ sĭ kơ Inh wơ̆n chă lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng wă tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch ôh. Inh jur tơ âu wă wơ̆n chă lu bơngai yoch wă kơ sư tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch sư.”

English: Then they said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and likewise those of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?”
Bahnar: Đe apinh Yêsu thoi âu: “Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan pơrơ̆ng ơ̆t kơ por wă krao khan ling-lang păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi kư̆m pơm thoi noh mơ̆n, mă-lei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih oei sa et đĕch, ưh kơ ơ̆t kơ por ôh.”

English: And He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Kơplah đe pơkong kơ bơngai mă iŏk akăn, lu bôl bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh, lu sư ưh kơ đei bu ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ por ôh.

English: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast in those days.”
Bahnar: Pôm ning-mônh đĕch, lăp đe rôp anhăk bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh đơ̆ng bôl sư, 'bơ̆t ei kơnh trŏ kơ lu bôl sư ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ por.”

English: Then He spoke a parable to them: “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old one; otherwise the new makes a tear, and also the piece that was taken out of the new does not match the old.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia gah tơdrong đêl lu sư jet noh hei thoi âu: “Kơbĭ bu 'maih hek che ao 'nao wă sĭt pơklĕp tơ ao so. Tơ̆ng đe pơm thoi noh lei sư pơrăm ao 'nao păng che 'nao mă đêl sư sĭt pơklĕp hăm che so noh ưh kơ layơ lei-lăi băl ôh.

English: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n kơbĭ bu 'maih tring sik 'nao 'băt kơtang mong tơ kơdŭng akar so. Tơ̆ng đe tring thoi ei, pă jor kơdŭng akar so 'noh gô pơchah, na sik gô lĕch hiong, kơdŭng kư̆m gô pơchah răm.

English: But new wine must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bu wă tring sư athei tring mong sik 'nao tơ kơdŭng akar 'nao, yua kơ kơdŭng akar 'nao 'noh kơjăp.

English: And no one, having drunk old wine, immediately desires new; for he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'maih et sik so, sư kuă kơ et sik 'nao, yua kơ sư đêl juăt kơ et sik so khan 'lơ̆ng hloh.”

English: Now it happened on the second Sabbath after the first that He went through the grainfields. And His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate them, rubbing them in their hands.
Bahnar: Lăp năr pơdơh Sa'bat ei, Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư drong mơ̆t tơ mir, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư broch găr 'ba kăp sa ngôi.

English: And some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi 'bôh thoi noh na khan: “Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm pơm ưh kơ trŏ lăm năr pơdơh lĕ khan jang?”

English: But Jesus answering them said, “Have you not even read this, what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm tam biơh đŏk lăng lăm hla bơar tơdrong pơtao Đawit ôh hă? Sơ̆ sư kư̆m hơdai pơm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt mơ̆n, sư păng bôl sư pơngot ưh kơ đei tơmam sa.

English: how he went into the house of God, took and ate the showbread, and also gave some to those with him, which is not lawful for any but the priests to eat?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đawit sư ưh kơ pơm 'bok soi ră mă-lei sư gơh iŏk sa 'bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. 'Bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei noh pôm lu 'bok soi đĕch gơh sa, mă-lei Đawit sư iŏk asong kơ lu bôl sư sa mơ̆n.”

English: And He said to them, “The Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai Pharisi: “Inh Kon Bơngai, Inh boih yŏng pơgơ̆r kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat.”

English: Now it happened on another Sabbath, also, that He entered the synagogue and taught. And a man was there whose right hand was withered.
Bahnar: Minh năr pơdơh Sa'bat nai dơ̆ng Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei bơtho đe. Na đei minh 'nu bơngai ti kue gah 'ma oei lăm ei mơ̆n.

English: So the scribes and Pharisees watched Him closely, whether He would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against Him.
Bahnar: Na lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu bơngai Pharisi răp lăng Yêsu hăm ming pơklaih sư dah ưh kơplah lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat. Dah sư pơklaih bơngai ti kue noh lei lu sư wă jô̆ kơ Yêsu bơngai yoch yua kơ lu sư khan lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ưh kơ gơh jang păng ưh kơ gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn ôh.

English: But He knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Arise and stand here.” And he arose and stood.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu băt hloi kơ lu sư tơchĕng lăm to thoi noh na Sư khan kơ bơngai ti kue ei: “Năm tơ âu bĕ, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl.” Na bơngai kue ei iung hloi năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu đe ei thoi âu: “Inh wă jet iĕm, lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n athei pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng dah tơdrong kơnê̆, tơgŭm mơnat kon bơngai dah pơlôch bơngai?”

English: And when He had looked around at them all, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he did so, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
Bahnar: Yêsu hue lăng đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư, khan hloi kơ bơngai ti kue ei thoi âu: “Chro ti ih bĕ.” Na bơngai kue ei chro ti sư, na klaih 'lơ̆ng hloi.

English: But they were filled with rage, and discussed with one another what they might do to Jesus.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok thây păng lu bơngai Pharisi ei areh tơpă kơ Yêsu păng pơđâu chă tơdrong wă pơm kơ Yêsu.

English: Now it came to pass in those days that He went out to the mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei Yêsu tŏk tơ groi kông wă krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư krao khan tơ noh prăt măng hloi.

English: And when it was day, He called His disciples to Himself; and from them He chose twelve whom He also named apostles
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr boih na Yêsu krao lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Sư na Sư rơih iŏk mơjĭt-'bar 'nu. Sư anăn lu mơjĭt-'bar 'nu noh jơ̆ng 'bang Sư.

English: Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew
Bahnar: Na âu jô̆ tôm lu anăn mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lu sư: Simôn, mă Yêsu anăn Pêtrôs; oh sư Andrê; Yakơ, Yôhan, Philip, 'Barthôlêmi

English: Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot
Bahnar: Mathiơ, Thôm, Yakơ kon Alphê, Simôn mă kiơ̆ khŭl đe Sêlôt sơ̆

English: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot who also became a traitor.
Bahnar: Juđa kon Yakơ bơngai nai păng Juđa Ikariôt, bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu.

English: And He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases
Bahnar: Yêsu đơ̆ng groi kông ei jur tơ teh dơhnă hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư. Na kư̆m đei lơ bơngai nai mă lui kiơ̆ Sư oei tơ ei mơ̆n. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai nai năm tơ ei đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh Juđê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ'nah đơ̆ng Pơlei Tirơ păng Pơlei Siđôn mă oei kiơ̆ jih đak dơsĭ. Lu đe ei năm tơ Sư wă mơ̆ng Sư bơtho păng kư̆m wă kơ Yêsu chă pơklaih tơdrong jĭ jăn lu sư hloi.

English: as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơmat-tat yua kơ yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t, Yêsu kư̆m pơklaih ăn mơ̆n.

English: And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu đe ei mă năm tơ Yêsu wă 'maih pel Sư yua kơ mưh pel 'bơm akâu Yêsu na mă jĭ kiơ kiơ kư̆m klaih ngăl, yua đơ̆ng tơdrong mơsêh Sư.

English: Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: “Blessed are you poor, For yours is the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu hue lăng lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ Sư na khan: “Pŭn dêh lu iĕm bơngai dơnuh hin, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm.

English: Blessed are you who hunger now, For you shall be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, For you shall laugh.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu iĕm mă pơngot rơwĕt dang ei, iĕm gô phĭ jơnap. Pŭn dêh lu iĕm mă nhơ̆m hmoi dang ei, iĕm gô hiĕk, gô chơt.

English: Blessed are you when men hate you, And when they exclude you, And revile you, and cast out your name as evil, For the Son of Man’s sake.
Bahnar: “Hiôk bĕ lu iĕm mă đe areh arĕnh, pơm kuă kơ iĕm, pơjăm pơjuă iĕm, khan iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh Kon Bơngai.

English: Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! For indeed your reward is great in heaven, For in like manner their fathers did to the prophets.
Bahnar: Mưh đe pơm thoi noh iĕm rai hiôk 'nă hal bĕ, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah iĕm lơ tơpă tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng ning-mônh. Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n lu 'bok lu sư sơ̆ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei adrol sơ̆.

English: “But woe to you who are rich, For you have received your consolation.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei lu iĕm mă mơdrŏng dang ei, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh. Lu iĕm hiôk dang ei đĕch, ning-mônh iĕm ưh pă hiôk boih.

English: Woe to you who are full, For you shall hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, For you shall mourn and weep.
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm mă phĭ jơnap dang ei, ning-mônh iĕm kư̆m pơmat-tat mơ̆n yua kơ tơmam sa ưh kơ đei. “Lu iĕm mă 'nă hal dang ei, ning-mônh iĕm gô nhơ̆m hmoi pơmat-tat mơ̆n.

English: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, For so did their fathers to the false prophets.
Bahnar: “Dah đĭ-đăng bơngai khan iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng, lei ning-mônh iĕm kư̆m pơmat mơ̆n. Lu bơngai đe anăn bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, mă-lei sư chă hơlĕnh đĕch, lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆ kư̆m khan sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.”

English: “But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you
Bahnar: Yêsu oei bơtho lu sư thoi âu: “Na Inh pơma kơ iĕm mă mơ̆ng Inh: Iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă areh kơ iĕm.

English: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you.
Bahnar: Pơma rơngơp kơ lu bơngai mă hiap iĕm, krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu bơngai hil kơ iĕm.

English: To him who strikes you on the one cheek, offer the other also. And from him who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic either.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng đe tap 'bŏ iĕm gah 'ma, iĕm athei ăn hloi gah 'ngiĕo. Tơ̆ng đe iŏk ao iĕm minh blah, iĕm athei ăn hloi 'bar blah.

English: Give to everyone who asks of you. And from him who takes away your goods do not ask them back.
Bahnar: Bu apinh tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng iĕm, iĕm athei asong hloi. Tơ̆ng đe iŏk tơmam iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ pă pơdrĕo.

English: And just as you want men to do to you, you also do to them likewise.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n wă kơ đe pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ bơ̆n dang yơ, bơ̆n athei pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe dang ei mơ̆n.

English: “But if you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
Bahnar: “Dah iĕm 'mêm pôm lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ iĕm đĕch, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon ôh. Bĭ lu bơngai yoch kư̆m băt băi 'mêm kơ bơngai mă 'mêm kơ sư mơ̆n.

English: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ iĕm đĕch, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon ôh. Bĭ lu bơngai yoch kư̆m băt băi pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ sư mơ̆n.

English: And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive back, what credit is that to you? For even sinners lend to sinners to receive as much back.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong ăn kơ đe mơng jên iĕm, dah iĕm ăn kơ pôm lu bơngai mă iĕm băt sư gô pơdrĕo kơ iĕm tơpă đĕch, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon ôh. Lu bơngai yoch, dah sư băt kơ tơduă lu sư bơngai yoch gô pơdrĕo tơpă, lei sư kư̆m ăn kơ lu bôl sư mơng jên sư mơ̆n.

English: But love your enemies, do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High. For He is kind to the unthankful and evil.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei 'mêm, pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm. Iĕm athei ăn kơ đe mơng jên iĕm păng 'nĕ pă hơmĕng kơ jên noh. Tơ̆ng iĕm pơm thoi noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah iĕm tih tơpă păng iĕm jing kon Kră Yang Tih Hloh, yua kơ Sư kư̆m pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ păng lu bơngai mă ưh kơ băt bơnê kơ Sư mơ̆n.

English: Therefore be merciful, just as your Father also is merciful.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat kơ đe kư̆m thoi lĕ 'Bă bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ đe mơ̆n.

English: “Judge not, and you shall not be judged. Condemn not, and you shall not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ bâu roi đe, khan đe bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Dah iĕm jô̆ kơ đe bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, kơnh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m jô̆ kơ iĕm bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ jâu đe, na 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jâu iĕm. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ jô̆ yo kơ đe wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ iĕm.

English: Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will be put into your bosom. For with the same measure that you use, it will be measured back to you.”
Bahnar: Iĕm athei mơnat, tơgŭm đe, na 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat tơgŭm iĕm mơ̆n. Sư gô tơgŭm iĕm lơ tơpă kư̆m dang lĕ đe ăn đĕch kơ iĕm minh kơ'mŭng 'ba 'bĕnh blai rơkah rơkai. Iĕm tơgŭm đe dang yơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm iĕm dang noh mơ̆n.”

English: And He spoke a parable to them: “Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into the ditch?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu pơma minh tơdrong pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Bơngai măt tol ưh kơ gơh chông ba bôl sư măt tol ôh, hli kơ bre sư nơnăm gô huŏng tơ sơlŭng.

English: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is perfectly trained will be like his teacher.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă pơhrăm ưh kơ lah layơ pơm tih hloh kơ bơngai mă bơtho sư. Mă-lei dah sư adrin pơhrăm truh tôch na sư kư̆m dang ăi kơ bơngai mă bơtho sư mơ̆n.

English: And why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not perceive the plank in your own eye?
Bahnar: “Lơliơ iĕm jô̆ kơ đe đei tơdrong yoch mă iĕm đei tơdrong yoch tih hloh kơ đe dơ̆ng, dang iĕm 'bôh 'bruih iĕ đom lăm klong măt 'nhŏng oh iĕm, mă iĕm ưh kơ mơn kơ 'long tih oei đom lăm klong măt iĕm kơdih?

English: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the plank that is in your own eye? Hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye.
Bahnar: Lơliơ iĕm pơ̆n khan kơ 'nhŏng oh iĕm khan: Lê̆ inh iŏk 'bruih đom lăm klong măt ih, lăm klong măt iĕm kơdih 'long tih oei đom ră mă-lei kơdih iĕm ưh kơ mơn? Ơ bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, iĕm iŏk tŭk 'long tih đom lăm klong măt iĕm 'mơ̆i wăi, na iĕm gơh 'bôh hơdah iŏk tŭk 'bruih iĕ đom lăm klong măt 'nhŏng oh iĕm.

English: “For a good tree does not bear bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.
