Bahnar: “'Long 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ layơ pơjing plei kơnê̆. 'Long kơnê̆ ưh kơ layơ pơjing plei 'lơ̆ng.

English: For every tree is known by its own fruit. For men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.
Bahnar: Lăng plei băt kơ tơm. Bơ̆n ưh kơ lah layơ wă năm phĕ plei hơra khan năm chă tơ tơm 'long jơla. Bơ̆n ưh kơ lah layơ wă năm phĕ plei hơmu khan năm chă tơ tơm 'long bơmrôm.

English: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m đon 'lơ̆ng, sư kư̆m pơm 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n. Bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m đon kơnê̆, sư kư̆m pơm kơnê̆ mơ̆n. Lăm jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n thoi yơ, bơ̆n kư̆m gô pơma thoi ei.

English: “But why do you call Me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and not do the things which I say?
Bahnar: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm krao Inh Yŏng iĕm, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ pơm kiơ̆ kơ đon Inh bơtho?

English: Whoever comes to Me, and hears My sayings and does them, I will show you whom he is like
Bahnar: Bơngai bu năm tơ Inh wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh bơtho, na sư pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Inh pơkă

English: He is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on the rock. And when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently against that house, and could not shake it, for it was founded on the rock.
Bahnar: sư noh thoi lĕ kơ bơngai sir jrăng hnam jrŭ pơm hnam tơ kơpal tơmo kŭk. Na lăp đak krong tih blŭng hnam noh ră, mă-lei hnam noh oei kơjăp, na sư ưh kơ kĕ adrŏ ôh, yua kơ sư pơm kơpal tơmo kơjăp tơpă.

English: But he who heard and did nothing is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream beat vehemently; and immediately it fell. And the ruin of that house was great.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh bơtho, mă-lei ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ thoi Inh bơtho, bơngai noh thoi bơngai pơm hnam kơpal teh pŭk đĕch. Na lăp đak krong tih blŭng pŭng hơlŭng pơchah hoch đĭ.”

English: Now when He concluded all His sayings in the hearing of the people, He entered Capernaum.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho kơ lu kon pơlei pơla đang boih, na Sư năm dơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Kapernum.

English: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and ready to die.
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei ei đei minh 'nu 'bok tih linh, sư bơngai Rôm, đei minh 'nu đĭch sư kơeng bơlŏ wă lôch dĕng dĕng.

English: So when he heard about Jesus, he sent elders of the Jews to Him, pleading with Him to come and heal his servant.
Bahnar: Lăp 'bok tih linh kơtơ̆ng ang Yêsu gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn na sư wơh lu kră pơlei đe Juđê năm krao Yêsu năm tơ sư wă pơklaih jĭ đĭch sư.

English: And when they came to Jesus, they begged Him earnestly, saying that the one for whom He should do this was deserving
Bahnar: Lu sư năm truh tơ Yêsu, lung Yêsu khan: “Apinh Ih khŏm năm pơklaih đĭch 'bok tih linh noh 'biơ̆, yua kơ sư 'mêm tơgŭm kơ lu khŭl Juđê bơ̆n mơ̆n, na sư mah pơm ăn kơ nhôn minh pôm hnam akŭm.”

English: “for he loves our nation, and has built us a synagogue.”
Bahnar: Lu sư năm truh tơ Yêsu, lung Yêsu khan: “Apinh Ih khŏm năm pơklaih đĭch 'bok tih linh noh 'biơ̆, yua kơ sư 'mêm tơgŭm kơ lu khŭl Juđê bơ̆n mơ̆n, na sư mah pơm ăn kơ nhôn minh pôm hnam akŭm.”

English: Then Jesus went with them. And when He was already not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself, for I am not worthy that You should enter under my roof.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu năm kiơ̆ hloi lu đe ei. Lăp lu sư năm wă jê̆ truh tơ hnam 'bok tih linh ei, tơ'bơ̆p hĭ lu bơngai đơ̆ng 'bok tih linh ei wơh na khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, yŏng nhôn khan Ih huay kơ mah năm truh tơ hnam sư ôh. Sư khan sư ưh kơ hơnhŏ wă tơmơ̆t Ih tơ hnam sư.

English: Therefore I did not even think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.
Bahnar: Păng sư kư̆m khan sư ưh kơ hơnhŏ wă năm tơ'bơ̆p Ih tơ âu ôh. Sư wă kơ Ih sơkat đơ̆ng âu đĕch na đĭch sư tơ hnam kư̆m klaih mơ̆n.

English: For I also am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
Bahnar: Sư khan sư kư̆m đei đe pơgơ̆r sư păng sư kư̆m đei pơgơ̆r lu linh mơ̆n. Dah sư khan kơ bơngai âu, mă bơngai to: Năm bĕ, đe năm hloi chu sư. Dah sư bơtho lu đĭch sư jang, mă dôm tơdrong kiơ kiơ, lu sư jang hloi. Na sư kư̆m wă kơ Ih pơm thoi noh mơ̆n. Sư wă kơ Ih sơkat đơ̆ng âu đĕch na đĭch sư tơ hnam kư̆m gô klaih mơ̆n.”

English: When Jesus heard these things, He marveled at him, and turned around and said to the crowd that followed Him, “I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel!”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng sư khan thoi noh, Sư mah hlĭch kơ đon, yua 'bok noh đei đon lui tơpă. Na Sư hue tơ rŏng khan kơ lu bơngai tơpôl mă kiơ̆ Sư ei thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đơ̆ng sơ̆ Inh tam mă 'bôh ôh khŭl bơngai Juđê lui kơjăp dang bơngai Rôm âu.”

English: And those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant well who had been sick.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu bơngai mă đơ̆ng 'bok tih linh athei năm đih Yêsu ei wih hĭ tơ hnam. Lăp truh tơ hnam 'bôh đĭch mă đêl jĭ hei klaih hloi.

English: Now it happened, the day after, that He went into a city called Nain; and many of His disciples went with Him, and a large crowd.
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh, Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Nain, kư̆m đei lơ kon pơlei pơla đơ̆ng nai păng kư̆m đei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: And when He came near the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was being carried out, the only son of his mother; and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the city was with her.
Bahnar: Lăp Sư wă jê̆ truh tơ 'măng jang Pơlei Nain, Sư tơ'bơ̆p hĭ đe tung bơngai lôch. Bơngai ei sư kon pôm yă adro. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ năm 'bŭ bơngai ei.

English: When the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not weep.”
Bahnar: Lăp Kră Yang Yêsu 'bôh mĕ sư ei, 'brơ̆k mơnat, na Sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ pă hmoi.”

English: Then He came and touched the open coffin, and those who carried him stood still. And He said, “Young man, I say to you, arise.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu hơloh năm pel hơbang, na lu bơngai tung hơbang 'nei dơ̆ng. Yêsu khan kơ bơngai lôch 'nei khan: “Ơ dăm, iung bĕ ih.”

English: So he who was dead sat up and began to speak. And He presented him to his mother.
Bahnar: Gruih sư iung tơoei păng pơma. Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu pơjao ăn kơ mĕ sư.

English: Then fear came upon all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has risen up among us”; and, “God has visited His people.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ ei hli ngăl, na lu sư ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh tơpă năm tơ bơ̆n boih.” Lu sư kư̆m khan dơ̆ng: “Dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơgŭm lu bơngai Isơrael tơpă.”

English: And this report about Him went throughout all Judea and all the surrounding region.
Bahnar: Đe ră roi tơdrong Yêsu tơiung arih bơngai ei đơ̆ng lôch jơ̆p kơ dêh Juđê păng kiơ̆ dêh tơmoi hai.

English: Then the disciples of John reported to him concerning all these things.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan, sư roi kơ Yôhan dôm tơdrong mơsêh mă Yêsu 'nao pơm noh.

English: And John, calling two of his disciples to him, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yôhan krao 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng sư, wơh bre sư năm tơ Kră Yang Yêsu wă jet Sư thoi âu: “Ih hăm trŏ kơ 'Bok Krist mă Yôhan khan gô truh, dah nhôn oei gô bơngai nai dơ̆ng?”

English: When the men had come to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?’ ”
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư truh tơ Yêsu na bre sư khan thoi âu: “Yôhan mă pơm 'batem wơh nhi jet Ih: ‘Ih hăm trŏ 'Bok Krist mă sư khan gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư, dah nhôn oei gô bơngai nai dơ̆ng?’ ”

English: And that very hour He cured many of infirmities, afflictions, and evil spirits; and to many blind He gave sight.
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư oei tơ noh, Yêsu pơklaih lơ bơngai jĭ jăn, thoi lĕ pơpuh yang kơnê̆, pơklaih măt tol gơh 'bôh.

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and tell John the things you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have the gospel preached to them.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng noh Yêsu khan kơ bre sư: “Biĕm wih roi kơ Yôhan tơdrong mă biĕm kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng Inh bơtho, hăm biĕm 'bôh noh bĕ: Lu măt tol gơh 'bôh hơdah, lu jơ̆ng kue mah gơh yak, lu jĭ chin mah klaih, lu klĭk jing hơbăng, lu bơngai lôch mah gơh iung arih, lu bơngai dơnuh hin mah mơ̆ng Inh bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng.

English: And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă lui kơ Inh khŏm khŏm ưh kơ achăng lê̆ Inh, lu sư hiôk dêh.”

English: When the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the multitudes concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan wih boih, na Yêsu pơma kơ tơpôl đe ei gah tơdrong Yôhan: “Iĕm năm tơ Yôhan tơ char glă sơ̆, iĕm chă kiơ? Ưh kơ sĭ iĕm năm chă bơngai ngĭl ngŭl tơchĕng đon 'bar pah thoi lĕ hla kial thu wơ̆t lăk ôh.

English: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Indeed those who are gorgeously appareled and live in luxury are in kings’ courts.
Bahnar: Lei iĕm chă kiơ? Dah iĕm năm lăng bơngai hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng? Tơ̆ng iĕm wă lăng bơngai hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng jơnap jơnoi, lei sư oei tơ hnam 'bok pơtao.

English: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
Bahnar: Lei iĕm chă kiơ? Iĕm năm chă bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm trŏ? Trŏ boih iĕm năm chă bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Yôhan boih sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: This is he of whom it is written: ‘Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, Who will prepare Your way before You.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Yôhan boih na đe mah chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Âu Inh wơh minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Inh hơdrol, wă kơ sư hơmet trong kơ Ih.’

English: For I say to you, among those born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Yôhan sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai mơ̆n, mă-lei bơngai bu iĕ hloh kơ đe lăm chăl 'nao mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r dang ei, sư kư̆m hlôh wao tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei nhên hloh kơ Yôhan dơ̆ng.”

English: And when all the people heard Him, even the tax collectors justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla păng lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ mơ̆ng Yôhan bơtho sơ̆, lu sư khan 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, na lu sư wă kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei bơtho, đơ̆ng noh Yôhan pơm 'batem kơ lu sư hloi.

English: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the will of God for themselves, not having been baptized by him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei bơtho, na lu sư kuă kơ iŏk 'batem ôh.

English: And the Lord said, “To what then shall I liken the men of this generation, and what are they like?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ahrei âu phara dêh na Inh wă pơtih gia tơdrong sư thoi yơ?

English: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling to one another, saying: ‘We played the flute for you, And you did not dance; We mourned to you, And you did not weep.’
Bahnar: Lu sư dang lĕ hơ'lơ̆p pơchơt ngôi tơ kơchơ, lu sư đei 'bar khŭl. Minh khŭl pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ bôl sư khan: ‘Nhôn hlôm tơgiĕp wă kơ tơdrong chơt, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ suang pơrŏ. Nhôn hơri tơdrong đe lôch, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ nhơ̆m hmoi.’

English: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
Bahnar: Na tơdrong iĕm kuă kơ nhi Yôhan kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Sơ̆ Yôhan ơ̆t kơ por, ưh kơ et sik, na iĕm kư̆m jô̆ kơ sư khan wơnh.

English: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look, a glutton and a winebibber, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
Bahnar: Na gah Inh Kon Bơngai âu jur tơ teh âu, sŏng sa hơdai lu sư, na iĕm kư̆m jô̆ kơ Inh khan bơngai sa bơlŭk, et dư, tơbôl hăm bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆, lu bơngai yoch mơ̆n.

English: But wisdom is justified by all her children.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm trŏ ngăl.”

English: Then one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. And He went to the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to eat.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai Pharisi wơ̆n Yêsu năm sŏng sa tơ hnam sư. Na Yêsu năm tơ ei sa hơdai sư.

English: And behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at the table in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster flask of fragrant oil
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei ei đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn juăt kơ pơm yoch. Sư kơtơ̆ng khan Yêsu oei sŏng sa păng bơngai Pharisi ei, na sư iŏk minh gŏl đak pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: and stood at His feet behind Him weeping; and she began to wash His feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head; and she kissed His feet and anointed them with the fragrant oil.
Bahnar: Na sư năm nhơ̆m 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu, đak măt sư kơtoh tơ jơ̆ng Yêsu. Đơ̆ng noh na sư sut jơ̆ng Yêsu păng sŏk sư kơdih, na chŭm hloi jơ̆ng Yêsu. Đơ̆ng ei na sư tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu kơ jơ̆ng Yêsu.

English: Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this, he spoke to himself, saying, “This Man, if He were a prophet, would know who and what manner of woman this is who is touching Him, for she is a sinner.”
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai Pharisi mă wơ̆n Sư, 'bôh thoi noh na sư tơchĕng lăm to sư kơdih khan: “Tơ̆ng bơngai âu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, lei Sư băt kơ bơngai mă pel Sư 'noh bơngai đi.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” So he said, “Teacher, say it.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan hloi kơ sư: “Ơ Simôn, Inh wă khan kơ ih.” Na Simôn tơl: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih wă khan kiơ kơ inh?”

English: “There was a certain creditor who had two debtors. One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Sơ̆ đei minh 'nu bơngai đei 'bar 'nu hre kơ sư jên. Minh 'nu ei hre kơ sư kiơ̆ kơ jên so sơ̆ pơđăm-hrĕng, gah minh 'nu dơ̆ng hre kơ sư pơđăm-jĭt đĕch.

English: And when they had nothing with which to repay, he freely forgave them both. Tell Me, therefore, which of them will love him more?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tôm kơ bre sư ưh kơ đei jên 'mong ngăl. Yua kơ thoi noh na mă 'bok tơm jên ei pơklaih kơ bre sư đĕch. Thoi noh na 'bar 'nu bre noh, ayơ mă hiôk hloh yua kơ tơ'ngla jên pơklaih hre?”

English: Simon answered and said, “I suppose the one whom he forgave more.” And He said to him, “You have rightly judged.”
Bahnar: Simôn khan: “Rŏ lăng bơngai mă hre lơ 'biơ̆, sư hiôk hloh.” Yêsu khan: “Ih tơl trŏ boih.”

English: Then He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house; you gave Me no water for My feet, but she has washed My feet with her tears and wiped them with the hair of her head.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu hue tơ bơngai drŏ-kăn noh khan hloi kơ Simôn: “Ih lăng bơngai drŏ-kăn âu. Lăp Inh mơ̆t tơ hnam ih, ih ưh kơ ăn kơ Inh đak wă ôp jơ̆ng Inh ôh, mă-lei sư âu ôp jơ̆ng Inh păng đak măt sư păng sut pơhrĕng păng sŏk sư kơdih.

English: You gave Me no kiss, but this woman has not ceased to kiss My feet since the time I came in.
Bahnar: Lăp ba tơ'bơ̆p hei, ih ưh kơ đei chŭm 'mêm kơ Inh thoi bơ̆n juăt kơ pơm ôh, mă-lei sư âu oei chŭm jơ̆ng Inh khŏm khŏm.

English: You did not anoint My head with oil, but this woman has anointed My feet with fragrant oil.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m ưh kơ pik đak yâu tơ kơ̆l Inh wă pơhiôk Inh ôh, mă-lei sư âu tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu tơ jơ̆ng Inh.

English: Therefore I say to you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh khan kơ ih tơpă, dôm tơdrong yoch sư lơ ră, mă-lei Inh mơnat ăn boih. Thoi noh na sư 'mêm kơ Inh tơpă. Mă-lei bơngai bu ưh kơ gan wă apinh Inh pơklaih tơdrong yoch sư, bơngai noh ưh kơ gan 'mêm kơ Inh dêh ôh.”

English: Then He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn ei dơ̆ng: “Tơdrong yoch ih Inh tŭk lê̆ boih.”

English: And those who sat at the table with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai sŏng sa hơdai Yêsu tơ ei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na lu sư mơmơnh lăm to khan: “'Nâu bơngai bu khan gơh pơklaih yoch đe?”

English: Now it came to pass, afterward, that He went through every city and village, preaching and bringing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God. And the twelve were with Him
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm tơ lơ pơlei chă bơtho đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai. Lu mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kư̆m năm kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities—Mary called Magdalene, out of whom had come seven demons
Bahnar: Na kư̆m đei lu drŏ-kăn năm hơdai lu sư mơ̆n. Lu drŏ-kăn noh sơ̆ đơ̆ng đêl Yêsu pơklaih lơ tơdrong jĭ lu sư, kư̆m đei pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lu sư mơ̆n. Lu đe noh anăn lu sư: Mari đơ̆ng Pơlei Mađơla. Bơngai noh sơ̆ Yêsu pơpuh tơpơh tŏ yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng sư.

English: and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others who provided for Him from their substance.
Bahnar: Yă Jôanna akăn Chusa. Chusa noh sư wei-lăng tơmam pơtao Hêrôt. Yă Susana păng kư̆m đei lơ drŏ-kăn nai dơ̆ng kiơ̆ hơdai Yêsu. Lu sư tơgŭm Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư bơ̆n tơmam, bơ̆n jên.

English: And when a great multitude had gathered, and they had come to Him from every city, He spoke by a parable
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai năm tơ Yêsu đơ̆ng jơ̆p pơlei na Sư pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu

English: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside; and it was trampled down, and the birds of the air devoured it.
Bahnar: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm rei adrĕch 'ba. Lăp sư rei, đei găr mơ'nah huŏng tơ trong, na đe juă 'bơm, sem kư̆m jur sa.

English: Some fell on rock; and as soon as it sprang up, it withered away because it lacked moisture.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei găr mơ'nah huŏng tơ kơpal tơmo trêl ưh kơ gan đei teh lơ. Sư chăt mơ̆n ră mă-lei sư jing jô yua kơ teh đơng ưh kơ jrŭ.

English: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up with it and choked it.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng 'bơ̆t 'nhĕt jơla na 'nhĕt jơla chăt wơ̆ hơdai sư krênh lê̆ sư hloi.

English: But others fell on good ground, sprang up, and yielded a crop a hundredfold.” When He had said these things He cried, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng tơ teh 'lơ̆ng, na sư chăt wơ̆ truh tơ đei plei trem minh-hrĕng găr.” Na Yêsu pơma re 'biơ̆ dơ̆ng khan: “Bu đei đon athei tơchĕng kơdih bĕ.”

English: Then His disciples asked Him, saying, “What does this parable mean?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jet Sư khan: “Tơdrong mă Ih pơtih gia noh hei wă khan kiơ?”

English: And He said, “To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest it is given in parables, that ‘Seeing they may not see, And hearing they may not understand.’
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm băt gah tơdrong Sư wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi yơ, mă-lei Inh bơtho lu bơngai nai tơdrong noh Inh yua nơ̆r pơjuang ngăl, wă kơ sư lăng khŏm khŏm ră mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong kiơ, wă kơ sư mơ̆ng khŏm khŏm ră mă-lei ưh kơ hlôh.”

English: “Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Tơdrong rei 'ba noh hei wă khan thoi âu: 'Ba noh wă pơtih gia kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Those by the wayside are the ones who hear; then the devil comes and takes away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
Bahnar: Pơtih gia găr mă huŏng tơ trong noh hei wă khan lu bơngai mă mơ̆ng ră mă-lei yang kơnê̆ Satan dang lĕ iŏk nơ̆r noh đơ̆ng lu sư wă kơ lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na ưh kơ klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: But the ones on the rock are those who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a while and in time of temptation fall away.
Bahnar: Lu găr mă huŏng tơ kơpal tơmo trêl wă pơtih gia kơ lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư hưch hanh păng iŏk hloi mơ̆n. Kư̆m đei ră tơnơm 'ba mă-lei rơh sư chăt ưh kơ jrŭ, sư jing jô lôch hloi, 'noh wă khan lu sư đei ră đon lui mă-lei ưh kơ đunh lăp đei tơdrong pơlong lăng lu sư jing achăng lê̆.

English: Now the ones that fell among thorns are those who, when they have heard, go out and are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.
Bahnar: Lu găr mă huŏng 'bơ̆t 'nhĕt jơla wă pơtih gia kơ lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei ră, mă-lei lu sư wă tơchĕng tơdrong arih sư kăl hloh, sư wă kơ mơdrŏng, hiôk jơnap tơ ala teh đĕch. Thoi noh na sư jing ưh kơ plei.

English: But the ones that fell on the good ground are those who, having heard the word with a noble and good heart, keep it and bear fruit with patience.
Bahnar: Lu găr mă huŏng tơ teh 'lơ̆ng wă pơtih gia kơ lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei na kiơ̆ hloi kơjăp hăm pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Sư kư̆m adrin lui khŏm khŏm pơyua tơdrong jang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a lampstand, that those who enter may see the light.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng kơ lu đe noh, Sư khan: “Bơ̆n tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng wă kơ hơdah; bơ̆n ưh kơ lah tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng tah tơ lăm ge dah 'măn lê̆ tơ ala rimrôm giơng wă kơ măng mu ôh. Bơ̆n juăt kơ atol ŭnh kơđeng tơ kơpal jrăng wă kơ bơ̆n 'bôh hơdah jơ̆p-jang.

English: For nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and come to light.
Bahnar: Thoi noh tôm tơdrong Inh bơtho pơjuang kơ iĕm dang ei iĕm gô băt dơning dơmônh.

English: Therefore take heed how you hear. For whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he seems to have will be taken from him.”
Bahnar: “Thoi noh na iĕm athei mơ̆ng Inh mă nhên. Bơngai bu hlôh, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơthim kơ sư hlôh hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng tơpă. Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, bơngai 'noh sư tơchĕng sư hlôh ră, mă-lei sư gô hiong dôm tơdrong sư hlôh.”

English: Then His mother and brothers came to Him, and could not approach Him because of the crowd.
Bahnar: Oh Yêsu hăm mĕ Sư năm tơ Sư ră, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh truh yua kơ bơngai hrăt-hrot kơ 'măng.

English: And it was told Him by some, who said, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”
Bahnar: Na đe khan kơ Yêsu: “Mĕ Ih hăm oh Ih dơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih hnam to. Lu sư chă Ih.”

English: But He answered and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Bơngai bu mă mơ̆ng păng kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai noh boih dang mĕ Inh, dang 'nhŏng oh Inh.”

English: Now it happened, on a certain day, that He got into a boat with His disciples. And He said to them, “Let us cross over to the other side of the lake.” And they launched out.
Bahnar: Minh năr ei, Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tŏk thŏng-nan. Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bĕ bơ̆n tŏk pah to đak dơsĭ.” Na lu sư năm hloi.

English: But as they sailed He fell asleep. And a windstorm came down on the lake, and they were filling with water, and were in jeopardy.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei yak kơpal đak dơsĭ, Yêsu tep. Na đei kial hơbŭt tih păng đei đak poh-yă tih tơprah mơ̆t lăm thŏng-nan. Đak wă jê̆ 'bĕnh na thŏng-nan wă jê̆ krăm.

English: And they came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water. And they ceased, and there was a calm.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu năm râu Yêsu khan hloi: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, bơ̆n wă lôch kơ đak lơ̆p boih.” Na Yêsu hơloh iung khă hloi kial hăm đak poh-yă. Na kial thĕng hloi păng đak poh-yă kư̆m pă adrŏ adrĕnh.

English: But He said to them, “Where is your faith?” And they were afraid, and marveled, saying to one another, “Who can this be? For He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Lơliơ iĕm tam băt gơnang kơ Inh?” Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư lăng hlĭch kơ đon. Jơhngơ̆m lu sư hli dêh. Na lu sư apinh băl khan: “Bu âu kih, kial hơbŭt, đak dơsĭ poh-yă tih dang noh, mă kư̆m chu yom kơ Sư?”

English: Then they sailed to the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk hloh pah to đak dơsĭ tơ tơring đe Gerasen. Tơring đe Gerasen noh pah to đak dơsĭ, pah âu dêh char Galilê.

English: And when He stepped out on the land, there met Him a certain man from the city who had demons for a long time. And he wore no clothes, nor did he live in a house but in the tombs.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan Sư tơ'bơ̆p hloi minh 'nu bơngai pơlei noh, bơngai yang mơ̆t. Sư pă lah hrŭk hơbĕn ao boih. Sư pă wă oei tơ hnam boih, sư oei tơ bơsat đĕch.

English: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have I to do with You, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me!”
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh Yêsu, sư ôr na năm 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu na Yêsu athei yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư. Yang kơnê̆ ei pơma pơret khan: “Ơ Yêsu, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lơliơ Ih wă phak inh dang ei, apinh Ih 'nĕ phak inh hŏ.” Đơ̆ng sơ̆ yang kơnê̆ juăt kơ pơm kơ sư wik. Đe chô̆ ră jơ̆ng ti sư păng glang mam, gak sư ră mă-lei sư hrĕch kơtĕch kơtoch đĭ, na yang kơnê̆ pơpuh sư năm tơ char glă chơngue.

English: For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For it had often seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles; and he broke the bonds and was driven by the demon into the wilderness.
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh Yêsu, sư ôr na năm 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu na Yêsu athei yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư. Yang kơnê̆ ei pơma pơret khan: “Ơ Yêsu, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lơliơ Ih wă phak inh dang ei, apinh Ih 'nĕ phak inh hŏ.” Đơ̆ng sơ̆ yang kơnê̆ juăt kơ pơm kơ sư wik. Đe chô̆ ră jơ̆ng ti sư păng glang mam, gak sư ră mă-lei sư hrĕch kơtĕch kơtoch đĭ, na yang kơnê̆ pơpuh sư năm tơ char glă chơngue.

English: Jesus asked him, saying, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.
Bahnar: Yêsu jet anăn sư: “Anăn ih bu?” Sư khan: “Anăn inh Tơpôl.” Sư khan thoi noh yua kơ sư đei lơ yang kơnê̆ oei lăm sư.

English: And they begged Him that He would not command them to go out into the abyss.
Bahnar: Na lu yang kơnê̆ ei apinh Yêsu thoi âu: “Dah Ih pơpuh nhôn, Ih 'nĕ pơpuh nhôn năm tơ sơlŭng jrŭ.”

English: Now a herd of many swine was feeding there on the mountain. So they begged Him that He would permit them to enter them. And He permitted them.
Bahnar: Đei minh tơpôl nhŭng chă sa kiơ̆ groi ei, na lu yang kơnê̆ apinh Yêsu ăn kơ lu sư gơh mơ̆t tơ tơpôl lu nhŭng mă sa kiơ̆ groi ei. Na Yêsu ăn lu sư mơ̆t tơ lăm nhŭng kiơ̆ ei.

English: Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the lake and drowned.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu sư jăk hloi đơ̆ng bơngai 'nei mơ̆t hĭ tơ lu nhŭng. Lu nhŭng ei kơdâu jur đơ̆ng kông groi ei huŏng hơtat tơ đak dơsĭ, glơ̆k lôch đĭ minh tơpôl nhŭng ei.

English: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă wei nhŭng 'bôh thoi noh na kơdâu chă roi kơ đe jơ̆p-jang lăm pơlei ei.

English: Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
Bahnar: Na lu kon pơlei pơla năm lăng tơdrong noh lơliơ. Lu sư năm tơ Yêsu na 'bôh bơngai mă đêl yang mơ̆t ei oei ngôi 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu. Sư hrŭk hơbĕn ao thoi lĕ bơngai hmă boih, ưh pă wơnh dơ̆ng. Na lu đe ei hli kơ Yêsu.

English: They also who had seen it told them by what means he who had been demon-possessed was healed.
Bahnar: Lu đe mă đêl 'bôh Yêsu pơklaih bơngai wơnh hei, lu sư chă roi kơ đe tơdrong noh dơ̆ng.

English: Then the whole multitude of the surrounding region of the Gadarenes asked Him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. And He got into the boat and returned.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơring Gerasen ei athei Yêsu jăk tơ nai yua kơ lu sư hli dêh.

English: Now the man from whom the demons had departed begged Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu tŏk tơ thŏng-nan na bơngai mă 'nao klaih kơ wơnh ei apinh kiơ̆ oei păng Yêsu. Mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ anhăk ba ôh. Sư khan

English: “Return to your own house, and tell what great things God has done for you.” And he went his way and proclaimed throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
Bahnar: “Ih wih brŏk tơ hnam ih đĕch chă roi kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ ih dang yơ, na sư mah pơklaih ih đơ̆ng ti yang kơnê̆.” Na sư wih tơ hnam chă ră roi jơ̆p-jang kơ pơlei sư dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơklaih sư.

English: So it was, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed Him, for they were all waiting for Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu tŏk tơ thŏng-nan tŏk găn brŏk tơ pah âu dơ̆ng. Đei lơ bơngai răp gô Sư.

English: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged Him to come to his house
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm tơ Yêsu. Sư ei bơngai kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm đe Juđê lăm pơlei kiơ̆ ei. Anăn sư Jairut. Sư 'nap 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu na apinh Yêsu năm tơ hnam sư

English: for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as He went, the multitudes thronged Him.
Bahnar: yua kơ kon pôm adruh sư bơlŏ dêh. Kơplah Yêsu oei yak năm tơ hnam sư 'nei, đei lơ bơngai yak hơdai Sư hmĕt hmot Sư.

English: Now a woman, having a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her livelihood on physicians and could not be healed by any
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn tuh pham mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm boih. Sư apah đe ming akâu sư tĕch đĭ mŭk tơmam sư ră mă-lei ưh kơ klaih ôh.

English: came from behind and touched the border of His garment. And immediately her flow of blood stopped.
Bahnar: Sư năm hơdai đe kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng Yêsu chur mơ̆t kiơ̆ Yêsu wă pel tơdrơi ao Yêsu wă kơ klaih kơ tơdrong jĭ sư. Lăp sư pel 'bơm tơdrơi ao Yêsu, kơtă ei sư klaih hloi kơ đơ̆ng tuh pham.

English: And Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes throng and press You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”
Bahnar: Kơplah 'nei Yêsu khan: “Bu kih pel Inh?” Đĭ-đăng lu đe ei khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ đei pel Ih.” Na Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, đei lơ bơngai hmĕt hmot Ih.”

English: But Jesus said, “Somebody touched Me, for I perceived power going out from Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Đei bơngai pơrơ̆ng pel Inh yua kơ Inh băt kơdih tơdrong mơsêh Inh lĕch.”

English: Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before Him, she declared to Him in the presence of all the people the reason she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei băt sư ưh pă gơh ôn boih na sư hli tơtey năm tơ Yêsu 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Sư roi hloi 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl tơdrong sư pel Yêsu, na sư klaih hloi kơ jĭ.

English: And He said to her, “Daughter, be of good cheer; your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ duch, kơlih kơ ih lui na ih klaih. Na dang ei brŏk kơ ih mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ.”

English: While He was still speaking, someone came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma, blư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng hnam 'bok Jairut năm giong khan kơ sư: “Kon adruh ih lôch boih, ih oei pơhrat kiơ kơ 'Bok Thây?”

English: But when Jesus heard it, He answered him, saying, “Do not be afraid; only believe, and she will be made well.”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng sư pơtruh kơ Jairut thoi noh na Sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli, ih kư̆ kơ lui đĕch, na kon ih gô klaih.”

English: When He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, James, and John, and the father and mother of the girl.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ hnam Jairut boih, na Yêsu ăn lăp Pêtrôs, Yôhan, Yakơ păng mĕ 'bă adruh ei đĕch mơ̆t tơ hnam noh.

English: Now all wept and mourned for her; but He said, “Do not weep; she is not dead, but sleeping.”
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai 'bơ̆t ei tơjrông tơjrang mang oei nhơ̆m hmoi. Na Yêsu khan kơ lu đe ei: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư wăi, sư ưh kơ lôch ôh, sư tep đĕch.”

English: And they ridiculed Him, knowing that she was dead.
Bahnar: Na đe ei pơm hiĕk kơ Sư yua kơ lu sư băt nhên kơ bơngai noh lôch tơpă boih.

English: But He put them all outside, took her by the hand and called, saying, “Little girl, arise.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đe Yêsu păng mĕ 'bă adruh ei mơ̆t tơ anih đe tơ'bĭch adruh ei na Yêsu rôp ti adruh ei păng khan: “Ơ mŏ adruh iĕ, iung bĕ.”

English: Then her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He commanded that she be given something to eat.
Bahnar: Bơhngol sư wih hloi na sư gruih iung. Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu athei mĕ sư sŏ ăn kơ kon adruh sư ei tơmam sŏng sa.

English: Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, ăn kơ lu sư gơh pơpuh tơlĕch lu yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu bơngai păng ăn kơ lu sư gơh pơklaih tơdrong jĭ jăn.

English: He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu wơh lu sư năm chă bơtho đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai păng pơklaih lu đe jĭ jăn.

English: And He said to them, “Take nothing for the journey, neither staffs nor bag nor bread nor money; and do not have two tunics apiece.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Iĕm năm bơtho 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba tơmam kiơ kiơ. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba 'long jra, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba kơdŭng tah tơmam păng tơmam sa, mă jên. Păng iĕm hrŭk ba ao minh blah đĕch.

English: “Whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there depart.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm mơ̆t oei tơ hnam ayơ, iĕm oei hloi tơ hnam noh đĕch truh tơ năr iĕm wă năm tơ pơlei nai.

English: And whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”
Bahnar: Dah pơlei ayơ ưh kơ wă sơng iŏk iĕm, thoi noh na lăp iĕm brŏk đơ̆ng pơlei noh iĕm sơpuih 'bruih tơ jơ̆ng iĕm wă tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak ning-mônh.”

English: So they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu bơtho lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư đang boih, na lu sư năm jơ̆p kơ pơlei chă bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng păng pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Him; and he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead
Bahnar: Pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong mă Yêsu pơm na sư hơwơ̆l kơ Yêsu, ưh kơ băt Sư bu, yua kơ lu bơngai mơ'nah khan Yêsu Yôhan mă pơm kơ đe 'batem ki, khan sư lôch iung arih.

English: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan Yêsu Êli mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Mơ'nah dơ̆ng kư̆m khan Yêsu minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei nai sơ̆ iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: Herod said, “John I have beheaded, but who is this of whom I hear such things?” So he sought to see Him.
Bahnar: Hêrôt sư khan: “Gah Yôhan inh chơ̆ng ako sư boih, na bơngai mă pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh noh bu dơ̆ng?” Na Hêrôt 'maih chă tơ'bơ̆p Yêsu.

English: And the apostles, when they had returned, told Him all that they had done. Then He took them and went aside privately into a deserted place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu wih roi kơ Sư dôm tơdrong sư jang. Na Yêsu anhăk ba kơdrô̆ lu sư tơ Pơlei 'Betsaiđa.

English: But when the multitudes knew it, they followed Him; and He received them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng Yêsu wă năm tơ pơlei ei lu sư kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu. Na Yêsu kư̆m ưh kơ khă lu sư ôh. Sư bơtho lu đe ei tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai. Na Yêsu kư̆m chă pơklaih rah dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn mơ̆n.

English: When the day began to wear away, the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding towns and country, and lodge and get provisions; for we are in a deserted place here.”
Bahnar: Lăp hiưp kơsơ̆, đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Sư na khan: “Ih kuă kơ kiơ athei lu đe kon pơlei pơla năm tơ lu pơlei kiơ̆ âu wă kơ lu sư răt kơdih tơmam sa, chă kơdih anih tep? Anih bơ̆n âu kueng dêh.”

English: But He said to them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'me sư wăi.” Lu sư khan: “Bơ̆n đei lăp pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar tŏ ka đĕch, na Ih wă kơ nhôn năm răt tơmam sa wă 'me lu đe tơpôl âu dah kiơ?”

English: For there were about five thousand men. Then He said to His disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of fifty.”
Bahnar: Lu đe ei đei dang pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu bơngai jô̆ gah drŏ-nglo đĕch. Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư dơ̆ng: “Iĕm athei lu sư tơoei akŭm hơdai, rim jơ'bôt dang pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.”

English: And they did so, and made them all sit down.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư athei đĭ-đăng lu sư oei hơdai kiơ̆ thoi Yêsu athei.

English: Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu iŏk pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar tŏ ka ei, ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đơ̆ng noh Sư phĕ 'bĕng mi păng ka ei ăn kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ lu bôl buăl.

English: So they all ate and were filled, and twelve baskets of the leftover fragments were taken up by them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu đe ei sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih. Đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă dônh tah tơ bai mă đơ̆ng đêl lu sư sa rơkah, kư̆m mah oei 'bĕnh kơ mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bai plơ̆ng dơ̆ng.

English: And it happened, as He was alone praying, that His disciples joined Him, and He asked them, saying, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei Yêsu oei krao khan kơdrô̆, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Sư. Na Yêsu jet lu sư: “Lu kon pơlei pơla sư krao anăn Inh bu?”

English: So they answered and said, “John the Baptist, but some say Elijah; and others say that one of the old prophets has risen again.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Mơ'nah đe krao Ih Yôhan, bơngai pơm kơ đe 'batem. Mơ'nah khan Ih Êli, bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Mơ'nah dơ̆ng kư̆m khan Ih minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei nai sơ̆ iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered and said, “The Christ of God.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet lu sư dơ̆ng: “Bĭ iĕm khan Inh bu?” Pêtrôs khan: “Ih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơgơ̆r kon bơngai.”

English: And He strictly warned and commanded them to tell this to no one
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khă lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kuă ăn kơ lu sư chă roi kơ đe Sư boih 'Bok Krist.

English: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Inh Kon Bơngai gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. Lu đe kră dêh char Juđê, lu đe 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê kuă chu yom kơ Inh na athei đe pơlôch Inh. Mă-lei kơtĕch kơ pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơiung arih Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: Then He said to them all, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow Me.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai tơpôl lơ mă năm mơ̆ng Sư: “Dah bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ Inh, sư athei tŭk đĭ dôm tơdrong sư kơdih na rim năr sư athei tôi kơdih 'long pơglang chu lôch yua kơ wă kiơ̆ Inh.

English: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will save it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai noh lôch hoh hoh đĕch ưh kơ yua kiơ. Bơngai bu chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, sư 'noh gô arih ling-lang.

English: For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and is himself destroyed or lost?
Bahnar: Mă bu mơdrŏng đei tôm mŭk tơmam tơ ala teh âu, dah sư ưh kơ arih ling-lang lei truh sư lôch ưh pă đei yua kiơ boih.

English: For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words, of him the Son of Man will be ashamed when He comes in His own glory, and in His Father’s, and of the holy angels.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur tơ ala teh âu dơ̆ng, hơdai păng lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng. Năr 'noh kơnh 'Bă Inh gô ăn kơ Inh mơsêh mơyang 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơpă. Na bơngai bu khan sư kiơ̆ Inh boih, mă-lei sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu kơ đe na kuă kơ bơtho kơ đe tơdrong Inh, năr 'noh kơnh Inh kư̆m kuă kơ sư mơ̆n.

English: But I tell you truly, there are some standing here who shall not taste death till they see the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei lăm lu iĕm âu mơ'nah ưh tam lôch ôh, lu sư gô 'bôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r tơpă.”

English: Now it came to pass, about eight days after these sayings, that He took Peter, John, and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
Bahnar: Dang tơhngam năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yêsu bơtho tơdrong noh Yêsu anhăk lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, anăn lu sư Pêtrôs, Yôhan păng Yakơ, lu sư tŏk tơ kông kơdrô̆ lu sư wă krao khan.

English: As He prayed, the appearance of His face was altered, and His robe became white and glistening.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei krao khan, muh măt Sư tơwir hloi păng ao Sư rang hơdah mơnhal.

English: And behold, two men talked with Him, who were Moses and Elijah
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bôh blư kơ Môis păng Êli jur pơma dơnuh păng Yêsu.

English: who appeared in glory and spoke of His decease which He was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Akâu jăn bre sư kư̆m rang hơdah mơ̆n. Bre sư pơma dơnuh păng Yêsu tơdrong Sư wă lôch iung arih tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei ată lê̆ hơdrol.

English: But Peter and those with him were heavy with sleep; and when they were fully awake, they saw His glory and the two men who stood with Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Pêtrôs păng bre bôl sư oei tep. Lăp lu sư hơđơ̆r, lu sư 'bôh akâu Yêsu mơnhal thoi noh păng 'bôh bre Môis păng Êli oei pơma dơnuh păng Yêsu.

English: Then it happened, as they were parting from Him, that Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—not knowing what he said.
Bahnar: Lăp bre noh wă weh đơ̆ng Yêsu, na Pêtrôs khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, bơ̆n oei tơ âu hiôk dêh. Lê̆ kơ nhôn pơm kơ bơ̆n pêng tŏ bơsŭn; minh pôm pơm kơ Ih, minh pôm pơm kơ Môis, minh pôm pơm kơ Êli.” Pêtrôs pơma thoi noh, sư pơma hơdrol kơ đon.

English: While he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them; and they were fearful as they entered the cloud.
Bahnar: Kơplah Pêtrôs oei pơma thoi noh 'bôh glĭp kơ hơmơ̆l jur gom lu sư na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu hli.

English: And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Hear Him!”
Bahnar: Păng đei nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l noh khan: “Sư âu Kon Inh. Inh athei Sư jang tơdrong Inh. Na iĕm ling-lang athei chu yom kơ Sư.”

English: When the voice had ceased, Jesus was found alone. But they kept quiet, and told no one in those days any of the things they had seen.
Bahnar: Lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma thoi noh đang boih, hơloh kơ jua kơ bre Môis păng Êli, pă minh 'nu Yêsu đĕch oei 'bơ̆t ei. Kơplah ei sơ̆ lu sư ưh kơ roi ôh kơ đe tơdrong noh.

English: Now it happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met Him.
Bahnar: Minh năr đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư jur đơ̆ng kông ei boih na tơ'bơ̆p hĭ kơ lu đe tơpôl.

English: Suddenly a man from the multitude cried out, saying, “Teacher, I implore You, look on my son, for he is my only child.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu lăm bơngai tơpôl ei pơma re khan kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, apinh Ih lăng kon pôm inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.

English: And behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out; it convulses him so that he foams at the mouth; and it departs from him with great difficulty, bruising him.
Bahnar: Phŏ phŏ yang kơnê̆ glơ̆m sư na sư ôr. Yang kơnê̆ pơm kơ sư lĕch đak hai djơdjih djơdjah. Yang kơnê̆ glơ̆m pơm kơ sư jĭ dêh 'mơ̆i na jăk jăi.

English: So I implored Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”
Bahnar: Inh athei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih pơpuh yang kơnê̆ noh ră mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh.”

English: Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Ơ lu iĕm mă oei lui rơdu hơnơ̆ng kư̆m oei pơm yoch, iĕm wă kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm đunh dang yơ 'mơ̆i na iĕm lui kơjăp? Iĕm wă kơ Inh gleh dang yơ 'mơ̆i na iĕm gơh pơklaih đe?” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai ei: “Năm ba kon ih tơ âu năm.”

English: And as he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. Then Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the child, and gave him back to his father.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'lơ̆p noh năm wă jê̆ Yêsu na yang kơnê̆ glơ̆m lê̆ sư arăng jơ'mro. Na Yêsu pơma pơpuh tơlĕch lê̆ hloi yang kơnê̆ 'nei đơ̆ng akâu sư ưh pă layơ mơ̆t dơ̆ng. Na Sư pơjao 'lơ̆p 'nei kơ 'bă sư dơ̆ng.

English: And they were all amazed at the majesty of God. But while everyone marveled at all the things which Jesus did, He said to His disciples
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu đe 'bơ̆t ei sơleng kơ đon yua kơ 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi noh. Kơplah lu bơngai tơpôl oei tơchĕng sơleng kơđon kơ dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơm, na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơdrô̆ lu sư thoi âu

English: “Let these words sink down into your ears, for the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
Bahnar: “Inh wă kơ iĕm tơguăt lăm đon tơdrong âu: Đe gô rôp pơjao Inh Kon Bơngai tơ ti kon bơngai tơ ala teh âu.”

English: But they did not understand this saying, and it was hidden from them so that they did not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask Him about this saying.
Bahnar: Mă khan Yêsu pơma hơdah tơdrong noh, lu sư ưh kơ hlôh păng lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ pơ̆n jet Yêsu.

English: Then a dispute arose among them as to which of them would be greatest.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu oei pơjah dih băl bu lăm lu sư pơm tih 'biơ̆ kơ tơduă lu sư.

English: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a little child and set him by Him
Bahnar: Yêsu ưh kơ kơtơ̆ng ră lu sư pơjah thoi noh mă-lei Sư băt. Na Yêsu năm dui iŏk minh 'nu 'lơ̆p athei dơ̆ng jê̆ Sư

English: and said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in My name receives Me; and whoever receives Me receives Him who sent Me. For he who is least among you all will be great.”
Bahnar: na khan kơ lu đe ei: “Bơngai bu sơng iŏk bơngai 'lơ̆p âu, yua kơ bơngai 'lơ̆p âu lui kơ Inh, bơngai noh dang sơng iŏk Inh. Bơngai bu sơng iŏk Inh, bơngai noh dang sơng iŏk 'Bok Kei-Dei mă wơh Inh mơ̆n. Bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm pơm iĕ hloh, bơngai noh boih pơm tih.”

English: Now John answered and said, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he does not follow with us.”
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai gơnang kơ anăn Ih wă pơpuh yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng đe, na nhôn khă sư yua kơ sư ưh kơ jang hơdai bơ̆n.”

English: But Jesus said to him, “Do not forbid him, for he who is not against us is on our side.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ Yôhan: “'Nĕ pă khă sư yua kơ bơngai bu huay ayăt kơ bơ̆n, bơngai noh kiơ̆ đon bơ̆n.”

English: Now it came to pass, when the time had come for Him to be received up, that He steadfastly set His face to go to Jerusalem
Bahnar: Lăp wă jê̆ năr Yêsu wă tŏk tơ plĕnh Sư pơkă khan Sư gô năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơdrol 'mơ̆i.

English: and sent messengers before His face. And as they went, they entered a village of the Samaritans, to prepare for Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Sư wơh lu bôl Sư năm hơdrol kơ Sư wă hơmet kơ Yêsu minh pôm anih oei tơ pơlei đe lăm dêh char Samri.

English: But they did not receive Him, because His face was set for the journey to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ pơlei ei lu kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ ăn Yêsu oei tơ pơlei sư. Lu sư hil yua kơ lu sư băt kơ Yêsu wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And when His disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them, just as Elijah did?”
Bahnar: Lăp bre Yakơ păng Yôhan bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'bôh thoi noh boih, bre sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih hăm wă kơ bơ̆n athei ŭnh jruh đơ̆ng plĕnh sa pơlei đe âu?”

English: But He turned and rebuked them, and said, “You do not know what manner of spirit you are of.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu hue tơ rŏng khan kơ bre sư: “Bơ̆n ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ 'nei ôh.”

English: For the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives but to save them.” And they went to another village.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu sư weh tơ pơlei nai đĕch.

English: Now it happened as they journeyed on the road, that someone said to Him, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei năm rok trong đei minh 'nu bơngai khan kơ Sư: “Mă Ih năm tơ yơ yơ, inh wă kiơ̆ Ih ngăl.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Mơja đei anih tep, sem păr kư̆m đei tơpu. Inh Kon Bơngai ră mă-lei ưh kơ đei anih tep ôh.”

English: Then He said to another, “Follow Me.” But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng: “Kiơ̆ Inh bĕ.” Mă-lei bơngai ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, gô inh năm 'bŭ 'bă inh 'mơ̆i.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and preach the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ưh ôh, ih kiơ̆ Inh dang ei năm bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai. Tơdrong 'bŭ bơngai lôch, lê̆ tơduă lu bơngai lôch tơ'bŭ băl.”

English: And another also said, “Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go and bid them farewell who are at my house.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu dơ̆ng khan: “Ơ 'Bok, inh wă kiơ̆ Ih mơ̆n mă-lei gô inh pơtruh kơ đe mĕ 'bă inh 'mơ̆i.”

English: But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Bơngai bu wă rơuơ mir sư wă kơ tơpăt, sư 'noh ưh kơ hue-huo 'ma 'ngiĕo ôh. Na bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ Inh kư̆m athei adrin thoi noh mơ̆n. Tơ̆ng sư hue-huo 'ma 'ngiĕo lei sư ưh kơ trŏ kơ bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai ôh.”

English: After these things the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two by two before His face into every city and place where He Himself was about to go.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang Yêsu rơih tơpơh-jĭt 'nu bơngai, na wơh lu sư chă năm bơtho rim pơlei 'bơ'bar 'nu hơdrol kơ Yêsu wă năm.

English: Then He said to them, “The harvest truly is great, but the laborers are few; therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư gah tơdrong đei lơ bơngai tam mă lui đei hui bơngai năm bơtho lu sư: “'Ba lơ ră mă-lei hui bơngai năm kĕch ăn. Thoi noh na bơ̆n athei adrin krao khan apinh tơ'ngla tơm mir wă wơh lơ bơngai năm tơgŭm kĕch.

English: Go your way; behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.
Bahnar: Dang ei Inh wơh iĕm năm chă bơtho đe, na iĕm athei kơchăng hŏ, yua kơ dang lĕ wơh kon triu năm tơ kŏ-so.

English: Carry neither money bag, knapsack, nor sandals; and greet no one along the road.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba kơdŭng tah jên dah kơdŭng bĕng păng 'nĕ kơ chĕp hiă chơkhŏ săng-đal. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ hiơ̆ kơ pơma dơnuh kơ đe rok trong.

English: But whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace to this house.’
Bahnar: Lăp wă mơ̆t tơ hnam đe, iĕm khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ hnam iĕm chơt hiôk.’

English: And if a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on it; if not, it will return to you.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai lăm hnam ei bơngai 'lơ̆ng, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ sư chơt hiôk tơpă. Dah sư ưh kơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ sư chơt hiôk ôh.

English: And remain in the same house, eating and drinking such things as they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Do not go from house to house.
Bahnar: Na iĕm kư̆ kơ oei tơ hnam noh khŏm khŏm. Iĕm lê̆ kơ sư 'me iĕm, yua kơ iĕm bơtho sư tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, kư̆m dang lĕ jang tơgŭm sư mơ̆n. Iĕm 'nĕ chă oei jơ̆p jơ̆p kơ hnam đe.

English: Whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you.
Bahnar: Pơlei ayơ sơng iŏk iĕm, lu sư 'me iĕm tơmam sa kiơ kiơ, iĕm kư̆ kơ sa đĕch, iĕm 'nĕ pơrơih.

English: And heal the sick there, and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’
Bahnar: Na iĕm pơklaih lu bơngai jĭ jăn tơ noh păng tơbăt kơ lu sư khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm boih.’

English: But whatever city you enter, and they do not receive you, go out into its streets and say
Bahnar: Pơlei ayơ ưh kơ wă sơng iŏk iĕm, iĕm năm tơ cham pơlei noh na khan

English: ‘The very dust of your city which clings to us we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the kingdom of God has come near you.’
Bahnar: ‘'Bruih pơlei iĕm mă đom tơ jơ̆ng nhôn, nhôn sơpuih đĭ boih. 'Noh wă tơbăt kơ iĕm 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak iĕm. Nhôn wă tơbăt kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm ră mă-lei iĕm pơm ưh kơ chu.’

English: But I say to you that it will be more tolerable in that Day for Sodom than for that city.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư gô phak kon pơlei Sôđôm hơiơch 'biơ̆ kơ pơlei mă ưh kơ sơng iŏk iĕm mă khan Pơlei Sôđôm pơm kơnê̆ dêh ră sơ̆.”

English: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Ơ Pơlei Chơrasin, iĕm gô đei tơdrong pơmat tơpă ning-mônh. Ơ Pơlei 'Betsaiđa, iĕm kư̆m đei tơdrong pơmat tơpă mơ̆n ning-mônh. Dah Inh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơ Pơlei Tirơ hăm Pơlei Siđôn dang Inh pơm tơ pơlei iĕm ki, lei 'bar tŏ pơlei noh tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch 'bônh đĕch, lu sư hrŭk hloi ao 'bi păng iŏk hloi tơnuh ŭnh pik tơ akâu lu sư wă kơ đe băt kơ lu sư sơ'ngon kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư tơpă. Mă-lei lu iĕm âu phara dêh, iĕm ưh kơ băt tơbral thoi noh.

English: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.
Bahnar: Truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư gô phak Pơlei Tirơ păng Pơlei Siđôn hơiơch 'biơ̆ kơ pơlei iĕm mă khan 'bar tŏ pơlei noh pơlei dêh tơmoi.

English: And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.
Bahnar: Bĭ iĕm ơ Pơlei Kapernum, iĕm tơchĕng iĕm tih dang yơ, iĕm tih atŏ truh tơ plĕnh ti hă? Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơhuŏng lê̆ iĕm truh tơ dơnâu ŭnh sŭng.”

English: He who hears you hears Me, he who rejects you rejects Me, and he who rejects Me rejects Him who sent Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Bơngai bu mơ̆ng iĕm, sư 'noh dang mơ̆ng Inh mơ̆n. Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng iĕm, sư 'noh kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh mơ̆n. Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Inh, sư 'noh kư̆m dang ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mă wơh Inh mơ̆n.”

English: Then the seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in Your name.”
Bahnar: Lu tơpơh-jĭt 'nu noh năm chă bơtho đe păng chă pơklaih lu bơngai jĭ jăn. Klaih kơ noh lu sư wih tơ Yêsu. Lu sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, nhôn gơnang kơ anăn Ih, mă lu yang kơnê̆ kư̆m chu kơ nhôn mơ̆n.”

English: And He said to them, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Trŏ boih, Inh 'bôh yang Satan, yŏng yang kơnê̆, huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh hrĕnh dang kơmlat.

English: Behold, I give you the authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall by any means hurt you.
Bahnar: Inh ăn boih kơ iĕm gơh juă 'bih păng aguăt. Inh kư̆m ăn dôm tơdrong yang kơnê̆ thuơ kơ iĕm ngăl, ưh pă đei bu pơ̆n pơm kơ iĕm boih.

English: Nevertheless do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice because your names are written in heaven.”
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ chhôk kơ yang kơnê̆ chu iĕm, mă-lei iĕm athei chhôk kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei chih anăn iĕm tơ Pơlei 'lơ̆ng.”

English: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in the Spirit and said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and revealed them to babes. Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ Yêsu hiôk na Sư krao khan: “Ơ 'Bă, Ih boih Kră Yang plĕnh teh. Inh bơnê kơ Ih yua kơ dôm tơdrong Inh bơtho, Ih tơbăt kơ lu bơngai âu mă băt gơnang kơ Ih thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p băt gơnang kơ mĕ 'bă păng Ih ưh kơ tơhlôh kơ lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih hŏk hơgei. Ơ 'Bă, Ih pơm thoi noh trŏ tơpă, kiơ̆ thoi Ih lăp đon.

English: All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father, and who the Father is except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.”
Bahnar: “'Bă Inh jao ăn kơ Inh tôm tĕch tơdrong, minh 'nu 'Bă Inh đĕch băt kơ Inh păng minh 'nu Inh đĕch băt kơ Sư. Na dôm lu bơngai mă Inh tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư, băt kơ 'Bă.”

English: Then He turned to His disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see the things you see
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu hue tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na Yêsu khan kơdrô̆ lu sư: “Dôm lu bơngai 'bôh tôm tơdrong iĕm 'bôh Inh pơm ahrei, lu sư hiôk tơpă.

English: for I tell you that many prophets and kings have desired to see what you see, and have not seen it, and to hear what you hear, and have not heard it.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei lơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lu đe 'bok pơtao sơ̆ 'maih 'bôh tơpă dôm tơdrong mă iĕm 'bôh dang ei ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ đei 'bôh ôh. Lu sư 'maih mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong iĕm kơtơ̆ng dang ei ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ đei kơtơ̆ng ôh.”

English: And behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested Him, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê iung jet pơlong lăng Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, inh pơm thoi yơ wă kơ arih ling-lang?”

English: He said to him, “What is written in the law? What is your reading of it?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Bĭ đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ? Ih hlôh hla bơar noh thoi yơ?”

English: So he answered and said, “ ‘You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind,’ and ‘your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Bok thây ei khan: “Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt khan: ‘Bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang bơ̆n hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak bơ̆n păng đĭ dôm tơdrong đon bơ̆n tơchĕng. Păng bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi bơ̆n 'mêm akâu bơ̆n kơdih.’ ”

English: And He said to him, “You have answered rightly; do this and you will live.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Tơdrong ih tơl noh trŏ tơpă. Ih pơm kiơ̆ hloi bĕ na ih gô arih ling-lang.”

English: But he, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok thây noh sư ưh kơ 'mêm kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai na sư apinh Yêsu dơ̆ng: “Lu đe bu bôl buăl inh?”

English: Then Jesus answered and said: “A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, who stripped him of his clothing, wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư pơtih gia thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđê yak đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrikô. Kơplah sư năm rok trong sư tơ'bơ̆p lu bơngai răp tơgar. Na lu bơngai răp tơgar ei tơgar iŏk jên tơmam hơbĕn ao sư đĭ păng teh sư rơka jĭ jơ̆p-jang kơ akâu. Klaih kơ noh lu bơngai noh kơdâu weh achăng kơdrô̆ sư lôch mol 'bơ̆t noh.

English: Now by chance a certain priest came down that road. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng 'biơ̆ kơ noh đei minh 'nu 'bok soi Juđê năm rok trong noh 'bôh sư ră, mă-lei sư năm yoh đĕch.

English: Likewise a Levite, when he arrived at the place, came and looked, and passed by on the other side.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dơ̆ng đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđê khŭl đe Lêwi mă jang tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, sư kư̆m năm rok trong noh mơ̆n 'bôh sư ră, sư kư̆m năm yoh đĕch.

English: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was. And when he saw him, he had compassion.
Bahnar: Tơpo hơtuch đei minh 'nu bơngai dêh đe Samri kư̆m năm truh tơ noh. Sư 'bôh bơngai noh na sư đei đon 'brơ̆k mơnat.

English: So he went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine; and he set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
Bahnar: Sư thar pik đak pơgang 'bơ̆t rơka jĭ păng pơ̆n hloi jĭ noh, klaih kơ noh atŏk sư kơpal kơdŭ aseh sư kơdih, chơ ba sư tơ hnam tơmoi tep wă tơgŭm wei-lăng sư tơ noh.

English: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, gave them to the innkeeper, and said to him, ‘Take care of him; and whatever more you spend, when I come again, I will repay you.’
Bahnar: Truh pơgê dơning sư ăn kơ tơ'ngla hnam tơmoi noh 'bar hlak jên hu păng pơkă khan: ‘Ih wei-lăng bơngai jĭ âu hŏ. Dah jên âu ưh kơ mah lei gô inh wih tơ âu dơning dơmônh inh gô ăn pơthim kơ ih dơ̆ng mă tôm.’ ”

English: So which of these three do you think was neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet 'bok thây noh: “Lăm pêng 'nu bơngai noh, ih lăng bơngai ayơ bôl buăl păng bơngai mă jĭ kơ lu bơngai tơtông teh noh?”

English: And he said, “He who showed mercy on him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok thây ei khan: “Bơngai mă băt mơnat kơ bơngai jĭ noh yơh.” Yêsu khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Ih băt thoi noh boih na ih pơm kiơ̆ hloi bĕ.”

English: Now it happened as they went that He entered a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.
Bahnar: Kơplah đe Yêsu oei rok trong wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, lu sư drong mơ̆t tơ minh pôm pơlei ei, na minh 'nu drŏ-kăn anăn sư Mathê sơng iŏk Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam sư.

English: And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard His word.
Bahnar: Mathê đei minh 'nu oh drŏ-kăn anăn sư Mari. Na Mari tơoei 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu mơ̆ng Sư bơtho.

English: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she approached Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me.”
Bahnar: Mathê ưh kơ hiôk ôh yua kơ sư đei tơdrong jang lơ, na sư năm tơ Yêsu khan: “Ơ 'Bok, oh inh tŭk inh jang kơdrô̆ inh gleh dêh, lơliơ ih ưh kơ mơnat kơ inh ôh hă? Athei sư iung tơgŭm inh 'biơ̆.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Ơ Mathê, ih mah tơchĕng kiơ kơ dôm tơdrong jang noh dêh?

English: But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her.”
Bahnar: Đei minh tơdrong mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch kăl. Mari sư wă kơ mơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei na Inh ưh kơ wă achăng sư ôh.”

English: Now it came to pass, as He was praying in a certain place, when He ceased, that one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei Yêsu oei krao khan tơ minh anih ei. Lăp đang kơ Sư krao khan boih đei minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, sơ̆ Yôhan bơtho lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư krao khan. Dang ei nhôn kư̆m 'maih kơ Ih bơtho nhôn lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n.”

English: So He said to them, “When you pray, say: Our Father in heaven, Hallowed be Your name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done On earth as it is in heaven.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Iĕm krao khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ 'Bă, ăn anăn Ih jing ư-ang. Ăn kơ dêh char Ih tĕnh truh.

English: Give us day by day our daily bread.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ăn kơ nhôn đei sŏng sa mah rim năr.

English: And forgive us our sins, For we also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. And do not lead us into temptation, But deliver us from the evil one.”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ jô̆ yo kơ nhôn, thoi nhôn ưh kơ jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm yoch păng nhôn. Apinh Ih 'nĕ ăn kơ nhôn lui kơ đe pơhlŭ pơlung.’ ”

English: And He said to them, “Which of you shall have a friend, and go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Pơtih gia đei tơmoi truh tơ hnam bơ̆n kơmăng, bơ̆n ưh kơ đei tơmam sa wă pôk ăn kơ sư. Na lăp tŏk-bŏk măng bơ̆n năm tơ buôl juăt bơ̆n apinh: ‘Ơ mih, asong inh pêng tŏ 'bĕng mi 'biơ̆

English: for a friend of mine has come to me on his journey, and I have nothing to set before him’
Bahnar: yua kơ bôl inh 'nao truh đơ̆ng ataih na inh ưh kơ đei tơmam kiơ wă pôk ăn kơ sư sa.’

English: and he will answer from within and say, ‘Do not trouble me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give to you’?
Bahnar: Na pơtih gia bôl bơ̆n khan thoi âu: ‘Inh pă gơh tơgŭm ih boih. 'Măng đĭ chơkăl boih, inh oei weng kon inh tep. Na inh ưh kơ gơh iung iŏk ăn kơ ih ôh.’

English: I say to you, though he will not rise and give to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence he will rise and give him as many as he needs.
Bahnar: Mă sư bôl bơ̆n ră sư kuă iung asong kơ bơ̆n 'bĕng. Mă-lei Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah bơ̆n apinh sư khŏm khŏm lei sư kư̆m iung iŏk ăn kơ bơ̆n dôm tơmam bơ̆n apinh sư noh mơ̆n.

English: “So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh khan kơ iĕm, krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei khŏm khŏm na Sư gô asong kơ iĕm. Iĕm nŏng kơ chă khŏm khŏm, Sư gô tơ'bôh kơ iĕm. Iĕm dơdŭ 'măng Sư khŏm khŏm, na Sư gô pơih ăn.

English: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ kiơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô asong. Bơngai bu chă kiơ kiơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơ'bôh ăn. Bơngai bu dơdŭ 'măng 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơih ăn.

English: If a son asks for bread from any father among you, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent instead of a fish?
Bahnar: “Bĭ lăm lu iĕm hăm đei bu kon sư apinh sa ka na ăn kơ sư sa 'bih kơep?

English: Or if he asks for an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?
Bahnar: Kon sư apinh sa kơtăp iĕr, na ăn kơ sư sa aguăt?

English: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!”
Bahnar: Iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ ră, mă-lei iĕm kư̆m băt chă ăn kơ kon iĕm tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng, pơma kiơ kơ 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti, dah bơ̆n apinh Sư, Sư gô ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơpă.”

English: And He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. So it was, when the demon had gone out, that the mute spoke; and the multitudes marveled.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai yang mơ̆t pơm kơ sư kơmlo. Na Yêsu pơpuh yang kơnê̆ ei lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai noh, na bơngai noh gơh pơma hloi. Lu bơngai tơpôl 'bôh thoi noh na lu sư sơleng kơ đon.

English: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei mơ'nah tơkhan dih băl: “Yua kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆, anăn sư Belsêbul, tơgŭm, na Sư gơh pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ nai.”

English: Others, testing Him, sought from Him a sign from heaven.
Bahnar: Đei lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng wă pơlong lăng Sư, athei Sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ wă pơm ôh.

English: But He, knowing their thoughts, said to them: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and a house divided against a house falls.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư jô̆ kơ Yêsu khan yang kơnê̆ tơgŭm na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah minh pôm teh đak tơblah dih băl, lei teh đak noh gô pơchah hiong tôch. Dah minh pôm hnam dơnŏ tơblah băl, lei hnam dơnŏ noh kư̆m gô hiong.

English: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? Because you say I cast out demons by Beelzebub.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dah yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ tơblah tơduă yang kơnê̆, dôm tơdrong sư pơgơ̆r gô hiong tôch. Inh khan thoi noh yua kơ iĕm khan yŏng yang kơnê̆ Belsêbul tơgŭm Inh pơpuh tơduă sư yang kơnê̆.

English: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
Bahnar: Iĕm jô̆ kơ Inh thoi noh lei bĭ buăl iĕm gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆ noh, sư gơh đơ̆ng yơ? Đơ̆ng yang noh mơ̆n dah đơ̆ng yơ? Bơ̆n băt kơ đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư ngăl. Thoi noh na lu buăl iĕm kư̆m băt kơ iĕm pơma kơ Inh kư̆ kă đĕch.

English: But if I cast out demons with the finger of God, surely the kingdom of God has come upon you.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Inh, na Inh gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆. Thoi noh na iĕm 'bôh ră 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu boih, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ băt ôh.

English: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are in peace.
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia dah minh 'nu bơngai pran chĕp tak đao oei gak hnam sư, đe ưh kơ gơh tơtông iŏk tơmam sư ôh.

English: But when a stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes from him all his armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư gơnang kơ tak đao sư, mă-lei dah đei bơngai bu pran hloh năm blah iŏk pơjei tak đao sư, na bơngai 'nei gơh iŏk đĭ dôm mŭk tơmam sư đei păng asong kơ lu bôl buăl sư. Inh kư̆m tơblah hăm yang Satan thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơchăng hŏ, bơngai bu ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ Inh, bơngai noh dang ayăt kơ Inh. Bơngai bu ưh kơ tơgŭm Inh, sư dang pơrăm tơdrong Inh.

English: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’
Bahnar: “Inh pơtih kơ iĕm tơdrong noh thoi âu: Yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai, năm tơ char glă, sư chă anih pơdơh ră, sư chă ưh kơ đei. Na sư tơchĕng khan: ‘Inh brŏk oei tơ bơngai mă đêl inh oei ki đĕch.’

English: And when he comes, he finds it swept and put in order.
Bahnar: Lăp sư brŏk, sư 'bôh bơngai đêl sư oei noh thoi hnam đe sơpuih hơmet lê̆ 'lơ̆ng boih mă-lei ưh kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei.

English: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first.”
Bahnar: Na sư năm chă pơtơm buăl sư tơpơh 'nu mă kơnê̆ hloh kơ sư dơ̆ng mơ̆t oei tơ bơngai noh. Na bơngai noh sư jing pơmat hloh kơ minh 'nu yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t ki.”

English: And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which nursed You!”
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih na đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn pơma re khan kơ Yêsu: “Bơngai mă tơpŭ kơ Ih păng rong Ih sơ̆, sư noh hiôk tơpă.”

English: But He said, “More than that, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan: “Bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơm kiơ̆, sư boih hiôk hloh.”

English: And while the crowds were thickly gathered together, He began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.
Bahnar: Lăp kơ'bêl kơ đe akŭm rai lơ na Yêsu Sư khan: “Lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei kơnê̆ dêh, pơm pơlong Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang wă kơ băt kơ Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi iĕm apinh noh ôh. Kơplah Jôna năm bơtho lu bơngai Pơlei Ninêwơ sơ̆, tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng sư đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ kư̆m tơbăt kơ lu kon pơlei ei Jôna đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă na lu sư bơngai yoch. Na tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă dŏng Inh Kon Bơngai ning-mônh kơnh kư̆m wă tơbăt kơ jơhnơr iĕm dang ei Inh đơ̆ng Sư mơ̆n, na iĕm bơngai yoch.

English: For as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also the Son of Man will be to this generation.
Bahnar: Lăp kơ'bêl kơ đe akŭm rai lơ na Yêsu Sư khan: “Lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei kơnê̆ dêh, pơm pơlong Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang wă kơ băt kơ Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi iĕm apinh noh ôh. Kơplah Jôna năm bơtho lu bơngai Pơlei Ninêwơ sơ̆, tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng sư đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ kư̆m tơbăt kơ lu kon pơlei ei Jôna đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă na lu sư bơngai yoch. Na tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă dŏng Inh Kon Bơngai ning-mônh kơnh kư̆m wă tơbăt kơ jơhnơr iĕm dang ei Inh đơ̆ng Sư mơ̆n, na iĕm bơngai yoch.

English: The queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and indeed a greater than Solomon is here.
Bahnar: Truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh, đei yă pơtao đơ̆ng dêh Sêba jô̆ kơ lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei bơngai yoch tih, yua kơ sơ̆ sư đơ̆ng dêh ataih kư̆m adrin năm mơ̆ng pơtao Sôlômôn bơtho hơgei. Iĕm âu đei bơngai bơtho hơgei hloh kơ pơtao Sôlômôn bơtho ră mă-lei kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and indeed a greater than Jonah is here.
Bahnar: Truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh lu kon pơlei Ninêwơ kư̆m jô̆ kơ lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei bơngai yoch mơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư kơtơ̆ng Jôna bơtho athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, lu sư tơbral hloi. Iĕm âu đei bơngai bơtho hơgei hloh kơ Jôna ră mă-lei kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a secret place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, that those who come in may see the light.
Bahnar: “Bơ̆n tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng wă kơ hơdah, bơ̆n ưh kơ lah tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng 'măn lê̆ tơ rimrôm hnam ôh, dah tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng iŏk reo klơ̆p lê̆. Bơ̆n juăt kơ atol ŭnh kơđeng tơ kơpal jrăng wă kơ bơ̆n 'bôh hơdah jơ̆p-jang.

English: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore, when your eye is good, your whole body also is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your body also is full of darkness.
Bahnar: Măt pơm ŭnh kơđeng kơ akâu bơ̆n. Dah măt bơ̆n hơdah 'lơ̆ng, lei tôm tơdrong akâu bơ̆n jang kư̆m 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n. Dah măt bơ̆n kơnê̆, lei tôm tơdrong akâu bơ̆n jang kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, dang bơ̆n oei lăm măng mu đĕch.

English: Therefore take heed that the light which is in you is not darkness.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei kơchăng hli kơ ŭnh iĕm păt.

English: If then your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, the whole body will be full of light, as when the bright shining of a lamp gives you light.”
Bahnar: Dah akâu bơ̆n jang 'lơ̆ng, ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tŏ sĕt, lei akâu bơ̆n dang jing hơdah 'brach, kư̆m thoi ŭnh kơđeng pơchrang hơdah kơ bơ̆n rang achal.”

English: And as He spoke, a certain Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. So He went in and sat down to eat.
Bahnar: Lăp đang kơ Yêsu pơma boih, đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđê khŭl Pharisi pơtơm Yêsu năm sŏng sa tơ hnam sư, na bre sư mơ̆t tơoei wă sŏng sa.

English: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner.
Bahnar: Bơngai Pharisi ei 'bôh Yêsu ưh kơ ôp ti hơdrol kơ sa kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt đe Juđê pơkă na bơngai Pharisi ei chrêu kơ đon.

English: Then the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees make the outside of the cup and dish clean, but your inward part is full of greed and wickedness.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Lu iĕm bơngai Pharisi hăt hot kơ ôp pơnhan hăm kơchŏk hơdrol kơ sŏng sa khan trŏ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, mă-lei lăm to iĕm 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach, 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pơgâm.

English: Foolish ones! Did not He who made the outside make the inside also?
Bahnar: Ô iĕm bơngai kơhlôh, mă tơ 'ngoaih mă tơ lăm, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing iĕm ngăl dah kiơ?

English: But rather give alms of such things as you have; then indeed all things are clean to you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei asong ăn kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin tơmam sa iĕm lăm pơnhan noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m lăng tôm tơdrong iĕm rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ngăl.

English: “But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass by justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh. Iĕm pơm hăt hot tĕch lu tơmam hơi thoi lĕ kơ hla gơsơ̆m, hla hla-kat, dôm hla 'nhot nai, iŏk jên noh pơm pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei minh lăm mơjĭt. Mă-lei gah tơdrong kăl hloh thoi lĕ kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe păng 'mêm bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơdrong noh iĕm pơm pơhơi, ưh kơ wă. Mă tơdrong iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam hơi noh kư̆m trŏ mơ̆n, mă-lei iĕm athei pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe păng 'mêm bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'noh kăl hloh.

English: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh. Iĕm lăp đon kơ oei tang-dŏ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ bôl buăl lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm kư̆m lăp đon kơ đe chă kơkuh kơ iĕm tơ trong kơchơ.

English: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like graves which are not seen, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them.”
Bahnar: Ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh. Iĕm dang lĕ bơsat juơ, đe ưh kơ băt na đe juă 'bơm kơpal noh. Đe lăng iĕm tơ 'ngoaih thoi lĕ kơ 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei lăm to iĕm kơnê̆.”

English: Then one of the lawyers answered and said to Him, “Teacher, by saying these things You reproach us also.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê oei 'bơ̆t ei, sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih pơma thoi noh Ih kư̆m dang pơjăm nhôn mơ̆n.”

English: And He said, “Woe to you also, lawyers! For you load men with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Ơ lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, ning-mônh iĕm kư̆m pơmat-tat dêh mơ̆n. Lu iĕm pơkă kơ đe lơ tơdrong juăt kiơ̆ kơ lu iĕm tơchĕng kơdih, kư̆m dang lĕ iĕm tơpŭ kơ đe tơmam trăp hloh kơ ai tơ̆p pă kĕ gơrŭn, mă-lei iĕm kơdih kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơgŭm sư hơya tŏ sĕt.

English: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh. Dang ei iĕm pơm chă pơrŏ hơmet ming lu bơsat lu bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, mă-lei lăm to iĕm kư̆m thoi lu đe 'bok iĕm mă pơlôch lu sư sơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: In fact, you bear witness that you approve the deeds of your fathers; for they indeed killed them, and you build their tombs.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆ pơlôch lu sư na iĕm dang ei pơm hơmet ming bơsat lu sư dơ̆ng. Thoi noh iĕm kư̆m băt kơ 'bok iĕm pơlôch lu sư mơ̆n sơ̆ păng iĕm dang khan lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆ pơlôch lu sư khan trŏ.

English: Therefore the wisdom of God also said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei mă hơgei tôm tơdrong khan thoi âu: ‘Inh gô wơh lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Inh păng lu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Inh năm bơtho lu sư, na 'blep kơ lu sư areh pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư phŏ kư̆m pơlôch.’

English: that the blood of all the prophets which was shed from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mă lu 'bok iĕm pơlôch sơ̆, đơ̆ng blŭng-a 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh truh dang ei
