English: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah who perished between the altar and the temple. Yes, I say to you, it shall be required of this generation.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Kain pơlôch Abel truh lu 'bok iĕm pơlôch Sachari tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, yua kơ dôm lu bơngai mă 'bok iĕm pơlôch noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wă phak iĕm hơgop hăm lu sư mơ̆n.

English: “Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in you hindered.”
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ dang ei iĕm ưh kơ wă ăn kơ đe băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'blep. Iĕm dang lĕ đei khuă gơh mơ̆t tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơhrăm tơdrong Sư, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă pơih 'măng mơ̆t kơdih păng kư̆m kuă ăn đe mơ̆t mơ̆n.”

English: And as He said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to assail Him vehemently, and to cross-examine Him about many things
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu lĕch yak đơ̆ng hnam bơngai Pharisi ei, lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai Pharisi areh kơ Sư dêh, na chă jet Sư lơ tơdrong

English: In the meantime, when an innumerable multitude of people had gathered together, so that they trampled one another, He began to say to His disciples first of all, “Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei lơ rơbâu 'nu bơngai akŭm tơ Yêsu truh kơ lu sư mah tơhmĕt tơhmot dih băl. Na Yêsu pơma kơdrô̆ kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơ lu bơngai Pharisi hŏ yua kơ lu sư bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh.

English: For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm tơdrong lu sư wă ôn hrĕp dang ei, đe gô 'bôh ning-mônh.

English: Therefore whatever you have spoken in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong kon bơngai bơ̆n pơma kơdrô̆ dang ei thoi lĕ đe pơma lăm măng mu, mă-lei ning-mônh đe gô băt đĭ. Dôm tơdrong kon bơngai bơ̆n pơma lăm anih kơdrô̆ dang ei, ning-mônh đe gô pơma 'bơ̆r re đơ̆ng pra hnam, wă tơbăt kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai.

English: “And I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'nhŏng oh, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli kơ đe mă gơh pơlôch akâu iĕm đĕch.

English: But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear Him who, after He has killed, has power to cast into hell; yes, I say to you, fear Him!
Bahnar: Iĕm athei hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă gơh pơlôch akâu iĕm păng gơh hơtat iĕm tơ dơnâu ŭnh. Minh 'nu 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch iĕm athei hli yom.

English: “Are not five sparrows sold for two copper coins? And not one of them is forgotten before God.
Bahnar: “Bơ̆n kư̆m băt sem rĕch tĕch reh dêh, pơđăm tŏ lăp 'bar hlak jên. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wei rong lu sư ưh kơ hiơt ôh.

English: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows.
Bahnar: Mă sŏk bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m jô̆ băt tôm. Thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli. 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ iĕm hloh kơ sư 'mêm kơ sem rĕch.

English: “Also I say to you, whoever confesses Me before men, him the Son of Man also will confess before the angels of God.
Bahnar: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bu roi kơ đe khan sư lui kơ Inh, ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai kư̆m gô roi kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai noh sư lui kơ Inh tơpă mơ̆n.

English: But he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bu hli kơ đe, mơlâu kơ đe na sư khan sư ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, Inh kư̆m gô roi kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai noh ưh kơ lui kơ Inh.

English: “And anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but to him who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven.
Bahnar: “Bu pơjăm Inh Kon Bơngai, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ sư ôh. Mă-lei bơngai bu pơma kơnê̆ kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, 'Bok Kei-Dei oei jô̆ khŏm khŏm.

English: “Now when they bring you to the synagogues and magistrates and authorities, do not worry about how or what you should answer, or what you should say.
Bahnar: “Mưh đe rôp iĕm wă sek tơlang iĕm tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê, dah pơjao iĕm kơ lu 'bok tih sek tơlang, lei iĕm 'nĕ mah tơchĕng kơ tơdrong iĕm wă pơma dŏng akâu iĕm kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư hŏ

English: For the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say.”
Bahnar: yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng gô tơgŭm iĕm kơplah iĕm wă pơma.”

English: Then one from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu oei lăm tŏk-bŏk đe tơpôl jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, apinh Ih bơtho 'nhŏng inh wă kơ sư dô̆ asong inh tơmam 'bă nhi sơ̆.”

English: But He said to him, “Man, who made Me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ bơngai ah, bu ăn kơ Inh pơm kră sek tơlang wă dô̆ asong mŭk biĕm?”

English: And He said to them, “Take heed and beware of covetousness, for one’s life does not consist in the abundance of the things he possesses.”
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma dơ̆ng kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai kiơ̆ ei: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih 'nĕ kơ mah hăt kơ mŭk tơmam dêh. Arih chơt hiôk ưh kơ đơ̆ng mơdrŏng ôh.”

English: Then He spoke a parable to them, saying: “The ground of a certain rich man yielded plentifully.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư khan kơ đe thoi âu wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong 'noh hei: “Minh 'nu bơngai đei mir să, trŏ bơyan 'ba, sư đei 'ba lơ tơpă.

English: And he thought within himself, saying, ‘What shall I do, since I have no room to store my crops?’
Bahnar: Na tơ'ngla sư tơchĕng kơdih khan: ‘Inh wă pơm thoi yơ kih, anih mong 'ba ưh kơ mah thoi âu?’

English: So he said, ‘I will do this: I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there I will store all my crops and my goods.
Bahnar: Sư khan: ‘Inh wă yuih pơk 'ba inh so âu, na pơm ming plơ̆ng mă tih hloh dơ̆ng. Klaih kơ noh na inh tah akŭm đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam păng 'ba inh.

English: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years; take your ease; eat, drink, and be merry.” ’
Bahnar: Lăp inh pơm đang boih, inh wă khan kơ inh kơdih thoi âu: Inh đei mŭk drăm lơ wă 'măn lê̆ kơ đunh sơnăm. Inh pơdơh bĕ, sŏng sa nhă đak phĭ mah rơkah rơkai, hiôk boih inh.’

English: But God said to him, ‘Fool! This night your soul will be required of you; then whose will those things be which you have provided?’
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ bơngai ei: ‘Ơ bơngai kơhlôh, măng kơnh boih Inh wă iŏk Bơhngol ih, đơ̆ng noh na ih lôch hloi măng kơnh. Mŭk tơmam ih wă ăn ngôi kơ đe iŏk đĕch.’ ”

English: “So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Tơdrong âu wă pơtih gia kơ dôm lu bơngai hăt kơ mŭk tơmam ala teh, ưh kơ wă tơchĕng gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then He said to His disciples, “Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; nor about the body, what you will put on.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh wă khan kơ iĕm: 'Nĕ tơchĕng gah tơmam sŏng sa, 'nĕ kơ tơchĕng kơ hơbĕn ao hrŭk.

English: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơjing iĕm arih, Sư kư̆m băt ăn kơ iĕm tơmam sa mơ̆n, Sư kư̆m băt ăn kơ iĕm hơbĕn ao hrŭk mơ̆n.

English: Consider the ravens, for they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor barn; and God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds?
Bahnar: Iĕm lăng sem ak, sư ưh kơ đei pơtăm 'ba, ưh kơ đei kĕch 'măn lê̆ tơ pơk ôh, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m oei hiĕm 'me sư mơ̆n. Pơma kiơ kơ iĕm, 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ iĕm hloh kơ lu sem păr tơpă.

English: And which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?
Bahnar: Iĕm tơchĕng dêh gah tơdrong arih, mă iĕm nŏng tơchĕng dang yơ gah tơdrong arih noh ră, kư̆m ưh kơ đei yua tơgŭm iĕm arih đunh 'biơ̆ hơya minh năr ôh.

English: If you then are not able to do the least, why are you anxious for the rest?
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng iĕm nŏng kơ tơchĕng dang noh ră mă-lei ưh kơ tơgŭm iĕm arih đunh 'biơ̆ hơya minh năr, lei iĕm mah nŏng kơ kiơ kơ tơchĕng gah tơdrong nai dơ̆ng.

English: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin; and yet I say to you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
Bahnar: Iĕm lăng lu pơkao 'nhĕt tơ bri brah. Sư ưh kơ bơ̆jang, sư ưh kơ tanh sĭt hơbĕn ao sư kơdih ôh, mă-lei bơ̆n lăng sư 'lơ̆ng dêh. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, pơtao Sôlômôn sơ̆ sư mơdrŏng tih tơpă mă-lei hơbĕn ao sư ưh kơ mah 'lơ̆ng tơ̆l dang pơkao 'nhĕt bri brah ôh.

English: If then God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?
Bahnar: Tơdrong lui iĕm rơdu dêh. Iĕm kuă kơ kiơ tơchĕng kơ lu pơkao 'nhĕt bri brah, sư 'bônh kơ hơlŭng, klaih hơlŭng đe soh hŭt lê̆ lăm ŭnh. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ăn kơ sư 'lơ̆ng dang noh, pơma kiơ kơ iĕm kon bơngai kăl hloh kơ sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm hơbĕn ao tơpă.

English: “And do not seek what you should eat or what you should drink, nor have an anxious mind.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă tơchĕng khan: Bơ̆n wă sa kiơ, nhă kiơ? Iĕm 'nĕ kơ mah hăt kơ tơdrong noh.

English: For all these things the nations of the world seek after, and your Father knows that you need these things.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai mă ưh kơ lui, lu sư tơchĕng kơ tơdrong noh ling-lang. Mă-lei 'Bă bơ̆n kư̆m băt boih dôm tơdrong lu iĕm kăl yua, Sư gô tơgŭm iĕm tơpă.

English: But seek the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added to you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh iĕm athei ăn kơ Sư pơgơ̆r iĕm hơdrol 'mơ̆i na đơ̆ng noh Sư gô tơgŭm iĕm tôm tơmam iĕm kăl yua.

English: “Do not fear, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, iĕm bơngai kơtuei ră, mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, yua kơ 'Bă bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ iĕm gơh pơgơ̆r đe ning-mônh.

English: Sell what you have and give alms; provide yourselves money bags which do not grow old, a treasure in the heavens that does not fail, where no thief approaches nor moth destroys.
Bahnar: Tĕch tơmam iĕm na tơgŭm lu bơngai dơnuh hin, na iĕm gô đei jên mă huay kơ hiong hiach oei 'măn lê̆ kơ iĕm tơ plĕnh ti. Tơ ei ưh kơ đei bơngai bu mă gơh tơtông iŏk dơ̆ng ôh. Tơ ei mua kư̆m ưh kơ gơh reh ngơ̆r tơmam iĕm mơ̆n.

English: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm đei mŭk tơmam tơ plĕnh ti, jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm kư̆m tơchĕng tơ noh mơ̆n. Dah iĕm đei mŭk tơmam tơ teh âu, jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm kư̆m tơchĕng tơ teh âu mơ̆n.

English: “Let your waist be girded and your lamps burning
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei kơchăng ling-lang thoi lĕ bơngai oei chang gô đe truh kơmăng. Sư đĭ hrŭk hơmet hơbĕn ao boih. Ŭnh kơđeng sư oei khơ̆ng.

English: and you yourselves be like men who wait for their master, when he will return from the wedding, that when he comes and knocks they may open to him immediately.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơchăng thoi lĕ lu đĭch đam kơchăng kơ yŏng sư wih đơ̆ng sŏng sa đơ̆ng hnam đe et pơkong, na lăp sư dơdŭ 'măng lu sư pơih kơ sư hloi.

English: Blessed are those servants whom the master, when he comes, will find watching. Assuredly, I say to you that he will gird himself and have them sit down to eat, and will come and serve them.
Bahnar: Dôm lu đĭch đam mă oei kral gô yŏng sư, ưh kơ tep, na yŏng sư 'mêm tơpă. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yŏng sư kơdih kư̆m gô awih ăn kơ lu đĭch đam sư tơmam sa dơ̆ng mơ̆n.
Dah yŏng sư wih kơplah tŏk-bŏk măng dah kơplah leng gong, mă-lei lu sư oei kral gô, na yŏng sư bơnê kơ lu sư tơpă.

English: But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơchăng hli kơ thoi bơngai âu: Bơngai âu sư ưh kơ kơchăng kơ đe wă tơtông tơmam sư. Lăp đe tơtông tơmam sư boih na sư khan: ‘Ô, ăn dah băt kơ đe wă tơtông tơmam inh măng hei, lei inh kral kơchăng kuă ăn lu sư bŏk tơnăr hnam inh ôh.’

English: Therefore you also be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng 'nĕ kơ thoi bơngai noh, hli kơ Inh Kon Bơngai wă jur tơ iĕm dơ̆ng kơplah iĕm ưh kơ lêng ê.”

English: Then Peter said to Him, “Lord, do You speak this parable only to us, or to all people?”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih pơtih gia noh kơ nhôn đĕch dah Ih pơtih gia noh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai?”

English: And the Lord said, “Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his master will make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of food in due season?
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan: “Bơngai đĭch, sư athei jang tơnăp kiơ̆ thoi yŏng sư pơkă, na yŏng sư lăp đon. Na yŏng sư pơjao ăn kơ sư pơm kai wei-lăng lu buăl sư dơ̆ng, na mưh trŏ kơ jơ sŏng sa na sư chă asong kơ lu buăl sư tơmam sa.

English: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
Bahnar: Lăp yŏng lu sư wih 'bôh bơngai kai mă đêl sư pơjao athei wei-lăng lu đĭch đam sư noh jang kiơ̆ kơ sư pơkă, na sư bơnê. Thoi noh na bơngai kai, jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk tơpă.

English: Truly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all that he has.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yŏng sư gô ăn kơ sư wei-lăng đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam yŏng sư hloi.

English: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master is delaying his coming,’ and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and be drunk
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bơngai kai noh tơchĕng lăm to sư kơdih khan: Yŏng inh wă wih oei đunh, na bơngai kai noh chă tôn teh lu bôl buăl sư mă drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, na sư sa et tơ̆p suai

English: the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in two and appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
Bahnar: na yŏng sư gô wih kơplah sư ưh kơ kơchăng, tabơla haih pă tam boih. Na yŏng sư gô phak pơlôch sư, ăn kơ sư oei hơdai hăm dôm lu bơngai pơm ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: And that servant who knew his master’s will, and did not prepare himself or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
Bahnar: “Dôm lu đĭch đam mă băt kơ nơ̆r yŏng sư ată ră, mă-lei sư ưh kơ kơchăng păng ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆, na yŏng sư gô tôn teh sư kơtang tơpă.

English: But he who did not know, yet committed things deserving of stripes, shall be beaten with few. For everyone to whom much is given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been committed, of him they will ask the more.
Bahnar: Dôm lu đĭch đam mă ưh kơ băt kơ nơ̆r yŏng sư ată, na ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆, yŏng sư kư̆m gô tôn teh mơ̆n, mă-lei lăp lăp 'biơ̆. Bơngai bu yŏng sư ăn jang tih hloh kơ đe, bơngai noh, dah sư ưh kơ chu, yŏng sư gô phak sư kơtang hloh kơ đe.

English: “I came to send fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!
Bahnar: “Dang ei Inh jur dang lĕ wă soh teh âu, na Inh ưh kơ hiôk tơ̆p truh ŭnh sa.

English: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am till it is accomplished!
Bahnar: Inh gô đei tơdrong lôch pơmat, na jơhngơ̆m Inh ưh kơ hiôk tơ̆p hloh kơ năr Inh 'nei 'mơ̆i na Inh hiôk.

English: Do you suppose that I came to give peace on earth? I tell you, not at all, but rather division.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng Inh jur tơ teh âu na kon bơngai wă jing hiôk-hian hloi, ưh pă tơblah boih. Ưh ôh. Inh jur tơ teh âu na kon bơngai wă tơklah dih băl.

English: For from now on five in one house will be divided: three against two, and two against three.
Bahnar: Pơtih gia lăm minh pôm hnam dơnŏ pơđăm 'nu bơngai, đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp lu sư gô tơklah dih băl. Lu sư pêng 'nu ưh kơ lui kơ Inh gô areh kơ 'bar 'nu mă lui kơ Inh.

English: Father will be divided against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
Bahnar: Pơtih gia lu sư gô tơklah dih băl thoi âu: 'Bă sư mă ưh kơ lui kơ Inh gô areh kơ kon sư mă lui kơ Inh; phŏ kon sư ưh kơ lui kư̆m gô areh kơ 'bă sư mă lui. Mĕ sư mă ưh kơ lui gô areh kơ kon sư mă lui; phŏ kon sư ưh kơ lui gô areh kơ mĕ sư mă lui. Tơnei sư mă ưh kơ lui gô areh kơ mai sư yua kơ sư lui kơ Inh; phŏ mai sư mă ưh kơ lui gô areh kơ tơnei sư mă lui.”

English: Then He also said to the multitudes, “Whenever you see a cloud rising out of the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming’; and so it is.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai tơpôl: “Lăp iĕm 'bôh hơmơ̆l đơ̆ng bơmơ̆t kial thu tơ hơlĕch, 'noh iĕm băt kơ wă jê̆ 'mi boih, na 'blep tơpă.

English: And when you see the south wind blow, you say, ‘There will be hot weather’; and there is.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng iĕm 'bôh kial đơ̆ng gơal thu hơlơ̆k tơ yă-nơ̆m na iĕm băt kơ 'năr gô tŏ tơpă, na 'blep kiơ̆ ei tơpă.

English: Hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky and of the earth, but how is it you do not discern this time?
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai hơlĕnh, iĕm kơnăl kơ plĕnh wă 'mi dah 'năr wă tŏ ră, mă-lei liơ iĕm pơm ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm dang ei ră?

English: “Yes, and why, even of yourselves, do you not judge what is right?
Bahnar: “Liơ iĕm ưh kơ gơh tơchĕng kơdih wă kơ băt tơdrong trŏ, tơdrong glăi?

English: When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, make every effort along the way to settle with him, lest he drag you to the judge, the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
Bahnar: Dah đe năm apinh tơmam đêl iĕm hre kơ đe, na iĕm jah pơđang tơdrong hre noh hloi, 'nĕ kơ gô sư anhăk iĕm tơ 'bok sek tơlang, hli kơ đe gô rôp tah iĕm tơ hnam phak.

English: I tell you, you shall not depart from there till you have paid the very last mite.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đe oei phak iĕm khŏm khŏm 'mơ̆i, tơ̆p iĕm chu duh tôm 'mơ̆i, na đe tơlĕch tơlăi iĕm.”

English: There were present at that season some who told Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei đei lu bơngai năm tơ noh roi kơ Yêsu tơdrong Pilat pơlôch lu bơngai Galilê kơplah lu sư oei sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Do you suppose that these Galileans were worse sinners than all other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm tơchĕng lu bơngai Galilê lôch thoi noh yua kơ lu sư bơngai yoch hloh 'biơ̆ kơ tơduă lu sư bơngai Galilê dah kiơ?

English: I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ ôh. Mă-lei dah lu iĕm ưh kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, lei đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm kư̆m lôch lei-lăi thoi lu sư mơ̆n ning-mônh.

English: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, do you think that they were worse sinners than all other men who dwelt in Jerusalem?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia dơ̆ng, lu mơjĭt-tơhngam 'nu mă lôch kơ hnam kơjung tơgơ̆ sơ̆ jê̆ đak dơnâu Silôm, iĕm tơchĕng lu sư bơngai yoch hloh 'biơ̆ kơ tơduă lu sư bơngai Jêrusalem dah kiơ?

English: I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish.”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ ôh. Mă-lei dah lu iĕm ưh kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, lei đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm kư̆m lôch lei-lăi thoi lu sư mơ̆n ning-mônh.”

English: He also spoke this parable: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it and found none.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak dah bơ̆n ưh kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai rong minh tơnơm 'long hơra lăm pơgar sư. Na tơ'ngla sư năm chă lăng plei mă-lei 'nhŏ kơ đei.

English: Then he said to the keeper of his vineyard, ‘Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree and find none. Cut it down; why does it use up the ground?’
Bahnar: Na sư khan kơ bơngai wei-lăng pơgar sư noh thoi âu: ‘Pêng sơnăm kơ 'nâu boih tơm hơra inh âu 'nhŏ kơ mă đei plei 'biơ̆. Dang ei inh wă kơ ih kăl tŭk ăn kơ inh đĕch, pih pang lăp hrăt kơ pơgar đĕch.’

English: But he answered and said to him, ‘Sir, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.
Bahnar: Na bơngai wei-lăng pơgar sư noh khan: ‘Ơ 'bok ah, sơnăm âu ba lê̆ kơ tam kăl 'mơ̆i, gô lăng inh sir hơbong tăp dăr wă tuh ĭch rơmo 'mơ̆i.

English: And if it bears fruit, well. But if not, after that you can cut it down.’ ”
Bahnar: Dah sư plei sơnăm anăp, lei lê̆. Dah ưh, ba kăl tŭk đĕch.’ ”

English: Now He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ei Yêsu bơtho tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê.

English: And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bent over and could in no way raise herself up.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam akŭm ei đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn yang mơ̆t pơm kơ sư jĭ đĭ mơjĭt-tơhngam sơnăm boih, na sư jing kơdŭ grŏn pơm kơ sư pă gơh dơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: But when Jesus saw her, He called her to Him and said to her, “Woman, you are loosed from your infirmity.”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu 'bôh bơngai drŏ-kăn ei, Sư khan: “Ơ yă, Inh pơklaih ih boih.”

English: And He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu pel hloi akâu sư na kơtă ei 'mrah jing gơh dơ̆ng tơpăt hloi. Na sư hloi pơma pơư pơang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath; and he said to the crowd, “There are six days on which men ought to work; therefore come and be healed on them, and not on the Sabbath day.”
Bahnar: Kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm ei 'bôh thoi noh na sư hil dêh yua kơ Yêsu pơklaih đe lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat wă khan năr giĕng. Na 'bok ei khan kơ lu kon pơlei pơla mă oei akŭm 'bơ̆t ei thoi âu: “Lăm minh 'măng giĕng đei tơdrâu năr bơ̆n gơh jang, iĕm athei năm tơ âu ming akâu iĕm lăm tơdrâu năr ei đĕch. Iĕm ưh kơ gơh ming akâu iĕm lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ôh.”

English: The Lord then answered him and said, “Hypocrite! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath loose his ox or donkey from the stall, and lead it away to water it?
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu tơl 'bok ei: “Ơ lu bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, lăm năr pơdơh đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm yaih tơlĕch rơmo aseh iĕ iĕm puh pơnhă sư tơ đak.

English: So ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound—think of it—for eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai drŏ-kăn âu, sư kư̆m kon sâu Abraham thoi bơ̆n mơ̆n, mă-lei yang Satan dang kron sư ki mơjĭt-tơhngam sơnăm boih. Na Inh wă tơlĕch sư lăm năr pơdơh kư̆m trŏ tơpă.”

English: And when He said these things, all His adversaries were put to shame; and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu tơl thoi noh na lu bơngai mă areh kơ Yêsu mơlâu, mă-lei lu kon pơlei pơla chơt hiôk yua kơ 'bôh Sư pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang mơnat kơ lu sư.

English: Then He said, “What is the kingdom of God like? And to what shall I compare it?
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi yơ? Bơ̆n chă tơdrong kiơ wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong noh?

English: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and put in his garden; and it grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r thoi lĕ găr sơ'bei iĕ ioch đe pơtăm tơ pơgar. Na lăp sư chăt boih, sư jing tih thoi lĕ minh tơnơm tơm 'long, na sem gơh pơm tơpu tơ dơng sư.”

English: And again He said, “To what shall I liken the kingdom of God?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Bơ̆n chă tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng wă pơtih gia kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai?

English: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till it was all leavened.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi lĕ kơ 'buih pông. Minh 'nu drŏ-kăn iŏk 'buih pông tŏ sĕt đĕch, bơlŭ păng tơpŭng mi minh kơthŭng, na tơpŭng noh kư̆m pông pơđĭ kơ minh kơthŭng noh mơ̆n.”

English: And He went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, Sư drong bơtho rah pơlei đe kiơ̆ trong Sư yak tơ ei.

English: Then one said to Him, “Lord, are there few who are saved?” And He said to them
Bahnar: Đei bơngai jet Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, bơngai gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch dah kiơ?” Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư

English: “Strive to enter through the narrow gate, for many, I say to you, will seek to enter and will not be able.
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei adrin mơ̆t trong 'măng iĕ bĕ yua kơ đei lơ bơngai nŏng wă mơ̆t ră ưh kơ gơh.

English: When once the Master of the house has risen up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open for us,’ and He will answer and say to you, ‘I do not know you, where you are from,’
Bahnar: Pơtih gia Inh mă 'Bok tơ'ngla hnam gô tang lê̆ 'măng, na lăp iĕm dơ̆ng dơdŭ 'măng 'bơ̆t 'ngoaih khan: ‘Ơ 'Bok, pơih ăn kơ nhôn 'măng,’ na Inh khan: ‘Inh ưh kơ băt iĕm đơ̆ng yơ.’

English: then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in Your presence, and You taught in our streets.’
Bahnar: Na iĕm khan tơwih kơ Inh dơ̆ng: ‘Nhôn bơngai đơ̆ng đêl sŏng sa păng Ih lah. Ih kư̆m bơtho tơ pơlei nhôn.’

English: But He will say, ‘I tell you I do not know you, where you are from. Depart from Me, all you workers of iniquity.’
Bahnar: Na Inh tơl tơwih dơ̆ng: ‘Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh kơ băt kơ lu iĕm ôh. Weh tơ nai năm, iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ ngăl.’

English: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and yourselves thrust out.
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm gô hmoi tơkăp hơnĕnh pơmat-tat, yua kơ iĕm gô 'bôh Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ning-mônh, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ gơh năm tơ ei ôh.

English: They will come from the east and the west, from the north and the south, and sit down in the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei ning-mônh gô đei lơ bơngai ưh kơ sĭ khŭl iĕm Juđê đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang teh đak, đơ̆ng hơlĕch, đơ̆ng bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m, đơ̆ng gơal, na lu sư oei sŏng sa hơdai tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And indeed there are last who will be first, and there are first who will be last.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đei lu bơngai mơ'nah pơm iĕ kơ đe dang ei, sư jing tih hloh kơ đe 'bơ̆t ei ning-mônh. Đei lu bơngai mơ'nah pơm tih hloh kơ đe dang ei, sư gô jing lŭch hloh kơ đe ning-mônh.”

English: On that very day some Pharisees came, saying to Him, “Get out and depart from here, for Herod wants to kill You.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho 'bơ̆t ei đei lu bơngai Pharisi năm tơ Sư păng khan: “Ih athei weh tơ nai yua kơ Hêrôt wă chă pơlôch Ih.”

English: And He said to them, “Go, tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.’
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Iĕm jah năm tơ 'bok hơlĕnh pơdăr noh khan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Năr âu păng dơning Inh chă pơpuh yang kơnê̆ păng chă pơklaih đe jĭ jăn. Na năr dơmônh Inh đang tơdrong jang Inh boih.’

English: Nevertheless I must journey today, tomorrow, and the day following; for it cannot be that a prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: “Mă năr âu, năr dơning, năr dơmônh Inh khŏm năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem 'mơ̆i. Lu nhôn bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khŏm lôch kơ bơngai Pơlei Jêrusalem pơlôch ngăl.

English: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, but you were not willing!
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai Pơlei Jêrusalem, iĕm pơlôch kơ kiơ lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơtruh nơ̆r Sư kơ iĕm, iĕm iŏk tơmo klơ̆m pơlôch lu sư? Inh lung iĕm năm akŭm tơ Inh lơ wơ̆t boih ră, dang iĕr krao kon sư wă krôp ră, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ năm.

English: See! Your house is left to you desolate; and assuredly, I say to you, you shall not see Me until the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă achăng tŭk pơlei iĕm boih. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, iĕm pă 'bôh muh măt Inh boih tơ̆p truh năr Inh jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh na iĕm khan: ‘Ư-ang kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh jur tơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng.’ ”

English: Now it happened, as He went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees to eat bread on the Sabbath, that they watched Him closely.
Bahnar: Năr pơdơh Sa'bat ei Yêsu năm sŏng sa tơ hnam minh 'nu bơngai pơm kră kơ lu bơngai khŭl Pharisi. Na đe lăng Yêsu hnhong.

English: And behold, there was a certain man before Him who had dropsy.
Bahnar: Pă 'biơ̆ kơ 'nei 'bôh blư kơ minh 'nu bơngai jĭ pơpông năm tơ Yêsu.

English: And Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet hloi lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu bơngai Pharisi thoi âu: “Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n, bơ̆n hăm gơh pơklaih đe jĭ jăn lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ưh?”

English: But they kept silent. And He took him and healed him, and let him go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei thĕng kơ lu sư. Na Yêsu pơklaih hloi bơngai jĭ ei, na athei sư brŏk.

English: Then He answered them, saying, “Which of you, having a donkey or an ox that has fallen into a pit, will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu khan kơ lu đe ei: “Dah iĕm đei kon iĕm dah rơmo iĕm huŏng tơ sơlŭng đak lăm năr pơdơh, iĕm jur iŏk sư lăm năr pơdơh hloi mơ̆n dah kiơ?”

English: And they could not answer Him regarding these things.
Bahnar: Na hreh kơ lu sư pă gơh drơ̆ng.

English: So He told a parable to those who were invited, when He noted how they chose the best places, saying to them
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư wă tơoei sŏng sa, Yêsu 'bôh lu bơngai tơmoi chă lăng anih wă tơoei, lu sư mơ'nah pơm chă anih 'lơ̆ng 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆. Na Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ đĭ-đăng lu sư thoi âu

English: “When you are invited by anyone to a wedding feast, do not sit down in the best place, lest one more honorable than you be invited by him
Bahnar: “Dah đe wơ̆n iĕm năm sŏng sa lăm năr đe et pơkong, iĕm 'nĕ kơ chă tơoei anih rŏ rŏ hŏ, hli kơ đe wơ̆n bơngai pơm tih hloh kơ iĕm

English: and he who invited you and him come and say to you, ‘Give place to this man,’ and then you begin with shame to take the lowest place.
Bahnar: na tơ'ngla mă wơ̆n iĕm noh hei năm khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: ‘Iĕm ăn kơ 'bok âu oei 'bơ̆t âu 'biơ̆.’ Na đơ̆ng noh iĕm mơlâu tơpă na iĕm oei oăi anih lŭch dơ̆ng kơ đe.

English: But when you are invited, go and sit down in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes he may say to you, ‘Friend, go up higher.’ Then you will have glory in the presence of those who sit at the table with you.
Bahnar: “Dah đe wơ̆n iĕm sŏng sa, iĕm athei chă anih mă lŭch kơ đe hŏ, na tơ'ngla wơ̆n iĕm noh sư gô năm tơ iĕm păng khan: ‘Ơ ma, ih năm oei anih 'lơ̆ng to bĕ.’ Thoi noh na lu đe tơmoi nai kư̆m gô bơnê kơ iĕm mơ̆n.

English: For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai bu pơang akâu kơdih, sư gô mơlâu. Bơngai bu ưh kơ hơnhŏ, sư 'noh boih đe gô pôk pơư kơ sư.”

English: Then He also said to him who invited Him, “When you give a dinner or a supper, do not ask your friends, your brothers, your relatives, nor rich neighbors, lest they also invite you back, and you be repaid.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu khan kơ bơngai wơ̆n sư ei: “Dah ih chă wơ̆n đe năm sŏng sa tơ hnam ih, ih 'nĕ kơ wơ̆n lu 'nhŏng oh, lu bôl juăt ih, lu bôl ih bơngai mơdrŏng hŏ, yua kơ lu sư gô wơ̆n plơ̆ ih dơ̆ng, na ih dang lĕ ưh kơ đei huach tơmam kiơ ôh.

English: But when you give a feast, invite the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind.
Bahnar: Dah ih chă wơ̆n đe năm sŏng sa tơ hnam ih, lei ih athei wơ̆n lu bơngai dơnuh hin, lu bơngai jơ̆ng jo go kơdŭ, lu bơngai măt tol.

English: And you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you; for you shall be repaid at the resurrection of the just.”
Bahnar: Na ih gô hiôk yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ gơh wơ̆n hơlơ̆k kơ ih dơ̆ng ôh. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah ih lăm năr lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng iung arih dơ̆ng ning-mônh.”

English: Now when one of those who sat at the table with Him heard these things, he said to Him, “Blessed is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
Bahnar: Lăm minh 'nu mă oei sŏng sa hơdai Yêsu kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na khan kơ Yêsu: “Dôm lu bơ̆n mă sŏng sa tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ning-mônh, hiôk dêh yơh.”

English: Then He said to him, “A certain man gave a great supper and invited many
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai wơ̆n đe sŏng sa tih tơ hnam sư. Sư wơ̆n lơ bơngai tơpă.

English: and sent his servant at supper time to say to those who were invited, ‘Come, for all things are now ready.’
Bahnar: Lăp hơmet wă jê̆ đang boih, na tơ'ngla sư 'nei wơh đam sư chă pơtruh kơ lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n noh hei khan: ‘Năm bĕ lu iĕm, tơmam sa hơmet đĭ đang boih.’

English: But they all with one accord began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a piece of ground, and I must go and see it. I ask you to have me excused.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei đĭ-đăng lu sư pơm ưh kơ wăn ngăl. Bơngai blŭng-a sư khan tơwih kơ đam tơ'ngla tơm sŏng sa 'nei thoi âu: ‘Inh ưh kơ gơh năm yua kơ inh 'nao răt mir, na inh wă năm lăng mir inh 'nei 'mơ̆i. Inh dang ưh kơ chu ih ho.’

English: And another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to test them. I ask you to have me excused.’
Bahnar: Đei bơngai nai dơ̆ng khan: ‘Inh 'nao răt pơđăm agrop rơmo, dang ei inh wă rơuơ lăng 'mơ̆i. Ih 'nĕ kơ jô̆ yo kơ inh ưh kơ wăn ho.’

English: Still another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.’
Bahnar: Đei bơngai nai dơ̆ng khan: ‘Inh 'nao đei akăn na inh ưh kơ wăn.’

English: So that servant came and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in here the poor and the maimed and the lame and the blind.’
Bahnar: “Đam 'nei brŏk brăi tơ hnam na sư roi kơ tơ'ngla sư dôm tơdrong 'nei. Na tơ'ngla sư kơtơ̆ng thoi ei, sư 'blut tơpă, na sư khan hloi kơ đam sư: ‘Ih dah chă năm rim kơ trong jơ̆p lăm pơlei âu chă krao wơ̆n lu bơngai dơnuh hin, lu bơngai jơ̆ng jo go kơdŭ, lu bơngai măt tol, tĕnh.’

English: And the servant said, ‘Master, it is done as you commanded, and still there is room.’
Bahnar: Na đam 'nei hơloh yak chă krao đe hloi. Lăp chă krao đe đang boih na sư wih tơ hnam khan kơ tơ'ngla sư 'nei: ‘Ơ 'bok, inh chă krao lu đe noh hei boih, đĭ-đăng lu sư năm boih ră, mă-lei anih oei rơhơi 'mơ̆i.’

English: Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
Bahnar: Na tơ'ngla sư 'nei khan kơ đam sư thoi âu dơ̆ng: ‘Ih lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei âu, ih chă năm jơ̆p kơ trong mă tơ yơ yơ, ih tơ'bơ̆p bu bu, ih dui pơđĭ kơ lu sư tơ âu tơ̆p mă 'bĕnh kơ hnam inh 'mơ̆i.

English: For I say to you that none of those men who were invited shall taste my supper.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dôm lu bơngai mă inh wă wơ̆n hơdrol hei ră, lu sư ưh kơ đei bu gơh sa tơmam inh ôh.’ ”

English: Now great multitudes went with Him. And He turned and said to them
Bahnar: Đei tơpôl lơ tơpă yak kiơ̆ Yêsu. Na Yêsu hue tơ lu sư păng khan

English: “If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he cannot be My disciple.
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ Inh, mă-lei sư 'mêm kơ mĕ 'bă sư, kon akăn sư, 'nhŏng oh sư hloh kơ sư 'mêm kơ Inh păng sư 'mêm kơ akâu sư kơdih, lei sư ưh kơ gơh jing bơngai kiơ̆ Inh ôh.

English: And whoever does not bear his cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu tôi 'long pơglang sư kơdih lôch kiơ̆ Inh, bơngai ei ưh kơ gơh jing bơngai kiơ̆ Inh ôh.

English: For which of you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down first and count the cost, whether he has enough to finish it
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia dah iĕm wă pơm hnam tih kơjung, lei iĕm athei tơchĕng lăng hơdrol 'mơ̆i wă kơ băt huach dôm yơ, hli kơ jên iĕm ưh kơ mah kơ wă pơm.

English: lest, after he has laid the foundation, and is not able to finish, all who see it begin to mock him
Bahnar: Dah iĕm ưh kơ đei tơchĕng hơdrol kơ pơm, na iĕm kư̆ kơ mă pơm đĕch, lei hli kơ iĕm kư̆ kơ tơiung đĕch, mă-lei ưh kơ pơkeh, na đĭ-đăng bơngai lu mă 'bôh hnam iĕm noh gô hiĕk achơ̆ kơ iĕm khan

English: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish’?
Bahnar: ‘Bơngai âu kư̆ kơ mă tơiung hnam sư đĕch, mă-lei ưh kơ đei tơmam wă pơkeh.’

English: Or what king, going to make war against another king, does not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia dơ̆ng, dah đei minh 'nu 'bok pơtao anhăk ba mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu linh sư wă năm blah păng pơtao đe ayăt, na gah đe ayăt wă năm blah sư mơ̆n, lu linh đe ayăt dang 'bar-jĭt rơbâu, na 'bok pơtao ei athei tơchĕng hơdrol 'mơ̆i lu linh sư hăm kĕ ưh.

English: Or else, while the other is still a great way off, he sends a delegation and asks conditions of peace.
Bahnar: Dah sư tơchĕng ưh kơ kĕ ôh, lei lăp linh đe ayăt oei ataih, sư gô wơh linh sư năm tơ'bơ̆p pơtao đe ayăt, lung sư wă huay kơ tơblah.

English: So likewise, whoever of you does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, iĕm athei tơchĕng hơdrol 'mơ̆i, yua kơ bơngai bu ưh kơ tŭk dôm tơdrong sư kơdih, bơngai ei ưh kơ gơh jing bơngai kiơ̆ Inh ôh.

English: “Salt is good; but if the salt has lost its flavor, how shall it be seasoned?
Bahnar: “'Boh boih tơmam 'lơ̆ng dêh, mă-lei dah 'boh jing sap, lei bơ̆n ưh kơ đei kiơ wă pơm kơ sư 'băt dơ̆ng.

English: It is neither fit for the land nor for the dunghill, but men throw it out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n ưh pă gơh yua sư boih, mă tơ mir mă yua wă bơlŭ kơ ĭch rơmo. Na bơ̆n jing hŭt lê̆ đĕch. Dah iĕm đei đon, pơwao wăi.”

English: Then all the tax collectors and the sinners drew near to Him to hear Him.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ păng lơ bơngai yoch năm mơ̆ng Yêsu.

English: And the Pharisees and scribes complained, saying, “This Man receives sinners and eats with them.”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê chă mơmơnh khan: “Bơngai âu pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai yoch mơ̆ng sư bơtho, kư̆m sŏng sa hơdai hăm sư mơ̆n.”

English: So He spoke this parable to them, saying
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu pơma thoi âu

English: “What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he loses one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia iĕm đei minh-hrĕng tŏ triu, na hiong minh pôm. Hăm trŏ kơ iĕm lê̆ tơsĭn-jĭt tơsĭn tŏ triu noh oei chă sa tơ tơmăn, na iĕm khŏm năm chă minh pôm hiong noh tơ̆p 'bôh 'mơ̆i?

English: And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
Bahnar: Na mưh iĕm chă 'bôh boih iĕm hiôk tơpă, iĕm tôi sư tơ sơngiĕng

English: And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
Bahnar: brŏk tơ hnam. Đơ̆ng noh iĕm krao lu bôl buăl iĕm na khan: ‘Inh hiôk tơpă 'bôh triu inh mă đêl hiong boih ră.’

English: I say to you that likewise there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine just persons who need no repentance.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơ plĕnh, lu sư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai yoch tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch sư, lu sư hiôk hloh kơ 'bôh tơsĭn-jĭt tơsĭn 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆ng mă ưh kơ kăl kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: “Or what woman, having ten silver coins, if she loses one coin, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search carefully until she finds it?
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia dơ̆ng, minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn, sư đei mơjĭt hlak jên hu. Dah sư hiong minh hlak lăm hnam, hăm trŏ kơ sư tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng na sơpuih chă khŏm khŏm tơ̆p mă 'bôh 'mơ̆i?

English: And when she has found it, she calls her friends and neighbors together, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the piece which I lost!’
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh boih na sư krao lu bôl buăl sư na khan: ‘Inh hiôk tơpă, jên inh đêl hiong 'bôh boih.’

English: Likewise, I say to you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei hiôk tơpă mă 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai yoch băt băi tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.”

English: Then He said: “A certain man had two sons.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Minh 'nu bơngai đei 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the portion of goods that falls to me.’ So he divided to them his livelihood.
Bahnar: Kon hơdruch apinh 'bă sư: ‘Klah asong mŭk tơmam kơ inh bĕ 'bă.’ Thoi noh 'bă sư klah asong mŭk tơmam kơ bre sư.

English: And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together, journeyed to a far country, and there wasted his possessions with prodigal living.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr noh kon hơdruch sư iŏk dôm mŭk tơmam mă đêl 'bă sư ăn kơ sư, na jăk tơ dêh nai. Tơ ei sư pơm kư̆ kă, sư pơhuach đĭ mŭk tơmam sư.

English: But when he had spent all, there arose a severe famine in that land, and he began to be in want.
Bahnar: Truh mŭk tơmam sư đĭ boih, đei pơngot rơwĕt dêh truh tơ tơring 'nei. Sư jing bơngai dơnuh hin

English: Then he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
Bahnar: na sư chă jang kơ đe. Minh 'nu bơngai lăm pơlei 'nei athei sư wei nhŭng tơ mir.

English: And he would gladly have filled his stomach with the pods that the swine ate, and no one gave him anything.
Bahnar: Sư lăng nhŭng sa, sư 'ngeng hơdai 'maih sa mơ̆n, mă-lei kơbĭ bu mơnat kơ sư.

English: “But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
Bahnar: “Thoi noh sư 'blŏk hơdơ̆r, na sư khan: ‘Lu bơngai jang kơ 'bă inh đei sŏng sa phĭ rơkah rơkai, mă-lei inh 'nâu wă lôch ngôi kơ rơwĕt.

English: I will arise and go to my father, and will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you
Bahnar: Dang ei inh wă iung brŏk, năm khan kơ 'bă inh 'mơ̆i: Ơ 'bă ah, inh pơm yoch hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng yoch hăm ih

English: and I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants.” ’
Bahnar: ưh kơ trŏ ih krao kơ inh kon dơ̆ng boih. Apinh ih lăng inh thoi minh 'nu bơngai jang kơ ih đĕch.’

English: “And he arose and came to his father. But when he was still a great way off, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him.
Bahnar: “Klaih kơ noh sư iung brŏk hloi. Tam mă truh tơ hnam, oei ataih, mă-lei 'bă sư tơmang 'bôh sư boih. 'Bă sư lăng 'brơ̆k mơnat, na tơkan chŭm kuăr sư.

English: And the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight, and am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
Bahnar: Sư khan hloi kơ 'bă sư: ‘Ơ 'bă ah, inh pơm yoch hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng yoch hăm ih, ưh kơ trŏ ih krao kơ inh kon dơ̆ng boih.’

English: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bă sư krao hloi lu bơngai jang kơ sư na sư khan: ‘Iŏk ao mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ, pơhrŭk ăn kơ sư. Iŏk tơkhiĕn tơ'bot ăn kơ sư păng pơtrô̆ ăn kơ sư chơkhŏ.

English: And bring the fatted calf here and kill it, and let us eat and be merry
Bahnar: Rôp kon rơmo bek bĕ, bơ̆n 'bet sa, wă kơ hiôk chơt

English: for this my son was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ And they began to be merry.
Bahnar: yua kơ kon inh nhen lĕ lôch boih, mă-lei arih dơ̆ng. Sư hiong boih, mă-lei dang ei 'bôh sư dơ̆ng.’ Thoi noh lu sư ngôi pơchơt băl hloi.

English: “Now his older son was in the field. And as he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei kon kơdră sư oei tơ mir. Truh sư brŏk wă jê̆ hnam sư boih, sư kơtơ̆ng đe hơri suang.

English: So he called one of the servants and asked what these things meant.
Bahnar: Na sư krao minh 'nu bơngai jang kơ 'bă sư na jet: ‘Đei tơdrong kiơ?’

English: And he said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and because he has received him safe and sound, your father has killed the fatted calf.’
Bahnar: Bơngai noh tơl: ‘Oh ih brŏk tơ âu na 'bă ih 'bet kon rơmo bek yua kơ sư brŏk oei liĕm akâu 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.’

English: “But he was angry and would not go in. Therefore his father came out and pleaded with him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'nhŏng kơdră sư 'blut lăm jơhngơ̆m. Sư kuă kơ mơ̆t tơ hnam. 'Bă sư lĕch pơlung sư ră

English: So he answered and said to his father, ‘Lo, these many years I have been serving you; I never transgressed your commandment at any time; and yet you never gave me a young goat, that I might make merry with my friends.
Bahnar: mă-lei sư khan kơ 'bă sư: ‘Inh oei hơdai ih đunh boih, inh jang kơ ih păng ưh kơ pơjăng dôm nơ̆r ih athei inh ră. Mă-lei ih 'nhŏ mă đei ăn kơ inh minh pôm kon bơbe wă 'bet sa hơdai hăm lu buăl inh.

English: But as soon as this son of yours came, who has devoured your livelihood with harlots, you killed the fatted calf for him.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei tă tơ kon ih jăk tơ nai, pơhuach mŭk tơmam ih, ngôi kư̆ kă hăm lu drŏ-kăn đi, dang ei sư brŏk tơ âu, tă tơ sư dơ̆ng ih 'bet sa kon rơmo bek.

English: “And he said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei 'bă sư khan kơ sư: ‘Ơ dăm, e oei hơdai hăm inh ling-lang, dôm mŭk tơmam inh lê̆ đĭ kơ e.

English: It was right that we should make merry and be glad, for your brother was dead and is alive again, and was lost and is found.’ ”
Bahnar: Trŏ mơ̆n ba ngôi păng oh e, yua kơ sư nhen lôch boih mă-lei dang ei sư arih dơ̆ng; sư hiong đơ̆ng ba, mă-lei dang ei ba 'bôh sư dơ̆ng.’ ”

English: He also said to His disciples: “There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and an accusation was brought to him that this man was wasting his goods.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai mơdrŏng đei minh 'nu đam kơiĕng. Na đe roi kơ bơngai mơdrŏng ei khan: ‘Nhôn 'bôh đam kơiĕng ih pơhuach mŭk ih lah 'bok.’

English: So he called him and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your stewardship, for you can no longer be steward.’
Bahnar: Na bơngai mơdrŏng ei krao sư na khan: ‘Đe khan kơ ih đei tơdrong, na mă inh krao ih tơ âu. Inh wă kơ ih jô̆ đĭ dôm tơmam inh, inh ưh pă ăn kơ ih jang pơm đam kơiĕng inh boih.’

English: “Then the steward said within himself, ‘What shall I do? For my master is taking the stewardship away from me. I cannot dig; I am ashamed to beg.
Bahnar: Na đam kơiĕng sư ei tơchĕng lăm to khan: ‘Yŏng inh wă pơpuh inh boih, na inh wă jang tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng? Inh choh mir kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ ôh. Inh kư̆m mơlâu kơ chă apinh sa đơ̆ng đe mơ̆n.

English: I have resolved what to do, that when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.’
Bahnar: Ô inh băt boih. Inh gô pơm kơ lơ bơngai lăp đon kơ inh na lăp yŏng inh pơpuh inh boih, na inh đei bôl gô sơng iŏk inh oei tơ hnam sư.’

English: “So he called every one of his master’s debtors to him, and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
Bahnar: “Thoi noh na đam kơiĕng sư ei krao đĭ-đăng bơngai mă hre kơ yŏng sư. Sư khan kơ bơngai blŭng-a thoi âu: ‘Ih hre kơ yŏng inh dôm yơ?’

English: And he said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ So he said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
Bahnar: Na bơngai ei tơl: ‘Minh-hrĕng kơthŭng đak rơmă.’ Đam kơiĕng sư ei khan: ‘Âu hla bơar đêl ih hre kơ sư, na dang ei ih jah chih ming pơđăm-jĭt kơthŭng đĕch wăi.’

English: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ So he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ And he said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư khan kơ minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng: ‘Bĭ ih hre kơ yŏng inh dôm yơ?’ Na bơngai ei tơl: ‘Minh-hrĕng lom 'ba.’ Đam kơiĕng sư ei khan: ‘Âu hla bơar đêl ih hre kơ sư. Ih jah chih ming tơhngam-jĭt lom 'ba đĕch wăi.’

English: So the master commended the unjust steward because he had dealt shrewdly. For the sons of this world are more shrewd in their generation than the sons of light.
Bahnar: Bơngai đam kơiĕng ei pơm ưh kơ tơpăt ră, mă-lei yŏng sư kư̆m ngơnh kơ sư chă gơh găi pơm tơdrong arih akâu, yua kơ lu bơngai ala teh âu, lu sư hơgei hloh kơ bơngai lui gah tơdrong tơgŭm dih băl chă 'me akâu jăn wă kơ arih akâu.

English: “And I say to you, make friends for yourselves by unrighteous mammon, that when you fail, they may receive you into an everlasting home.
Bahnar: “Na Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Jên boih tơmam ala teh âu đĕch mă-lei iĕm gơh yua jên mơ̆n wă tơgŭm bơngai dơnuh hin, na lăp jên iĕm ưh pă yua boih ning-mônh, iĕm gô đei bôl buăl lơ sơng iŏk iĕm tơ plĕnh ti.

English: He who is faithful in what is least is faithful also in much; and he who is unjust in what is least is unjust also in much.
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu pơm tơpăt mă tơdrong iĕ, bơngai noh sư kư̆m gô pơm tơpăt tơdrong tih mơ̆n. Bơngai bu pơm ưh kơ tơpăt đơ̆ng tơdrong iĕ, sư kư̆m ưh kơ tơpăt kơ tơdrong tih.

English: Therefore if you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
Bahnar: Dah iĕm ưh kơ pơm tơpăt tơdrong wei-lăng mŭk tơmam ala teh âu, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ wă ăn kơ iĕm wei-lăng mŭk tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti mơ̆n.

English: And if you have not been faithful in what is another man’s, who will give you what is your own?
Bahnar: Dah iĕm ưh kơ pơm tơpăt wei-lăng mŭk tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm yua tơ ala teh âu, lei Sư kư̆m ưh kơ wă pơsư̆ ăn kơ iĕm mŭk tơmam tơ plĕnh ti mơ̆n.

English: “No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.”
Bahnar: “Minh 'nu đĭch ưh kơ gơh jang kơ 'bar 'nu yŏng ôh, hli kơ sư 'mêm kơ yŏng âu, areh kơ yŏng to; chu yom kơ yŏng to, pơjăm pơjuă yŏng âu. Na mŭk tơmam kư̆m dang pơm yŏng mơ̆n. Dah iĕm băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Yŏng iĕm tơpă, lei iĕm ưh kơ 'mêm kơ dôm mŭk tơmam ala teh âu ôh.”

English: Now the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they derided Him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi kư̆m kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Yêsu bơtho noh mơ̆n, na lu sư pơm hiĕk kơ Yêsu yua kơ lu sư 'mêm kơ mŭk tơmam tơ ala teh âu.

English: And He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For what is highly esteemed among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lu iĕm lăp đon kơ đe khan kơ iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm kơnê̆. Tơdrong kon bơngai ala teh âu pơang khan 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng kơnê̆ kơ Sư.

English: “The law and the prophets were until John. Since that time the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is pressing into it.
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong juăt Sư sơ̆ păng wơh lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư lăp truh tơ Yôhan đĕch. Na đơ̆ng Yôhan pơtơm bơtho sơ̆ truh dang ei nhôn bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih kon bơngai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch na pơgơ̆r lu sư, na đĭ-đăng bơngai wă tơpă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lu sư thoi noh.

English: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tittle of the law to fail.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, ưh kơ layơ hiong mă minh tơdrong iĕ ioch đơ̆ng Sư pơkă, mă truh tơ plĕnh teh hiong tôch ning-mônh, sư oei khŏm khŏm.

English: “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is divorced from her husband commits adultery.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong achăng akăn kư̆m lei-lăi, bơngai bu achăng akăn sư na iŏk akăn plơ̆ng, bơngai noh sư yoch boih yua kơ sư kơđang kơ̆l ako pơ'brơh kơ akăn sư. Bơngai bu iŏk akăn mă đơ̆ng đe achăng lê̆ boih, bơngai noh kư̆m yoch mơ̆n.”

English: “There was a certain rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared sumptuously every day.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Sơ̆ đei minh 'nu bơngai mơdrŏng, sư juăt kơ hrŭk ao 'lơ̆ng rŏ păng sŏng sa jơnap ling-lang.

English: But there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, full of sores, who was laid at his gate
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai dơnuh hin, anăn sư Lasarơ. Sư jĭ tơ'boch roch jơ̆p kơ akâu sư. Đe juăt kơ tung ba tơ'bĭch sư tơ 'măng hnam 'bok mơdrŏng ei.

English: desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table. Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
Bahnar: Sư wă răp tơmam sa mă đêl rơkah đơ̆ng bơngai mơdrŏng ei sa. Lu kŏ kư̆m liơh jĭ sư mơ̆n.

English: So it was that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died and was buried.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh bơngai dơnuh ei lôch, na linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk sư tơ kơpal plĕnh ti. Sư oei jê̆ Abraham 'bơ̆t lu sư oei sŏng sa tơ plĕnh ti. Bơngai mơdrŏng ei kư̆m lôch mơ̆n na đe 'bŭ sư.

English: And being in torments in Hades, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
Bahnar: Sư oei lăm dơnâu ŭnh tŏ hang tơpă. Na sư ngoi 'bôh Abraham tơ plĕnh ti păng kư̆m 'bôh Lasarơ oei jê̆ Abraham mơ̆n.

English: “Then he cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.’
Bahnar: Na 'bok mơdrŏng ei krao pơret Abraham thoi âu: ‘Ơ Abraham, apinh ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆, ih wơh Lasarơ năm djrŭ ti sư tơ đak năm kơtoh kơ 'bơ̆r inh 'biơ̆ bĕ wă klaih rơhing 'biơ̆, yua kơ inh oei lăm dơnâu ŭnh tŏ hang dêh.’

English: But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things; but now he is comforted and you are tormented.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei Abraham khan kơ sư: ‘Ơ dăm, ih athei 'blŏk mơ̆n kơplah ih oei arih tơ ala teh sơ̆ ih jơnap tơpă, đei tơmam lơ tơpă. Mă-lei Lasarơ ưh kơ đei kiơ păng jĭ ling-lang tăm. Dang ei sư oei tơ âu hiôk dêh, mă-lei ih oei lăm dơnâu ŭnh tŏ hang ling-lang.

English: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, so that those who want to pass from here to you cannot, nor can those from there pass to us.’
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m đei sơlŭng jrŭ păng să tăm sơlam bơ̆n, na mă nhôn wă năm tơ iĕm ưh kơ gơh păng iĕm wă năm tơ nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mơ̆n.’

English: “Then he said, ‘I beg you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house
Bahnar: Na 'bok mơdrŏng ei khan: ‘Inh oei đei pơđăm 'nu 'nhŏng oh oei arih tơ teh. Na ih ăn kơ Lasarơ iung arih thoi đêl năm khan kơ lu 'nhŏng oh inh 'nei 'biơ̆ bĕ

English: for I have five brothers, that he may testify to them, lest they also come to this place of torment.’
Bahnar: wă kơ lu sư tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch na huay kơ phak lăm dơnâu ŭnh thoi inh âu.’

English: Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.’
Bahnar: Na Abraham khan kơ bơngai mơdrŏng 'nei: ‘Tơ ala teh đe oei bơtho kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă păng tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. Lu 'nhŏng oh ih oei gơh mơ̆ng đe bơtho tơdrong noh mơ̆n.’

English: And he said, ‘No, father Abraham; but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
Bahnar: 'Bok mơdrŏng ei khan: ‘Ơ Abraham ah, inh băt tơpă lu sư ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng ôh kơ đe bơtho. Mă-lei dah đei bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, lei lu sư gô tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch tơpă.’

English: But he said to him, ‘If they do not hear Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded though one rise from the dead.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Abraham khan: ‘Dah lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng lu đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă păng tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă sư 'bôh bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, sư kư̆m ưh kơ lui 'mơ̆i.’ ”

English: Then He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no offenses should come, but woe to him through whom they do come!
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu: “Tơpă yơh iĕm gô đei tơdrong đe pơhlŭ iĕm wă kơ iĕm pơm yoch, mă-lei lu bơngai mă pơhlŭ iĕm noh sư gô pơmat-tat.

English: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu dang ei juăt pơhlŭ lu bơngai 'nao lui pơm yoch, pơtih gia đe dah chô̆ ako sư tơ tơpăl tơmo sơ̆, hơtat lê̆ sư tơ klŏng đak dơsĭ, lei sư hiôk 'biơ̆, yua kơ sư huay kơ gơh pơhlŭ đe pơm yoch dang ei.

English: Take heed to yourselves. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng. Dah 'nhŏng oh iĕm pơm yoch kơ iĕm, lei iĕm athei bơtho khan kơ sư. Dah sư lung iĕm mơnat tơdrong yoch sư, lei iĕm 'nĕ pă jô̆ yo kơ sư.

English: And if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day returns to you, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”
Bahnar: Dah sư pơm yoch kơ iĕm tơpơh 'măng lăm minh năr, na rim 'măng sư yoch kơ iĕm sư kư̆m năm hơlêm iĕm, lei iĕm 'nĕ pă jô̆ yo kơ sư dơ̆ng.”

English: And the apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ Sư: “Apinh Ih tơgŭm nhôn lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơjăp.”

English: So the Lord said, “If you have faith as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled up by the roots and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah tơdrong lui iĕm wơ̆ thoi găr sơ'bei, lei iĕm gơh sơkat kơ 'long tơpang âu khan: ‘Tơgloh pơtăm kơ e kơdih tơ đak dơsĭ to,’ na sư kư̆m chu ih mơ̆n.

English: And which of you, having a servant plowing or tending sheep, will say to him when he has come in from the field, ‘Come at once and sit down to eat’?
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia iĕm đei đĭch jang choh mir dah wei triu iĕm. Lăp sư wih đơ̆ng mir na iĕm hăm lah khan kơ sư: ‘Năm jah sa mơh e wă?’

English: But will he not rather say to him, ‘Prepare something for my supper, and gird yourself and serve me till I have eaten and drunk, and afterward you will eat and drink’?
Bahnar: Yŏng ưh kơ lah thoi noh ôh. Mă-lei yŏng juăt khan kơ đĭch sư thoi âu: ‘E hơmet kơ inh tơmam sa 'mơ̆i, đơ̆ng noh na e pôk kơ inh. Gô inh sa đang 'mơ̆i na e gơh sa.’

English: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I think not.
Bahnar: Lu đĭch sư jang kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong yŏng sư pơkă ră mă-lei yŏng sư ưh kơ lah kơ bơnê kơ sư ôh.

English: So likewise you, when you have done all those things which you are commanded, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants. We have done what was our duty to do.’ ”
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong iĕm kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Lăp iĕm pơm tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, iĕm athei khan kơ Sư thoi âu đĕch: ‘Nhôn đĭch đam Ih ưh kơ hơnhŏ kơ Ih bơnê ôh, nhôn kư̆ jang kiơ̆ kơ Ih pơkă đĕch.’ ”

English: Now it happened as He went to Jerusalem that He passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, Sư năm sơlam dêh char Samri păng dêh char Galilê.

English: Then as He entered a certain village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood afar off.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu mơ̆t tơ minh pôm pơlei ei, đei mơjĭt 'nu bơngai jĭ chin năm tơ Sư. Lu sư oei ataih 'biơ̆ kơ Yêsu

English: And they lifted up their voices and said, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
Bahnar: na lu sư krao 'bơ̆r re thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây ơi, Ih mơnat kơ nhôn 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: So when He saw them, He said to them, “Go, show yourselves to the priests.” And so it was that as they went, they were cleansed.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh lu đe ei na Sư khan thoi âu: “Iĕm năm tơ'bôh akâu iĕm tơ 'bok soi bĕ, wă kơ sư lăng iĕm tam klaih kơ jĭ.” Đơ̆ng noh na lu sư năm. Kơplah lu sư oei năm rok trong, na jĭ lu sư klaih hloi.

English: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, returned, and with a loud voice glorified God
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu lăm lu sư băt kơ tơdrong jĭ sư klaih boih, na sư wih dơ̆ng tơ Yêsu păng pơma re khan: “Bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.
Bahnar: Sư kŭp kơ̆l bon 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Yêsu păng khan: “Bơnê kơ Ih.” Bơngai noh đơ̆ng dêh char Samri, ưh kơ sĭ bơngai Juđê ôh.

English: So Jesus answered and said, “Were there not ten cleansed? But where are the nine?
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma kơ đe kiơ̆ ei păng bơngai mă tơkan tơ Sư ei thoi âu: “Ưh kơ klaih tôm mơjĭt 'nu ôh hă? Bĭ tơsĭn 'nu noh hei tơ yơ?

English: Were there not any found who returned to give glory to God except this foreigner?”
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ kiơ lu sư ưh kơ wă năm tơ âu na bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'biơ̆? Lăp minh 'nu bơngai âu, tơmoi tăm, mă-lei sư đei nơ̆r bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And He said to him, “Arise, go your way. Your faith has made you well.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Iung brŏk kơ ih bĕ. Tơdrong jĭ ih, yua kơ ih lui, na klaih.”

English: Now when He was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them and said, “The kingdom of God does not come with observation
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi jet Yêsu: “Layơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r teh đak?” Yêsu tơl: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r bơ̆n ưh kơ 'bôh păng măt ôh.

English: nor will they say, ‘See here!’ or ‘See there!’ For indeed, the kingdom of God is within you.”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh khan: 'Noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r boih, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n.”

English: Then He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Ning-mônh iĕm chang gô Inh Kon Bơngai jur dơ̆ng păng khan: ‘Ô kuă kơ kiơ Yêsu jah jur dang ei lah?’ Mă-lei kơplah ei kơnh iĕm tam mă 'bôh Inh jur ôh.

English: And they will say to you, ‘Look here!’ or ‘Look there!’ Do not go after them or follow them.
Bahnar: Na đe gô khan kơ iĕm: 'Bok Krist tơ âu boih. 'Bok Krist tơ to boih. Iĕm 'nĕ kiơ̆ sư năm lăng hŏ

English: For as the lightning that flashes out of one part under heaven shines to the other part under heaven, so also the Son of Man will be in His day.
Bahnar: yua kơ năr ei kơnh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô 'bôh Inh jur thoi lĕ kơmlat, chêr 'blêt 'bôh jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, mă đơ̆ng hơlĕch truh tơ bơmơ̆t.

English: But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei blŭng-a dang ei Inh gô đei tơdrong anat tơpă 'mơ̆i yua kơ lu bơngai jơhnơr ahrei ưh kơ wă kơ Inh.

English: And as it was in the days of Noah, so it will be also in the days of the Son of Man
Bahnar: “Na Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur ning-mônh thoi lĕ đak lip kơplah jơhnơr Nôê sơ̆.

English: They ate, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ đak lip sơ̆ kon bơngai kư̆m oei pơm sa et pơrŏ, thoi et pơkong, et sa tơdrong noh nai dang lĕ kơ năr oei hiôk-hian thoi krô hmă; truh tơ Nôê mơ̆t lăm duk, lu sư kư̆m ưh tam mă băt 'mơ̆i, na truh hĭ kơ đak lip, lu sư lôch đĭ.

English: Likewise as it was also in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built
Bahnar: Kơplah jơhnơr Lot sơ̆ kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Kon bơngai kư̆m oei pơm et sa pơrŏ, kư̆m oei chă pơm mơdro sa, chă pơtăm bơ̆n pro amrĕ, pơm bơ̆n hnam.

English: but on the day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed them all.
Bahnar: Na lăp năr 'bok Lot lĕch jăk đơ̆ng Pơlei Sôđôm boih, na 'Bok Kei-Dei tơjruh hloi ŭnh đơ̆ng plĕnh soh Pơlei Sôđôm, lu sư lôch đĭ.

English: Even so will it be in the day when the Son of Man is revealed.
Bahnar: Năr Inh Kon Bơngai jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh, kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n. Kon bơngai ưh kơ ê Inh wă jur, na 'bơ̆t ei boih Inh jur hloi.

English: “In that day, he who is on the housetop, and his goods are in the house, let him not come down to take them away. And likewise the one who is in the field, let him not turn back.
Bahnar: “Kơplah ei kơnh bơngai oei ngôi tơ 'ngoaih hnam, sư 'nĕ pă mơ̆t iŏk tơmam sư lăm hnam. Bơngai bu oei jang tơ mir, 'nĕ pă brŏk tơ hnam iŏk tơmam sư tơ hnam.

English: Remember Lot’s wife.
Bahnar: Iĕm hăm 'blŏk kơ akăn Lot lôch kơ kiơ sơ̆?

English: Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai noh lôch hoh hoh đĕch. Bơngai bu chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, sư 'noh gô arih ling-lang.

English: I tell you, in that night there will be two men in one bed: the one will be taken and the other will be left.
Bahnar: Kơplah măng ei kơnh đei 'bar 'nu bơngai tơdăm 'bĭch hơdai, na linh jang 'lơ̆ng gô iŏk anhăk minh 'nu mă lui, minh 'nu ưh kơ lui lê̆ 'bơ̆t noh.

English: Two women will be grinding together: the one will be taken and the other left.
Bahnar: Đei 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn peh 'ba, linh jang 'lơ̆ng gô iŏk minh 'nu mă lui, minh 'nu ưh kơ lui lê̆ 'bơ̆t noh.

English: Two men will be in the field: the one will be taken and the other left.”
Bahnar: “'Bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo oei jang hơdai tơ mir, linh jang 'lơ̆ng gô iŏk minh 'nu mă lui, minh 'nu ưh kơ lui lê̆ 'bơ̆t noh.”

English: And they answered and said to Him, “Where, Lord?” So He said to them, “Wherever the body is, there the eagles will be gathered together.”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu jet Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, tơdrong noh tơ yơ?” Yêsu khan: “Bơngai lôch tơ yơ, pă jor grơ̆ gô jur sa tơ ei.”

English: Then He spoke a parable to them, that men always ought to pray and not lose heart
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu wă kơ lu sư băt kơ krao khan ling-lang huay kơ hăl

English: saying: “There was in a certain city a judge who did not fear God nor regard man.
Bahnar: “Tơ minh pôm pơlei ei đei minh 'nu 'bok sek tơlang, sư ưh kơ chu yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng ưh kơ hli kơ đe.

English: Now there was a widow in that city; and she came to him, saying, ‘Get justice for me from my adversary.’
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei 'nei đei minh 'nu yă adro, sư năm tơ 'bok sek tơlang 'nei ling-lang wă kơ 'bok 'nei sek tơlang tơpăt tơdrong đe jâu sư.

English: And he would not for a while; but afterward he said within himself, ‘Though I do not fear God nor regard man
Bahnar: Sư năm apinh 'bok sek tơlang 'nei ling-lang ră, mă-lei 'bok 'nei kuă kơ tơdŏng sư. Mă-lei khŏm khŏm 'bok 'nei tơchĕng lăm to thoi âu: ‘Inh ưh kơ chu yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, kư̆m ưh kơ chu kơ đe mơ̆n.

English: yet because this widow troubles me I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh kuă kơ tơdŏng sư ră, mă-lei inh hơhrah kơ sư yua kơ sư apinh inh 'bơ'bel na inh chu tơdŏng sư.’ ”

English: Then the Lord said, “Hear what the unjust judge said.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Iĕm athei tơchĕng lăng deh. 'Bok sek tơlang noh hei, sư ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei yua kơ yă adro 'nei apinh 'bơ'bel na sư kư̆m tơdŏng mơ̆n.

English: And shall God not avenge His own elect who cry out day and night to Him, though He bears long with them?
Bahnar: Pơma kơ kiơ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư gô tơdŏng tơpă lu bơngai mă Sư đĭ rơih boih mă oei krao khan kơ Sư măng năr. 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm ngê̆ gô đunh ưh?

English: I tell you that He will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will He really find faith on the earth?”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơdŏng hloi lu sư noh. Mă-lei lăp Inh Kon Bơngai jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh, Inh hăm oei 'bôh lu bơngai lui dơ̆ng ưh kơnh lah?”

English: Also He spoke this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others
Bahnar: Yêsu kư̆m pơma pơtih gia thoi âu dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă ngêh kơdih bơngai 'lơ̆ng mă-lei sư pơjăm đe

English: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
Bahnar: “'Bar 'nu bơngai năm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm wă krao khan. Minh 'nu 'nei bơngai Pharisi, minh 'nu dơ̆ng bơngai chă iŏk jên thuê̆.

English: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other men—extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this tax collector.
Bahnar: Na 'bok bơngai Pharisi ei dơ̆ng dơ'nhơ̆ng ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan lăm to khan: ‘Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh bơnê kơ Ih yua kơ inh ưh kơ sĭ bơngai thoi đe nai ôh. Inh ưh kơ sĭ bơngai ưh kơ tơpăt, chă pơgâm sa đe ôh. Inh ưh kơ ngôi kư̆ kă ôh. Inh kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ thoi lĕ bơngai chă iŏk jên thuê̆ 'noh ôh.

English: I fast twice a week; I give tithes of all that I possess.’
Bahnar: Rim giĕng inh juăt kơ ơ̆t kơ por 'bar 'măng. Dôm tơmam inh đei inh juăt kơ pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt.’

English: And the tax collector, standing afar off, would not so much as raise his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me a sinner!’
Bahnar: “Mă-lei bơngai mă chă iŏk jên thuê̆ noh oei ataih đơ̆ng bơngai Pharisi ei. Sư ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk muh măt sư tơ plĕnh, mă-lei sư tŭr kơdih kơtơh păng khan: ‘Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ yua kơ inh bơngai yoch.’ ”

English: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lăp bơngai mă iŏk jên thuê̆ noh brŏk tơ hnam, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch boih. Bơngai Pharisi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ jô̆ kơ sư khan klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch ôh, yua kơ bơngai bu pơang akâu kơdih, sư ei gô mơlâu; bơngai bu pơma sơdrĭ tơ ala kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na sư 'nei boih 'Bok Kei-Dei 'brơ̆k mơnat tơiung sư.”

English: Then they also brought infants to Him that He might touch them; but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
Bahnar: Đe anhăk ba lu hơ'lơ̆p tơ Yêsu, wă kơ Yêsu pel kơ̆l krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Sư wei-lăng lu sư. Mă-lei lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'bôh, lu sư khă kuă ăn đe anhăk năm tơ Sư.

English: But Jesus called them to Him and said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao lu hơ'lơ̆p noh năm tơ Sư păng khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “'Nĕ pă khă lu hơ'lơ̆p, lê̆ lu sư năm tơ Inh, yua kơ bơngai bu lui thoi lu bơngai hơ'lơ̆p âu lui, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r wei-lăng sư ling-lang.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă: Dah bu ưh kơ lui thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p âu lui, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ pơgơ̆r sư ôh.”

English: Now a certain ruler asked Him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu kră tơring năm jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, inh pơm thoi yơ wă kơ arih ling-lang hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei?”

English: So Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ kiơ ih khan Inh bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt? Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ôh. Pôm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not bear false witness,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”
Bahnar: Ih băt boih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆. Sư khan: ‘'Nĕ plah klo kăn đe, 'nĕ pơlôch bơngai, 'nĕ chă tơtông mŭk tơmam đe, 'nĕ kơ pơma hơlĕnh, athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă.’ ”

English: And he said, “All these things I have kept from my youth.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok kră tơring noh khan: “Dôm tơdrong noh inh huay ră mă đơ̆ng inh oei iĕ sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei.”

English: So when Jesus heard these things, He said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na Sư khan: “Ih răk ưh kơ tôm oei pă minh tơdrong. Ih athei tĕch đĭ mŭk tơmam ih chă asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, na kiơ̆ Inh hloi. Thoi noh na ih gô đei mŭk tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti ning-mônh.”

English: But when he heard this, he became very sorrowful, for he was very rich.
Bahnar: 'Bok noh kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma thoi noh na sư sơ'ngon dêh, yua kơ sư mơdrŏng tơpă.

English: And when Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, He said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh 'bok noh sơ'ngon na Sư khan: “Lu bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r anat dêh.

English: For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Aseh lăk-đa mơ̆t bơlôh jrŭm 'bônh 'biơ̆ kơ bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And those who heard it said, “Who then can be saved?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă mơ̆ng Sư bơtho tơdrong noh jet Sư khan: “Lei bu gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei lĕ?”

English: But He said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Mă dôm tơdrong kiơ kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơm, 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh ngăl. Bơngai bu 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat, bơngai noh gơh mơ̆t.”

English: Then Peter said, “See, we have left all and followed You.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Yêsu: “Bĭ lu nhôn mă achăng lê̆ hnam dơnŏ nhôn yua kơ kiơ̆ Ih boih lơliơ?”

English: So He said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or parents or brothers or wife or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, kơplah oei ala teh âu bơngai bu achăng lê̆ hnam sư, kon akăn sư, 'nhŏng oh sư, mĕ 'bă sư, yua kơ sư jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: who shall not receive many times more in this present time, and in the age to come eternal life.”
Bahnar: bơngai noh gô đei tôm tơdrong hloh kơ sư đei sơ̆ dơ̆ng. Păng ning-mônh sư gô arih ling-lang hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei tăm.”

English: Then He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished.
Bahnar: Yêsu anhăk mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư weh ataih 'biơ̆ kơ đe na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ. Dang ei bơ̆n oei năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Tơ ei kơnh đe gô pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh, na 'blep tôm tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, lu sư chih khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Inh Kon Bơngai.

English: For He will be delivered to the Gentiles and will be mocked and insulted and spit upon.
Bahnar: Đe gô jao Inh kơ lu bơngai đơ̆ng dêh đe tơmoi. Lu bơngai đơ̆ng dêh đe tơmoi pơma che bơle achơ̆ achĕch kơ Inh, kơsoh pơ'brơh kơ Inh đak hai.

English: They will scourge Him and kill Him. And the third day He will rise again.”
Bahnar: Lu sư teh tach pơjĭ Inh păng pơlôch Inh. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: But they understood none of these things; this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know the things which were spoken.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma tơpăt tơdrong Sư gô lôch tơpă, mă-lei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Sư pơma noh wă khan kiơ.

English: Then it happened, as He was coming near Jericho, that a certain blind man sat by the road begging.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm rok trong wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Jêrikô. Tơ anăp Sư đei minh 'nu bơngai măt tol oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cheng trong chă apinh jên đe.

English: And hearing a multitude passing by, he asked what it meant.
Bahnar: Lăp sư kơtơ̆ng lơ bơngai yak rok trong brih sư, na sư jet khan: “Đe năm chă kiơ lơlap trong âu?”

English: So they told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
Bahnar: Na đe khan kơ sư: “Đe kiơ̆ Yêsu Pơlei Nasaret yak trong âu.”

English: And he cried out, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Bahnar: Lăp sư kơtơ̆ng đe khan thoi noh na sư krao pơret Yêsu: “Ơ Yêsu, ơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: Then those who went before warned him that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă yak hơdrol kơ Yêsu khă sư 'nĕ pă krao, mă-lei sư rai krao 'bơ̆r re: “Ơ Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: So Jesus stood still and commanded him to be brought to Him. And when he had come near, He asked him
Bahnar: Na Yêsu dơ̆ng athei đe chông ba bơngai măt tol năm tơ Sư. Lăp bơngai măt tol truh tơ Sư na Yêsu jet sư khan

English: saying, “What do you want Me to do for you?” He said, “Lord, that I may receive my sight.”
Bahnar: “Ih wă kơ Inh pơm kiơ?” Na bơngai măt tol ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, inh wă kơ Ih pơklaih măt inh gơh 'bôh hơdah.”

English: Then Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has made you well.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dang ei măt ih 'bôh hơdah. Yua kơ ih lui na măt ih klaih.”

English: And immediately he received his sight, and followed Him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God.
Bahnar: Đang Yêsu pơma thoi noh măt sư 'bôh hơdah hloi. Sư kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu. Sư pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai tơpôl kư̆m pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: Then Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
Bahnar: Yêsu drong mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrikô.

English: Now behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei ei đei minh 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r gah tơdrong iŏk jên thuê̆, măt sư Sachê. Sư mơdrŏng tih tơpă.

English: And he sought to see who Jesus was, but could not because of the crowd, for he was of short stature.
Bahnar: Sư wă lăng hơbŏ Yêsu thoi yơ yua kơ sư ưh tam lah 'bôh. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh 'bôh yua kơ sư bơngai kơđeh.

English: So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was going to pass that way.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na sư kơdâu ploi hơdrol kơ đe, hao tơ kơpal 'long hue tơ teh wă kơ gơh 'bôh Yêsu.

English: And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, make haste and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ noh Yêsu ngơk lăng tơ kơpal 'long na khan: “Ơ Sachê, ih jur tĕnh, Inh wă mơ̆t pơdơh tơ hnam ih năr âu.”

English: So he made haste and came down, and received Him joyfully.
Bahnar: Na Sachê jur hloi đơ̆ng 'long hloi anhăk ba Yêsu năm tơ hnam sư. Sachê 'nă hal, jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk chơt tơpă.

English: But when they saw it, they all complained, saying, “He has gone to be a guest with a man who is a sinner.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ đe 'bôh tơdrong noh na chă pơma kơdih khan: “Lơliơ Yêsu boih khan mơ̆t sŏng sa tơ hnam bơngai yoch?”

English: Then Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, I give half of my goods to the poor; and if I have taken anything from anyone by false accusation, I restore fourfold.”
Bahnar: Na Sachê iung khan kơ Kră Yang Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, dôm mŭk tơmam inh âu, inh wă asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin minh puăt. Păng lu bơngai mă inh pơgŏ iŏk jên, tơmam sư, inh gô tơwih ăn kơ sư lơ hloh kơ đêl inh iŏk, puăn hơtăl.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Năr âu 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih hnam dơnŏ iĕm boih na ih, mă đe jô̆ thoi noh, ih kư̆m kon sâu Abraham thoi đe noh mơ̆n.

English: for the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai jur tơ ala teh âu wă chă lu bơngai mă kuơ̆l kơ trong wă pơklaih yoch sư.”

English: Now as they heard these things, He spoke another parable, because He was near Jerusalem and because they thought the kingdom of God would appear immediately.
Bahnar: Đang tơdrong noh na Yêsu pơma pơtih gia dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă mơ̆ng Sư kiơ̆ ei. Sư oei tơ Pơlei Jêrikô wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih. Lu bơngai ei ngêh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn Yêsu pơm 'bok Pơtao pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu kơplah noh hloi.

English: Therefore He said: “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai ei: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm tih wă năm tơ dêh ataih wă tơ'bơ̆p 'bok pơtao tơm, yua kơ 'bok pơtao tơm wă pôk sư pơm phŏ sư wă pơgơ̆r dêh char sư kơdih, klaih kơ noh sư gô wih dơ̆ng.

English: So he called ten of his servants, delivered to them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Do business till I come.’
