Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ sư wă năm, sư krao mơjĭt 'nu bơngai jang kơ sư. Sư pơjao ăn rim 'nu kơ lu bơngai jang kơ sư minh hlak jên hu so sơ̆. Sư pơkă athei chă blơ̆ sa kơdih kơdih truh tơ năr sư wih dơ̆ng. Lăp sư pơjao ăn kơ lu đe noh đang boih na sư năm.

English: But his citizens hated him, and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We will not have this man to reign over us.’
Bahnar: Đe băt kơ sư năm boih na lu tơring tơrang hil areh kơ sư, đe ưh kơ wă kơ sư pơm pơtao kơ lu sư; na lu sư wơh đe pơtruh kơ 'bok pơtao tơm, lu tơring tơrang ưh kơ wă kơ bơngai noh pơm pơtao lu sư.

English: “And so it was that when he returned, having received the kingdom, he then commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei 'bok pơtao tơm lăp đon kơ sư tơpă, na ăn kơ sư pơm pơtao. Klaih kơ noh na sư wih. Sư krao lu mơjĭt 'nu bơngai jang kơ sư mă đêl sư pơjao ăn jên wă kơ băt lu sư blơ̆ sa bu lơi dôm yơ.

English: Then came the first, saying, ‘Master, your mina has earned ten minas.’
Bahnar: Bơngai mă mônh năm tơ yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sơ̆ inh iŏk minh hlak jên ih, inh năm mơdro sa đei lơi jing mơjĭt hlak dơ̆ng.’

English: And he said to him, ‘Well done, good servant; because you were faithful in a very little, have authority over ten cities.’
Bahnar: Na yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih jang kơ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpă. Ih ưh kơ lê̆ ôh dôm tơdrong jang inh. Yua kơ ih jang 'lơ̆ng, na mă khan tơdrong jang ih iĕ, inh gô ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong tih 'biơ̆, pơjao ăn kơ ih wei-lăng lăm mơjĭt tŏ pơlei.’

English: And the second came, saying, ‘Master, your mina has earned five minas.’
Bahnar: Bơngai mă 'bar kư̆m pơma lei-lăi khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sơ̆ ih ăn kơ inh minh hlak jên hu, inh năm mơdro sa đei lơi pơđăm hlak.’

English: Likewise he said to him, ‘You also be over five cities.’
Bahnar: Na yŏng tơ'ngla sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih jang kơ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpă. Ih ưh kơ lê̆ ôh dôm tơdrong jang inh. Yua kơ ih jang 'lơ̆ng, na mă khan tơdrong jang ih iĕ, inh gô ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong tih 'biơ̆, pơjao ăn kơ ih wei-lăng lăm pơđăm tŏ pơlei.’

English: “Then another came, saying, ‘Master, here is your mina, which I have kept put away in a handkerchief.
Bahnar: “Minh 'nu bơngai jang kơ sư nai dơ̆ng pơtruh kơ yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, âu jên ih. Sơ̆ ih athei inh mơdro ră, mă-lei inh 'nŭng 'măn lê̆ lăm che ling-lang.

English: For I feared you, because you are an austere man. You collect what you did not deposit, and reap what you did not sow.’
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ ih na inh 'nŭng 'măn lê̆ yua kơ inh băt kơ ih bơngai chă pơgŏ nhôn, na ih athei nhôn năm mơdro ăn kơ ih thoi bơngai nai pơtăm 'ba, na ih gô kĕch iŏk.’

English: And he said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth I will judge you, you wicked servant. You knew that I was an austere man, collecting what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.
Bahnar: Na yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih bơngai ưh kơ chu dêh. Ih jô̆ kơ inh iŏk jên đơ̆ng iĕm mơdro thoi lĕ bơngai kĕch iŏk 'ba đơ̆ng đêl đe pơtăm hă?

English: Why then did you not put my money in the bank, that at my coming I might have collected it with interest?’
Bahnar: Lei ih kuă kơ kiơ ăn kơ đe mơng, wă kơ đei lơi. Mưh inh năm iŏk na ih pơdrĕo jên mă inh ăn păng jên mă ih lơi noh?’

English: “And he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to him who has ten minas.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na yŏng sư athei bơngai mă jang kơ sư iŏk jên đơ̆ng bơngai kơchu noh hei, ăn thim tăm kơ bơngai đei mơjĭt hlak jên hei.

English: (But they said to him, ‘Master, he has ten minas.’)
Bahnar: Lu bơngai jang kơ sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sư đei mơjĭt hlak jên boih lah, liơ ih khan wă ăn kơ sư dơ̆ng?’

English: ‘For I say to you, that to everyone who has will be given; and from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
Bahnar: Na 'bok pơtao khan kơ lu sư: ‘Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu jang pơnam đei tơmam lơ, Kră Yang mơnat rai ăn pơthim tăm. Bơngai bu alah, tơmam ưh kơ đei lơ, rai hiong tơmam đơ̆ng sư kơdih tăm.

English: But bring here those enemies of mine, who did not want me to reign over them, and slay them before me.’ ”
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ inh, ưh kơ wă kơ inh pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu sư, iĕm dui anhăk lu sư tơ âu, pơlôch lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp inh.’ ”

English: When He had said this, He went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho tơdrong noh đang boih na Sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, Sư yak hơdrol kơ lu đe tơpôl noh.

English: And it came to pass, when He drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called Olivet, that He sent two of His disciples
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu wă jê̆ truh Pơlei Betphagê păng Pơlei Bethani, 'bơ̆t kông Ôliwơ, Yêsu đei wơh 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan

English: saying, “Go into the village opposite you, where as you enter you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Loose it and bring it here.
Bahnar: “Biĕm mơ̆t tơ pơlei tơpăt anăp biĕm to. Lăp biĕm truh tơ noh biĕm 'bôh minh pôm aseh iĕ dăm đe chô̆ 'bơ̆t noh. Aseh noh ưh tam đei bu hao ôh đơ̆ng sơ̆. Biĕm yaih dui anhăk aseh iĕ noh tơ âu.

English: And if anyone asks you, ‘Why are you loosing it?’ thus you shall say to him, ‘Because the Lord has need of it.’ ”
Bahnar: Dah đe khan: ‘Biĕm iŏk pơm kiơ?’ Biĕm khan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang wă yua 'biơ̆.’ ”

English: So those who were sent went their way and found it just as He had said to them.
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư năm truh tơ noh 'bôh 'blep tơpă thoi lĕ Yêsu khan hei.

English: But as they were loosing the colt, the owners of it said to them, “Why are you loosing the colt?”
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư yaih iŏk aseh iĕ noh, na tơ'ngla aseh iĕ noh jet bre sư: “Biĕm iŏk pơm kiơ kơ aseh iĕ noh?”

English: And they said, “The Lord has need of him.”
Bahnar: Bre sư khan: “Kră Yang wă yua 'biơ̆.”

English: Then they brought him to Jesus. And they threw their own clothes on the colt, and they set Jesus on him.
Bahnar: Na bre sư dui anhăk aseh iĕ noh tơ Yêsu. Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih tơ rŏng aseh iĕ, na atŏk Yêsu hao aseh iĕ.

English: And as He went, many spread their clothes on the road.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei hao aseh iĕ nơnăm rok trong na đei lơ bơngai lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih rok trong wă kơ mă rŏ.

English: Then, as He was now drawing near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư jur đơ̆ng kông Ôliwơ, na đei lơlap lơlang lu bơngai lui lu sư chhôk na pơma re 'bơ̆r wă ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ lu sư băt Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơpă. Na lu sư khan

English: saying: “ ‘Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the LORD!’ Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
Bahnar: “Bơnê kơ Pơtao bơ̆n truh tơ âu yua kơ Kră Yang wơh wă ăn kơ bơ̆n hiôk-hian. Bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh ti.”

English: And some of the Pharisees called to Him from the crowd, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”
Bahnar: Na đei lu khŭl Pharisi hơdai năm lăng tơ noh. Lu sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, khă lu bơngai lui kơ Ih 'nĕ pă pơma ư-ang thoi noh.”

English: But He answered and said to them, “I tell you that if these should keep silent, the stones would immediately cry out.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan tơwih kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah lu sư thĕng, lei lu tơmo kư̆m gô pơma ư-ang mơ̆n ưh kơ lê̆ ôh.”

English: Now as He drew near, He saw the city and wept over it
Bahnar: Yêsu năm wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Lăp Sư tơmang 'bôh Pơlei Jêrusalem Sư nhơ̆m hmoi mơnat kơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: saying, “If you had known, even you, especially in this your day, the things that make for your peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
Bahnar: Sư nhơ̆m hmoi rah pơma rah thoi âu: “Ơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, năr âu dah iĕm băt kơ Inh Bơngai wă pơklaih iĕm, lei iĕm hiôk dêh, ưh kơ đei tơdrong gleh truh kơ iĕm năr noh kơnh ôh. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Inh wă pơklaih iĕm dang ei.

English: For days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you, surround you and close you in on every side
Bahnar: “Ning-mônh lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm gô wang tăp dăr kơ pơlei iĕm. Lu sư gô pơgăn trong iĕm păng ưh kơ ăn iĕm jăk achăng pơlei iĕm ôh.

English: and level you, and your children within you, to the ground; and they will not leave in you one stone upon another, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”
Bahnar: “Lu sư gô blah pơchah pơlei pơla iĕm păng pơlôch lu kon pơlei pơla iĕm. Lu sư blah pơchah pơlei pơla iĕm ưh pă đei tơmo ayơ mă tơklep băl dơ̆ng, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih iĕm dang ei.”

English: Then He went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm na Sư pơpuh đe mơdro lăm noh.

English: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’ ”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Đe chih roi nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar sư thoi âu: ‘Hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Inh, wă lê̆ kơ đe krao khan kơ Inh lăm noh.’ Mă-lei lu iĕm mơdro lăm noh, pơgŏ athei đe răt kăp jên, iĕm pơm kơ hnam akŭm âu thoi lĕ kơ anih hnam đe tơtông klĕ.”

English: And He was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people sought to destroy Him
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho rim năr tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Na lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt păng lu đe kră pơlei wă rôp pơlôch Sư ră.

English: and were unable to do anything; for all the people were very attentive to hear Him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ gơh rôp thoi yơ, yua kơ lu sư hli kơ kon bơngai 'bĕnh-'bang hưch hanh wă mơ̆ng Sư bơtho tơpă.

English: Now it happened on one of those days, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, that the chief priests and the scribes, together with the elders, confronted Him
Bahnar: Minh năr ei kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt, hăm lu đe kră sek tơlang năm jet Yêsu khan: “Apinh Ih roi kơ nhôn bu ăn kơ Ih pơpuh đe mơdro đơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu păng chă bơtho đe lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n?”

English: and spoke to Him, saying, “Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Or who is he who gave You this authority?”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt, hăm lu đe kră sek tơlang năm jet Yêsu khan: “Apinh Ih roi kơ nhôn bu ăn kơ Ih pơpuh đe mơdro đơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu păng chă bơtho đe lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n?”

English: But He answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing, and answer Me
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Lei Inh kư̆m wă jet iĕm minh tơdrong mơ̆n. Apinh iĕm roi kơ Inh bu ăn kơ Yôhan pơm kơ đe 'batem noh sơ̆, đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai ăn đĕch?”

English: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Lei Inh kư̆m wă jet iĕm minh tơdrong mơ̆n. Apinh iĕm roi kơ Inh bu ăn kơ Yôhan pơm kơ đe 'batem noh sơ̆, đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai ăn đĕch?”

English: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
Bahnar: Na lu sư pơđâu băl khan: “Bơ̆n wă khan kơ Sư thoi yơ? Dah bơ̆n khan đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, lei Sư khan: ‘Iĕm kuă kơ kiơ lui kơ Yôhan bơtho?’

English: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n khan đơ̆ng kon bơngai, lei hli kơ lu kon pơlei klơ̆m bơ̆n păng tơmo, yua kơ lu sư lui kơ Yôhan bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: So they answered that they did not know where it was from.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu sư khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ băt đơ̆ng bu ăn kơ sư.”

English: And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lei Inh kư̆m ưh kơ roi ăn kơ iĕm bu ăn kơ Inh pơpuh đe păng bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n.”

English: Then He began to tell the people this parable: “A certain man planted a vineyard, leased it to vinedressers, and went into a far country for a long time.
Bahnar: 'Blă kơ noh Yêsu bơtho pơtih gia kơ lu kon pơlei pơla thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm mir wă pơtăm plei hơmu. Sư pơtăm đang boih na ăn kơ đe jang mơng, na tơ'ngla sư năm oei tơ dêh nai đunh tơpă.

English: Now at vintage-time he sent a servant to the vinedressers, that they might give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the vinedressers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
Bahnar: Lăp trŏ kơ bơyan plei hơmu đum boih, na sư wơh minh 'nu đĭch sư năm tơ lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh wă iŏk plei hơmu mă đei 'măn kơ tơ'ngla sư. Mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng mir plei hơmu noh rôp tôn teh tơbrŏk sư hoh hoh đĕch.

English: Again he sent another servant; and they beat him also, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir noh wơh dơ̆ng minh 'nu đĭch sư, mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh kư̆m oei tôn teh păng pơma kơnê̆ kơ sư, tơbrŏk sư hoh hoh đĕch mơ̆n.

English: And again he sent a third; and they wounded him also and cast him out.
Bahnar: “'Bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu noh wơh dơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai jang kơ sư mă pêng. Lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh oei pơm kơnê̆ lei-lăi tôn teh pơjĭ sư, pơpuh sư brŏk hoh hoh đĕch mơ̆n.

English: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. Probably they will respect him when they see him.’
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu noh khan: ‘Inh wă pơm thoi yơ kih? Inh athei wơh kon tơdăm inh mă 'mêm kơdih, rŏ lăng lu đe noh kư̆m chu yom kơ sư mơ̆n thâu.’

English: But when the vinedressers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh 'bôh kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir noh truh tơ lu sư na lu sư pơđâu dih băl khan: ‘Bơngai 'noh boih kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir âu, na dang ei bĕ bơ̆n pơlôch sư na mă mir âu jing mir bơ̆n.’

English: So they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him. Therefore what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
Bahnar: Na lu sư rôp hloi kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu noh hiŏng hơtat tơ jih mir pơlôch hloi. Thoi noh boih na 'bok tơ'ngla mir gô pơm kiơ kơ lu bơngai noh?

English: He will come and destroy those vinedressers and give the vineyard to others.” And when they heard it they said, “Certainly not!”
Bahnar: Sư gô năm pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai noh, na sư pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai nai jang dơ̆ng.” Lăp lu bơngai mơ̆ng Yêsu bơtho kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, na lu sư khan: “Apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ ăn tơdrong noh truh tơ nhôn.”

English: Then He looked at them and said, “What then is this that is written: ‘The stone which the builders rejected Has become the chief cornerstone’?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu lăng tơ lu sư păng khan: “Tơdrong iĕm kuă kơ Inh noh trŏ thoi đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: Tơmo mă thơ̆ man hnam hŭt lê̆, Jing tơmo man 'bơ̆t mum hnam

English: Whoever falls on that stone will be broken; but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder.”
Bahnar: Tơmo mă iĕm kuă noh dah bơngai bu huŏng hơtat kơ tơmo noh, bơngai noh gô tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng ti sư păng pơchah kơ̆l sư. Dah tơmo noh huŏng 'bơm bơngai bu, akâu bơngai noh gô pơchah hĕch hoch thoi 'mui teh.”

English: And the chief priests and the scribes that very hour sought to lay hands on Him, but they feared the people —for they knew He had spoken this parable against them.
Bahnar: Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu 'bok soi tih wă rôp hloi Yêsu kơplah noh ră yua kơ lu sư băt dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơma pơjuang noh hei trŏ hloi kơ lu sư tơpă. Mă-lei lu sư hli kơ lu kon pơlei pơla mă oei mơ̆ng bơtho 'bơ̆t ei, na lu sư jing ưh kơ yĕng kơ rôp Yêsu ôh.

English: So they watched Him, and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, that they might seize on His words, in order to deliver Him to the power and the authority of the governor.
Bahnar: Lu sư lăng tông Yêsu ling-lang wă chă tơdrong gơh rôp Sư. Lu sư wơh bôl sư năm tơ Yêsu pơm thoi bơngai tơpăt na sư jet pơlong Yêsu. Dah Yêsu pơma khă gah tơdrong juăt teh đak, lu sư wă rôp anhăk pơjao ăn kơ 'bok tih sek tơlang.

English: Then they asked Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You say and teach rightly, and You do not show personal favoritism, but teach the way of God in truth
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn băt kơ Ih bơtho tơpăt tơpă. Ih ưh kơ hli kơ bu ôh. Ih lăng lu bơngai pơm tih hăm bơngai iĕ kư̆m lei-lăi ngăl păng Ih ling-lang bơtho tơpăt gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
Bahnar: Na nhôn apinh Ih khan kơ nhôn, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n bơngai Juđê, bơ̆n hăm gơh ăn jên thuê̆ kơ Sêsar, pơtao đe Rôm mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n dah ưh?”

English: But He perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test Me?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu băt kơ lu đe noh wă plĕch-ploch kơ Sư na Sư khan kơ lu đe noh thoi âu

English: Show Me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?” They answered and said, “Caesar’s.”
Bahnar: “Iĕm ăn kơ Inh minh hlak jên iĕm tơ âu wă kơ Inh lăng.” Lăp đe ei ăn, na Sư jet lu đe ei khan: “Rup bu âu? Anăn bu âu?” Lu sư khan: “'Noh rup Sêsar păng anăn Sêsar mơ̆n.”

English: And He said to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu khan: “Jên âu rup Sêsar tơpă na bơ̆n athei thuê̆ kơ sư yua kơ sư pơgơ̆r. Tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n athei pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ Sư tơgŭm ăn kơ bơ̆n.”

English: But they could not catch Him in His words in the presence of the people. And they marveled at His answer and kept silent.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơm kơ Yêsu wă kơ Sư pơma yoch 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei pơla ôh. Na lu sư thĕng pă đei jet dơ̆ng boih yua kơ lu sư mơ̆ng Yêsu pơma tơwih kơ lu sư trŏ tơpă.

English: Then some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is a resurrection, came to Him and asked Him
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Sađusê. Lu sư khan kon bơngai lôch ưh kơ iung arih dơ̆ng ôh. Lu sư mơ'nah năm pơjah pơjăng păng Yêsu na lu sư jet Yêsu thoi âu

English: saying: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies, having a wife, and he dies without children, his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Môis chih ată kơ bơ̆n sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘'Nhŏng bu lôch, mi sư adro ưh kơ đei kon, oh sư athei iŏk mi sư pơm akăn na pơjing kon kơ 'nhŏng sư.’

English: Now there were seven brothers. And the first took a wife, and died without children.
Bahnar: Na sơ̆ đei minh pôm hnam dơnŏ đei tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh. 'Nhŏng kơdră lu sư iŏk akăn. Lăp 'nhŏng lu sư lôch ưh tam mă đei kon

English: And the second took her as wife, and he died childless.
Bahnar: na oh sư mă 'bar iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng. Oh sư mă 'bar lôch kư̆m ưh tam mă đei kon mơ̆n.

English: Then the third took her, and in like manner the seven also; and they left no children, and died.
Bahnar: Oh sư mă pêng iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng, mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon na lôch hĭ. Tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư noh iŏk minh 'nu akăn, na lôch hoh-hoy kơ pơjing 'măn lê̆ kon 'biơ̆.

English: Last of all the woman died also.
Bahnar: Tơpo hơtuch akăn lu sư noh kư̆m lôch kiơ̆ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife does she become? For all seven had her as wife.”
Bahnar: Ih khan kon bơngai gô iung arih, na mưh lu sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh, akăn lu sư 'noh jing akăn bu kơ lu sư mă tơpă, yua kơ tơpơh 'nu drŏ-nglo iŏk minh 'nu drŏ-kăn? Lu khŭl Sađusê pơjah pơjăng păng Sư thoi noh wă kơ Sư thuơ pơma ưh kơ trŏ.”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lu bơngai ala teh âu tơiŏk dih băl

English: But those who are counted worthy to attain that age, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage
Bahnar: mă-lei lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih sư, ăn sư gơh iung arih ning-mônh, lu sư ưh pă tơiŏk dih băl dơ̆ng boih.

English: nor can they die anymore, for they are equal to the angels and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi lĕ kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei păng ưh kơ gơh lôch ôh. Lu sư kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: But even Moses showed in the burning bush passage that the dead are raised, when he called the Lord ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
Bahnar: Môis kư̆m tơbăt kơ bơ̆n tơdrong kon bơngai iung arih dơ̆ng, kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma păng sư tơ tơm 'long ŭnh sa sơ̆. Kơplah noh sơ̆ Môis anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang wei-lăng Abraham, Kră Yang wei-lăng Isăk, Kră Yang wei-lăng Jakôp.

English: For He is not the God of the dead but of the living, for all live to Him.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu lôch đĭ boih kơplah noh sơ̆, mă-lei bơ̆n băt kơ lu sư gô iung arih đĭ tôm kơ lu sư yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang wei-lăng gah tơdrong arih, ưh kơ sĭ Sư wei-lăng gah tơdrong lôch ôh. Dôm lu bơngai lui kơ Sư mă lôch tơ ala teh âu, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư iung arih wă pơang anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
Bahnar: Đei lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê mơ'nah khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih drơ̆ng hơgei tơpă.”

English: But after that they dared not question Him anymore.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh đe ưh pă pơ̆n jet Yêsu dơ̆ng boih.

English: And He said to them, “How can they say that the Christ is the Son of David?
Bahnar: Yêsu jet lu đe ei khan: “Lơliơ lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê khan 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơm Pơtao, Sư kon sâu pơtao Đawit đĕch?

English: Now David himself said in the Book of Psalms: ‘The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit khan tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Tơdrong Hơri Sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Yŏng Kơdră inh thoi âu: Ih kư̆ kơ oei gah 'ma kơ Inh pơgơ̆r

English: Till I make Your enemies Your footstool.” ’
Bahnar: tơ̆p Inh blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Ih thuơ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Ih.’

English: Therefore David calls Him ‘Lord’; how is He then his Son?”
Bahnar: Đawit krao kơ 'Bok Krist Yŏng Kơdră sư, na lơliơ dang ei khan 'Bok Krist jing kon sâu Đawit đĕch lĕ?”

English: Then, in the hearing of all the people, He said to His disciples
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, na đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla kiơ̆ ei oei mơ̆ng Sư mơ̆n.

English: And He looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the treasury
Bahnar: Yêsu hue lăng lu bơngai mơdrŏng pơyơ̆r tah jên lơ tơpă lăm kơthŭng tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm.

English: and He saw also a certain poor widow putting in two mites.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu kư̆m 'bôh minh 'nu yă adro dơnuh tah lăp 'bar hlak jên ngang.

English: So He said, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ei thoi âu: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yă adro dơnuh âu sư dang tah lơ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bôl buăl nai

English: for all these out of their abundance have put in offerings for God, but she out of her poverty put in all the livelihood that she had.”
Bahnar: kơlih kơ lu bôl nai pơyơ̆r tơmam rơkah sư đĕch; yă adro âu dơnuh tơpă, mă-lei sư pơyơ̆r đĭ hloi jên sa sư.”

English: Then, as some spoke of the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and donations, He said
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei 'bơ̆t ei 'bôh hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm pơm păng tơmo rŏ păng 'bôh tơmam đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ pơm tơmam pơrŏ tơ hnam akŭm Sư, lu sư pơma khan: “Ô rŏ dêh.”

English: “These things which you see—the days will come in which not one stone shall be left upon another that shall not be thrown down.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Iĕm 'bôh boih hnam akŭm tơm âu 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă-lei ning-mônh hnam âu gô pơchah reng 'beng ưh pă đei tơmo ayơ tơklep băl dơ̆ng. Đe gô teh pơchah đĭ.”

English: So they asked Him, saying, “Teacher, but when will these things be? And what sign will there be when these things are about to take place?”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, apinh Ih roi kơ nhôn layơ đe wă pơrăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm păng wă kơ nhôn băt tơdra thoi yơ tơdrong noh gô truh.”

English: And He said: “Take heed that you not be deceived. For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and, ‘The time has drawn near.’ Therefore do not go after them.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih hli kơ đe wă pơhlŭ pơlung iĕm kiơ̆ sư. Ning-mônh gô đei lơ bơngai truh, na lu sư anăn măt Inh khan sư kơdih 'Bok Krist păng khan wă jê̆ truh năr tôch boih. 'Noh iĕm 'nĕ kiơ̆ kơ lu sư hŏ.

English: But when you hear of wars and commotions, do not be terrified; for these things must come to pass first, but the end will not come immediately.”
Bahnar: Mă iĕm kơtơ̆ng đe tơblah mă tih, mă iĕ, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli hŏ. Tơdrong noh ưh kơ jor ôh, gô đei 'mơ̆i, mă-lei năr tôch ưh tam mă truh ôh kơplah noh.”

English: Then He said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei bơtho khan: “Kơplah ei kơnh dêh âu gô iung blah dêh to, dêh to iung blah dêh nai.

English: And there will be great earthquakes in various places, and famines and pestilences; and there will be fearful sights and great signs from heaven.
Bahnar: Gô đei teh adrŏ kơtang păng đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt păng lôch hơbuh lơ tơring âu tơring to. Iĕm gô 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch hlăch krưp tơpă tơ kơpal plĕnh.

English: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons. You will be brought before kings and rulers for My name’s sake.
Bahnar: “Hơdrol kơ iĕm wă 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh ning-mônh na đe gô rôp iĕm păng pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm. Đe gô jao iĕm ăn kơ đe kră sek tơlang tơ lăm hnam akŭm đe Juđê, na tah iĕm lăm hnam phak. Đe kư̆m gô anhăk iĕm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu 'bok tih hăm lu 'bok pơtao yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh.

English: But it will turn out for you as an occasion for testimony.
Bahnar: Đe rôp iĕm ră, mă-lei iĕm kư̆m gơh ră roi kơ sư tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng kơplah iĕm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: Therefore settle it in your hearts not to meditate beforehand on what you will answer
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ mah tơchĕng hơdrol kơ tơdrong iĕm wă pơma dŏng akâu iĕm kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư

English: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to contradict or resist.
Bahnar: yua kơ Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm 'bơ̆r đon hơgei, na lu bơngai ayăt 'noh gô thuơ kơ iĕm.

English: You will be betrayed even by parents and brothers, relatives and friends; and they will put some of you to death.
Bahnar: “Lu mĕ 'bă iĕm hăm 'nhŏng oh iĕm păng kơtum kơtŏng iĕm, bôl juăt iĕm, gô jao iĕm ăn kơ đe kră sek tơlang, na lu iĕm mơ'nah sư gô pơlôch.

English: And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ bơngai gô areh arĕnh kơ iĕm yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh.

English: But not a hair of your head shall be lost.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah tơdrong arih ling-lang, iĕm ưh kơ hiong kiơ ôh, mă khan minh dăng sŏk kư̆m ưh kơ hiong mơ̆n.

English: By your patience possess your souls.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm adrin tơpă lei iĕm huay kơ hiong tơdrong arih ling-lang ôh.”

English: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is near.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei bơtho lu sư thoi âu: “Lăp iĕm 'bôh linh lơ tơpă oei tăp dăr kơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, lei iĕm băt kơ lu sư wă jê̆ mơ̆t blah lăm pơlei iĕm pơchah pơchek đĭ.

English: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those who are in the midst of her depart, and let not those who are in the country enter her.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai mă oei tơ dêh Juđê athei jăk tơ kông, lu bơngai mă oei lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem âu athei kơdâu jăk đơ̆ng pơlei, lu bơngai mă oei tơ 'ngoaih Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nĕ pă mơ̆t tơ pơlei dơ̆ng.

English: For these are the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
Bahnar: Năr noh kơnh trŏ kơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu bơngai Juđê thoi sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan mă đơ̆ng sơ̆, gô trŏ kơ năr noh tơpă.

English: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath upon this people.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh, lu bơngai drŏ-kăn akâu kơhioh păng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn tơmŏm kon, lu sư pơmat-tat dêh. Gô đei tơdrong anat anot gleh tơpă yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu bơngai Juđê âu.

English: And they will fall by the edge of the sword, and be led away captive into all nations. And Jerusalem will be trampled by Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
Bahnar: Đe gô koh pơlôch lu sư păng đao. Đe gô rôp lu sư, anhăk lu sư jơ̆p kơ teh đak pơm bơnă đe. Lu bơngai dêh đe gô pơjuă pơđep Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư rơngei đơ̆ng lu bơngai dêh đe ning-mônh.

English: “And there will be signs in the sun, in the moon, and in the stars; and on the earth distress of nations, with perplexity, the sea and the waves roaring
Bahnar: “Iĕm gô 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch hlăch tơ măt 'năr, tơ măt khei păng lu sơnglŏng mơ̆n. Tơ ala teh âu lu teh đak đei tơdrong gleh tơpă. Lu sư hli kơ jơwa đak dơsĭ poh-yă tih.

English: men’s hearts failing them from fear and the expectation of those things which are coming on the earth, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei gô gơgŭ sơnglŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh na kon bơngai chang gô kơ tơdrong anat anot wă truh tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ ala teh âu, na lu sư hli dang lĕ kơ wă lôch.

English: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đe gô 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơsêh mơyang tih-tin jur hăm hơmơ̆l.

English: Now when these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption draws near.”
Bahnar: Lăp iĕm pơtơm 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh hei na iĕm hiôk chơt, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă dŏng pơklaih iĕm boih.”

English: Then He spoke to them a parable: “Look at the fig tree, and all the trees.
Bahnar: Yêsu roi pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Iĕm tơchĕng lăng kơ 'long hơra păng mă dôm lu 'long nai.

English: When they are already budding, you see and know for yourselves that summer is now near.
Bahnar: Lăp iĕm 'bôh dơng sư hơđoh chăt hla, 'noh iĕm băt kơ wă jê̆ bơyan 'mi boih.

English: So you also, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n. Ning-mônh lăp iĕm 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh, iĕm băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pôk Inh jur pơm Pơtao iĕm boih.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, this generation will by no means pass away till all things take place.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, jơhnơr noh gô 'bôh tơpă tôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by no means pass away.
Bahnar: Plĕnh teh gô hiong tôch đĭ, mă-lei dôm tơdrong Inh pơma ưh kơ đei layơ hiong tôch ôh, gô 'bôh tơpă.

English: “But take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts be weighed down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that Day come on you unexpectedly.
Bahnar: “Na kơplah iĕm oei arih dang ei, iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih 'nĕ kơ nŏng kơ et sik, hli kơ suai. Păng 'nĕ pă hăt kơ tơdrong ala teh, hli kơ năr noh truh kơplah iĕm ưh kơ kơchăng, tabơla haih pă tam thoi bơngai 'leh 'năk. Na tơdrong noh wă truh tơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak ning-mônh kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: For it will come as a snare on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth.
Bahnar: “Na kơplah iĕm oei arih dang ei, iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih 'nĕ kơ nŏng kơ et sik, hli kơ suai. Păng 'nĕ pă hăt kơ tơdrong ala teh, hli kơ năr noh truh kơplah iĕm ưh kơ kơchăng, tabơla haih pă tam thoi bơngai 'leh 'năk. Na tơdrong noh wă truh tơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak ning-mônh kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Watch therefore, and pray always that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will come to pass, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei kơchăng păng krao khan ling-lang wă kơ iĕm kĕ ĕnh dôm tơdrong noh na dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh Kon Bơngai ning-mônh.”

English: And in the daytime He was teaching in the temple, but at night He went out and stayed on the mountain called Olivet.
Bahnar: Rim năr lăm hơdôm năr noh Yêsu bơtho đe tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm đơ̆ng pơgê truh kơsơ̆. Tơ kơsơ̆ Sư brŏk 'bĭch tơ pơlei đe tơ kơpal kông Ôliwơ.

English: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread drew near, which is called Passover.
Bahnar: Wă jê̆ truh năr giĕng sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông mă đe kư̆m anăn Giĕng Năm Brih.

English: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might kill Him, for they feared the people.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, lu sư chă đon wă kơ gơh tơtông rôp pơlôch Yêsu, yua kơ lu sư hli kơ rôp Yêsu 'bơ̆t anăp đe kon pơlei pơla.

English: Then Satan entered Judas, surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered among the twelve.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh yang Satan mơ̆t lăm jơhngơ̆m Juđa mă đe kư̆m anăn Ikariôt, bơngai minh 'nu đơ̆ng lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu.

English: So he went his way and conferred with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray Him to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Juđa năm tơ lu 'bok soi tih păng lu kră linh gak hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm wă chă tơdrong thoi yơ gơh rôp Yêsu jao kơ lu sư.

English: And they were glad, and agreed to give him money.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi păng lu kră linh noh lăp đon tơpă mah pơkă khan wă apah kơ Juđa jên.

English: So he promised and sought opportunity to betray Him to them in the absence of the multitude.
Bahnar: Na Juđa kư̆m pơkă kơ lu sư wă khŏm jao Yêsu kơ lu sư tơpă. Đơ̆ng noh Juđa chă tơdrong wă kơ gơh rôp Yêsu jao ăn kơ lu 'bok tih ei kơplah hrĕp wă kơ kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ băt.

English: Then came the Day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover must be killed.
Bahnar: Trŏ kơ năr đe pơm giĕng boih, na rim kơ đe juăt kơ 'bet sa triu kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông.

English: And He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”
Bahnar: Yêsu wơh Pêtrôs hăm Yôhan: “Biĕm năm hơmet kơ bơ̆n tơmam sa bĕ, yua kơ trŏ năr giĕng boih.”

English: So they said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare?”
Bahnar: Bre sư jet Yêsu: “Ih wă kơ nhi hơmet kơ bơ̆n tơmam sa tơ yơ?”

English: And He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered the city, a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him into the house which he enters.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Đơ̆ng âu biĕm mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, tơ ei biĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai glơng ge đak, na biĕm kiơ̆ hloi sư. Sư mơ̆t tơ hnam ayơ, biĕm mơ̆t kiơ̆ sư tơ noh hloi mơ̆n.

English: Then you shall say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?” ’
Bahnar: Na biĕm apinh tơ'ngla hnam noh thoi âu: ‘'Bok Thây athei nhi jet ih, tơ yơ anih Sư wă sŏng sa kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kư̆m wă sŏng sa hơdai hăm Sư mơ̆n?’

English: Then he will show you a large, furnished upper room; there make ready.”
Bahnar: Biĕm apinh sư thoi noh, sư gô tơ'bôh kơ biĕm minh pôm anih să tôch tơ kơpal ti, đei bơ̆n gơ'bang tang-dŏ sư hơmet lê̆ tôm boih, na biĕm hơmet kơ bơ̆n tơmam sa tơ ei.”

English: So they went and found it just as He had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na Pêtrôs hăm Yôhan năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem 'bôh tơpă dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơkă noh hei. Na bre sư hơmet lê̆ tơmam sŏng sa kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih tơ ei hloi.

English: When the hour had come, He sat down, and the twelve apostles with Him.
Bahnar: Trŏ jơ sŏng sa, na Yêsu hăm lu jơ̆ng 'bang Sư tơoei sŏng sa hơdai tơ gơ'bang tang-dŏ noh.

English: Then He said to them, “With fervent desire I have desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh lăp đon hiôk tơpă đei sŏng sa kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih hơdai hăm iĕm hơdrol kơ Inh wă lôch.

English: for I say to you, I will no longer eat of it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh pă đei sŏng sa tơdrong Giĕng Năm Brih thoi âu boih tơ̆p mă truh tơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r ning-mônh 'mơ̆i, na sa dơ̆ng. Kơplah ei kơnh kon bơngai gô klaih rơngei tơpă.”

English: Then He took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu iŏk minh pôm kơchŏk đak hơmu, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na khan: “Iĕm iŏk kơchŏk đak hơmu âu asong dih băl huch.

English: for I say to you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh pă huch boih đak hơmu âu tơ̆p mă truh tơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r ning-mônh 'mơ̆i.”

English: And He took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body which is given for you; do this in remembrance of Me.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi noh asong kơ lu sư păng khan: “'Bĕng âu boih akâu Inh. Akâu Inh âu boih Inh ăn lôch tang kơ iĕm. Iĕm kư̆m athei pơm thoi âu ling-lang wă 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Inh.”

English: Likewise He also took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood, which is shed for you.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sŏng sa Sư iŏk minh pôm kơchŏk đak hơmu păng khan: “Kơchŏk đak hơmu âu boih pham Inh wă lĕch tang ăn kơ lu iĕm. Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: But behold, the hand of My betrayer is with Me on the table.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Inh, sư oei sŏng sa hơdai păng Inh dang ei.

English: And truly the Son of Man goes as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai gô lôch 'blep trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, mă-lei mơnat kơ bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Inh 'noh đĕch pŭ tơdrong pơmat.”

English: Then they began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơjet dih băl khan: “Bu lăm lu bơ̆n wă plĕch kơ Yêsu kih?”

English: Now there was also a dispute among them, as to which of them should be considered the greatest.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu pơjah pơjăng dih băl kơ tơdrong lăm lu sư bu tih hloh kơ tơduă sư.

English: And He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lu 'bok pơtao dêh đe, lu sư chă wơh pơgŏ lu bơngai sư pơgơ̆r. Mă-lei sư kư̆m lăp đon kơ lu bơngai sư pơgơ̆r noh khan kơ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng gơh tơgŭm kon tơring.

English: But not so among you; on the contrary, he who is greatest among you, let him be as the younger, and he who governs as he who serves.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm rok lu 'bok pơgơ̆r noh hŏ. Bơngai bu 'maih pơm 'bok tih lăm lu iĕm, lei bơngai noh athei pơm iĕ hloh kơ đe. Dah bơngai bu 'maih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm lu iĕm, bơngai noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch iĕm.

English: For who is greater, he who sits at the table, or he who serves? Is it not he who sits at the table? Yet I am among you as the One who serves.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu tih hloh kơ bre sư, bơngai mă awih awăn kơ yŏng sư sa noh, dah yŏng sư tih hloh? Yŏng sư boih tih hloh kơ đĭch sư. Mă-lei kơplah Inh oei hơdai păng lu iĕm, Inh dang đĭch awih awăn kơ iĕm.

English: “But you are those who have continued with Me in My trials.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei Inh đei lơ tơdrong đe chă pơm kơ Inh, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ achăng lê̆ Inh ôh.

English: And I bestow upon you a kingdom, just as My Father bestowed one upon Me
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm pơgơ̆r đe kư̆m thoi 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh pơgơ̆r iĕm mơ̆n.

English: that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
Bahnar: Iĕm gô sŏng sa hơdai păng Inh kơplah Inh pơgơ̆r ning-mônh păng iĕm kư̆m pơm pơtao sek tơlang kơ mơjĭt-'bar khŭl bơngai Isơrael.

English: And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as wheat.
Bahnar: “Ơ Pêtrôs, ih mơ̆ng Inh 'biơ̆ bĕ. Yang Satan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơlong lăng tơdrong lui lu iĕm thoi lĕ đe wă um 'ba.

English: But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you have returned to Me, strengthen your brethren.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ Sư tơgŭm ih huay kơ tŭk lê̆ tơdrong lui ih. Na lăp ih kơnăl tơdrong ih wă sơngah kơ Inh noh kơnh, na ih athei pơlung lu 'nhŏng oh ih âu wă kơ lu sư kư̆m lui kơjăp dơ̆ng.”

English: But he said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with You, both to prison and to death.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, mă đe tah inh lăm hnam phak hơdai păng Ih, dah pơlôch inh hơdai păng Ih, mă-lei inh kư̆m ưh kơ wă sơngah kơ Ih ôh.”

English: Then He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster shall not crow this day before you will deny three times that you know Me.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Ơ Pêtrôs, Inh khan kơ ih tơpă, măng kơnh boih, hơdrol kơ iĕr wă ŏ, ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng khan ih ưh kơ băt kơ Inh.”

English: And He said to them, “When I sent you without money bag, knapsack, and sandals, did you lack anything?” So they said, “Nothing.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư dơ̆ng: “Sơ̆ Inh wơh iĕm năm chă bơtho đe, na Inh khan kơ iĕm 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba jên, mă kơdŭng tah tơmam, dah chơkhŏ, na iĕm hăm kơ'bah kơ tơdrong kiơ ưh sơ̆?” Lu sư tơl: “Nhôn ưh kơ đei kơ'bah tơdrong kiơ ôh sơ̆.”

English: Then He said to them, “But now, he who has a money bag, let him take it, and likewise a knapsack; and he who has no sword, let him sell his garment and buy one.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Mă-lei dang ei tơdrong gleh wă truh boih na bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm đei jên dah kơdŭng tah tơmam, lu iĕm athei chĕp ba tơmam iĕm noh. Bơngai bu ưh kơ đei đao athei tĕch ao sư na blơ̆ chă đao.

English: For I say to you that this which is written must still be accomplished in Me: ‘And He was numbered with the transgressors.’ For the things concerning Me have an end.”
Bahnar: Sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: Đe jô̆ kơ Inh bơngai yoch trŏ kơ pơlôch. Na bơ̆n gô 'bôh đe jô̆ kơ Inh thoi noh tơpă. Na dôm tơdrong đe chih lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ gah Inh bơ̆n gô 'bôh tôm tơpă.”

English: So they said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It is enough.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih lăng, nhôn đei 'bar hlak đao boih.” Yêsu khan: “Lei huay boih.”

English: Coming out, He went to the Mount of Olives, as He was accustomed, and His disciples also followed Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu yak đơ̆ng ei năm tơ kông Ôliwơ kư̆m thoi brei mơsơ̆ mơ̆n. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kư̆m kiơ̆ hơdai Sư.

English: When He came to the place, He said to them, “Pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ ei, Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm athei krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ iĕm huay kơ lui kơ yang Satan pơhlŭ.”

English: And He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and prayed
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu năm ataih ataih 'biơ̆ kơ lu đe noh na Sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: saying, “Father, if it is Your will, take this cup away from Me; nevertheless not My will, but Yours, be done.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ 'Bă, dah gơh, lei ăn kơ Inh gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong gleh âu. Mă-lei Ih 'nĕ pơm kiơ̆ kơ Inh, pơm kiơ̆ kơ Ih đĕch.”

English: Then an angel appeared to Him from heaven, strengthening Him.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng noh blư kơ minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng plĕnh jur tơ Sư wă tơgŭm Sư.

English: And being in agony, He prayed more earnestly. Then His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
Bahnar: Yêsu hli sơ'ngon tơpă, na Sư rai adrin krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei rai dêh mah tuh bơuh bơang thoi lĕ kơ pham lĕch đơ̆ng akâu Sư.

English: When He rose up from prayer, and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow.
Bahnar: Yêsu iung đơ̆ng krao khan wih tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'bôh lu sư oei tep, yua kơ lu sư sơ'ngon dêh.

English: Then He said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray, lest you enter into temptation.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm tep? Iung adrin krao khan 'biơ̆ bĕ, wă kơ iĕm huay kơ lui kơ yang Satan pơhlŭ.”

English: And while He was still speaking, behold, a multitude; and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them and drew near to Jesus to kiss Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma na blư hloi kơ lu bơngai lơ truh tơ Sư. Juđa, bơngai mă đơ̆ng lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu ră, sư anhăk ba lu bơngai wă năm rôp Yêsu. Na Juđa năm hloi tơ Yêsu wă chŭm Sư kiơ̆ thoi đe Juđê juăt kơ kơkuh dih băl.

English: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan hloi kơ sư thoi âu: “Ơ Juđa, lơliơ mă ih pơm pơrŏ chŭm Inh wă plơ̆ plĕch Inh Kon Bơngai?”

English: When those around Him saw what was going to happen, they said to Him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu 'bôh đe wă năm rôp Yêsu boih na lu sư jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih hăm wă kơ nhôn koh lu sư păng đao?”

English: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
Bahnar: Na minh 'nu lăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu hloch hloi đao koh kơtĕch hloi hla đon gah 'ma đĭch 'bok soi tơm.

English: But Jesus answered and said, “Permit even this.” And He touched his ear and healed him.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ koh lu sư.” Na Sư pel đon đĭch 'bok soi, na klaih hloi.

English: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and the elders who had come to Him, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu 'bok soi tih, hăm lu kră linh gak hnam akŭm tơm păng lu đe kră mă năm rôp Sư, thoi âu: “Lơliơ iĕm năm tơ âu chĕp tak đao 'long tơnôn dang lĕ đe wă rôp bơngai tơtông klĕ?

English: When I was with you daily in the temple, you did not try to seize Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
Bahnar: Bĭ rim năr Inh oei tơ tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm tơ lăm hnam akŭm tơm, na iĕm kuă kơ kiơ kơ rôp Inh tơ noh lĕ? Mă-lei iĕm oei kiơ̆ kơ yang Satan mă oei pơgơ̆r dôm lu bơngai oei lăm măng mu na trŏ năr iĕm rôp Inh boih.”

English: Having arrested Him, they led Him and brought Him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed at a distance.
Bahnar: Na lu sư rôp hloi Yêsu anhăk Sư tơ hnam 'bok soi tơm. Na Pêtrôs kiơ̆ lăng Sư đơ̆ng rŏng đơ̆ng rŏng Sư ataih ataih.

English: Now when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.
Bahnar: Đe rŭk ŭnh tơ tŏk-bŏk cham 'bok soi tơm, na đe oei nhur ŭnh. Na Pêtrôs kư̆m năm nhur ŭnh tơ ei hơdai hăm lu sư mơ̆n.

English: And a certain servant girl, seeing him as he sat by the fire, looked intently at him and said, “This man was also with Him.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn đam 'bok soi tơm oei ngôi kiơ̆ cham ei, sư kơnăl kơ Pêtrôs nhên yua kơ hơdah ŭnh, na sư 'bloh lăng Pêtrôs khan hloi: “Bơngai âu kư̆m oei hơdai păng Yêsu mơ̆n.”

English: But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs sơngah khan: “Ơ duch, inh ưh kơ băt kơ Sư ôh.”

English: And after a little while another saw him and said, “You also are of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
Bahnar: Lăp đunh 'biơ̆ kơ noh đei minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng 'bôh sư khan hloi: “Ih kư̆m khŭl Yêsu mơ̆n lah.” Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ ma, inh ưh kơ sĭ khŭl Sư ôh.”

English: Then after about an hour had passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Surely this fellow also was with Him, for he is a Galilean.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dang minh jơ đei minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng khan thoi âu: “'Nâu kư̆m bơngai oei hơdai păng Sư tơpă yua kơ sư kư̆m bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Galilê thoi Yêsu mơ̆n.”

English: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ ma, inh ưh kơ băt ôh ih wă pơma kơ inh tơdrong kiơ ră.” Kơplah Pêtrôs oei pơma sơngah kơ tơdrong ei, lêk kơ iĕr ŏ hloi.

English: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu hue lăng Pêtrôs, na Pêtrôs 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang Yêsu pơma pơkă lê̆ hơdrol hei khan: “Măng kơnh boih hơdrol kơ iĕr wă ŏ ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng.”

English: So Peter went out and wept bitterly.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na sư lĕch hmoi ơh kơdih sư.

English: Now the men who held Jesus mocked Him and beat Him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gak Yêsu tôn teh che bơle kơ Sư.

English: And having blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, saying, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck You?”
Bahnar: Lu sư đơ̆p muh măt Yêsu păng che na tŭr akâu Sư păng khan: “Ih mơsêh, Ih mơyang na dang ei roi lăng kơ nhôn bu tŭr Ih.”

English: And many other things they blasphemously spoke against Him.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma che bơle kơ Sư tôm tĕch.

English: As soon as it was day, the elders of the people, both chief priests and scribes, came together and led Him into their council, saying
Bahnar: Lăp 'brưch hơdah til pơgê 'nei, lu 'bok soi tih păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, hăm đĭ-đăng lu kră nai mă pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê akŭm dih băl. Na đe anhăk ba Yêsu tơ anăp lu sư. Na lu sư khan kơ Yêsu thoi âu

English: “If You are the Christ, tell us.” But He said to them, “If I tell you, you will by no means believe.
Bahnar: “Dah Ih 'Bok Krist tơpă, Ih jah roi kơ nhôn bĕ.” Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Mă Inh roi kơ iĕm, iĕm kư̆m kuă kơ lui kơ Inh.

English: And if I also ask you, you will by no means answer Me or let Me go.
Bahnar: Mă Inh jet iĕm tơdrong kiơ kiơ, iĕm kư̆m kuă kơ drơ̆ng Inh mơ̆n.

English: Hereafter the Son of Man will sit on the right hand of the power of God.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng âu truh tơ ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă mơsêh mơyang tơpă na pơgơ̆r.”

English: Then they all said, “Are You then the Son of God?” So He said to them, “You rightly say that I am.”
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu sư jet Yêsu: “Lei Ih hăm trŏ Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh?” Na Yêsu tơl sư khan: “Trŏ tơpă yơh.”

English: And they said, “What further testimony do we need? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan: “Bơ̆n mah kăl kơ kiơ chă bơngai nai wă jâu Sư dơ̆ng, yua kơ đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng boih Sư pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then the whole multitude of them arose and led Him to Pilate.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư iung anhăk ba Yêsu năm tơ anăp 'bok tih pơgơ̆r dêh Juđê anăn sư Pilat. Sư bơngai Rôm.

English: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this fellow perverting the nation, and forbidding to pay taxes to Caesar, saying that He Himself is Christ, a King.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jâu Yêsu 'bơ̆t anăp Pilat khan: “Nhôn 'bôh bơngai 'nâu boih pơchŭt đe kon tơring tơrang, Sư khă lu nhôn ưh kơ wă kơ nhôn ăn jên thuê̆ kơ 'bok pơtao bơ̆n Sêsar. Na Sư khan Sư kư̆m Pơtao mơ̆n, anăn Sư 'Bok Krist.”

English: Then Pilate asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He answered him and said, “It is as you say.”
Bahnar: Na Pilat jet Yêsu khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ Ih pơm Pơtao đe Juđê?” Na Yêsu tơl Pilat khan: “Trŏ kơ Inh boih.”

English: So Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowd, “I find no fault in this Man.”
Bahnar: Na Pilat khan kơ lu 'bok soi tih păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl oei kiơ̆ ei: “Inh 'bôh bơngai 'nâu ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh.”

English: But they were the more fierce, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to this place.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư khan thoi âu dơ̆ng wă pơlŭt Pilat kư̆m jâu Sư bơngai yoch: “Yêsu âu chă pơchŭt đe kon tơring tơrang jơ̆p kơ dêh Juđê đơ̆ng tơring Galilê mah truh tơ bơ̆n âu.”

English: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked if the Man were a Galilean.
Bahnar: Lăp Pilat kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na sư jet lu đe noh thoi âu: “Yêsu âu hăm trŏ kơ bơngai Galilê dah ưh?”

English: And as soon as he knew that He belonged to Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Pilat thoi âu: “Sư bơngai Galilê tơpă.” Na mă Pilat wơh đe anhăk ba Sư tơ pơtao Hêrôt, yua kơ Hêrôt pơgơ̆r dêh Galilê. Hêrôt hơtai ei sư năm ngôi tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad; for he had desired for a long time to see Him, because he had heard many things about Him, and he hoped to see some miracle done by Him.
Bahnar: Lăp Hêrôt 'bôh Yêsu na sư hiôk tơpă yua kơ Hêrôt đơ̆ng sơ̆ chang wă tơ'bơ̆p Yêsu ră, yua kơ sư kơtơ̆ng ang Yêsu gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang na sư 'maih lăng dêh.

English: Then he questioned Him with many words, but He answered him nothing.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Hêrôt jet Sư lơ tơdrong mă-lei Yêsu 'nhŏ kơ drơ̆ng hơya minh nơ̆r 'biơ̆.

English: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused Him.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê kư̆m oei 'bơ̆t ei mơ̆n na lu sư jâu Yêsu dêh.

English: Then Herod, with his men of war, treated Him with contempt and mocked Him, arrayed Him in a gorgeous robe, and sent Him back to Pilate.
Bahnar: Na Hêrôt păng lu linh sư che bơle pơ'brơh kơ Yêsu. Lu sư pơhrŭk ăn kơ Yêsu ao tai rŏ tơpă pơm thoi pơtao na tơwih Sư tơ Pilat dơ̆ng.

English: That very day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other, for previously they had been at enmity with each other.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ bre Hêrôt păng Pilat, bre sư areh arĕnh dih băl ră, mă-lei truh năr 'nei bre sư jing tơmơ̆t băl pôm jơhngơ̆m đon.

English: Then Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people
Bahnar: Na Pilat krao akŭm lu 'bok soi tih, lu đe kră tơring păng lu kon pơlei pơla.

English: said to them, “You have brought this Man to me, as one who misleads the people. And indeed, having examined Him in your presence, I have found no fault in this Man concerning those things of which you accuse Him
Bahnar: Na Pilat khan kơ lu đe noh thoi âu: “Iĕm anhăk bơngai âu tơ inh hei, iĕm pơtă kơ Sư khan Sư pơchŭt lu kon tơring tơrang pơm ưh kơ lăp. Mă-lei inh sek tơlang Sư 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm hei inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh gah tơdrong iĕm ată kơ Sư noh.

English: no, neither did Herod, for I sent you back to him; and indeed nothing deserving of death has been done by Him.
Bahnar: Hêrôt kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh Sư pơm tơdrong yoch mơ̆n, na sư mah tơwih Yêsu tơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng. Sư ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong yoch ôh, na lơliơ bơ̆n pơlôch Sư gơh trŏ lĕ?

English: I will therefore chastise Him and release Him”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu linh teh pơjĭ Sư păng sơnguĕt na đơ̆ng noh tơlĕch Sư đĕch.”

English: (for it was necessary for him to release one to them at the feast).
Bahnar: Rim đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih na Pilat ngăl juăt kơ tơlĕch ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng hnam phak.

English: And they all cried out at once, saying, “Away with this Man, and release to us Barabbas”
Bahnar: Pilat wă tơlĕch Yêsu ră mă-lei đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư wang pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Pơlôch Sư đĕch na tơlĕch ăn kơ nhôn 'Barra'ba.”

English: who had been thrown into prison for a certain rebellion made in the city, and for murder.
Bahnar: 'Barra'ba noh đe tah sư lăm hnam phak yua kơ sư iung blah lu 'bok pơgơ̆r tơ lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem, na kơplah ei sư kư̆m chă pơlôch đe mơ̆n.

English: Pilate, therefore, wishing to release Jesus, again called out to them.
Bahnar: Pilat oei pơma pơlung lu sư dơ̆ng yua kơ Pilat wă tơlĕch Yêsu tơpă ră.

English: But they shouted, saying, “Crucify Him, crucify Him!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang, pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.”

English: Then he said to them the third time, “Why, what evil has He done? I have found no reason for death in Him. I will therefore chastise Him and let Him go.”
Bahnar: Pilat pơma dŏng ră Yêsu 'măng mă pêng thoi âu: “Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm wă pơlôch Sư? Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ? Inh ưh kơ 'bôh Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh na lơliơ iĕm khan wă pơlôch Sư lĕ? Na dang ei inh athei lu linh teh pơjĭ Sư păng sơnguĕt, na đơ̆ng noh tơlĕch Sư đĕch.”

English: But they were insistent, demanding with loud voices that He be crucified. And the voices of these men and of the chief priests prevailed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu đe ei pơma 'bơ̆r re pơlŭt Pilat khŏm khŏm athei sư pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang. Na khŏm khŏm jing jei hĭ lu đe noh tơpă.

English: So Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they requested.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Pilat jing chu ăn kơ lu sư pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang.

English: And he released to them the one they requested, who for rebellion and murder had been thrown into prison; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
Bahnar: Pilat tơlĕch ăn kơ lu sư bơngai mă lu sư apinh noh, bơngai mă đêl đe tah lăm hnam phak yua kơ sư iung blah lu 'bok pơgơ̆r ki păng sư chă pơlôch đe. Mă-lei gah Yêsu, Pilat chu ăn kơ lu sư pơlôch đĕch.

English: Now as they led Him away, they laid hold of a certain man, Simon a Cyrenian, who was coming from the country, and on him they laid the cross that he might bear it after Jesus.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đe anhăk ba Yêsu wă năm pơ̆ng pơlôch. Đei minh 'nu bơngai, anăn sư Simôn, sư bơngai Pơlei Siren. Sư năm brih trong ei wă mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ră, mă-lei lu linh dui pơgŏ sư tôi kơ Yêsu 'long pơglang, yak đơ̆ng rŏng Yêsu.

English: And a great multitude of the people followed Him, and women who also mourned and lamented Him.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla lơ tơpă kiơ̆ lăng Yêsu. Kư̆m đei lơ drŏ-kăn mơ̆n, sư hmoi ơh sơ'ngon rah.

English: But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu hue lăng tơ lu sư păng khan: “Ơ lu drŏ-kăn Pơlei Jêrusalem, iĕm 'nĕ pă hmoi kơ Inh. Iĕm athei hmoi kơ lu tơduă iĕm păng đe kon iĕm đĕch.

English: For indeed the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, wombs that never bore, and breasts which never nursed!’
Bahnar: Yua kơ ning-mônh gô đei tơdrong anat anot truh tơpă na đe gô khan thoi âu: ‘Lu bơngai akâu pôm păng lu bơngai ưh kơ lah đei kon, lu sư đĕch hiôk.’

English: Then they will begin ‘to say to the mountains, “Fall on us!” and to the hills, “Cover us!” ’
Bahnar: Hơtai ei kơnh đe gô khan kơ kông thoi âu: ‘Hiŏng tơlơ̆ kơpal nhôn âu bĕ.’ Na đe kư̆m khan kơ groi thoi âu mơ̆n: ‘Klơ̆p lê̆ nhôn bĕ.’

English: For if they do these things in the green wood, what will be done in the dry?”
Bahnar: Dah đe pơm kơnê̆ dang âu kơ Inh bơngai mă ưh kơ pơm yoch yua kơ Inh thoi lĕ kơ 'long adrih đĕch, bĭ đe gô pơm dang yơ kơ lu bơngai pơm yoch, yua kơ lu sư thoi lĕ kơ 'long ŭnh kro, ŭnh 'bônh kơ sa tơpă?”

English: There were also two others, criminals, led with Him to be put to death.
Bahnar: Lu linh ei anhăk ba bre 'bar 'nu bơngai yoch, lu linh kư̆m wă pơ̆ng pơlôch bre sư hơdai păng Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: And when they had come to the place called Calvary, there they crucified Him, and the criminals, one on the right hand and the other on the left.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ anih đe anăn anih kơting kơ̆l bơngai lôch, na lu sư pơ̆ng Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang tơ noh. 'Bar 'nu bơngai yoch noh hei sư kư̆m pơ̆ng hơdai păng Yêsu mơ̆n, minh 'nu gah 'ma, minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo kơ Sư.

English: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they do.” And they divided His garments and cast lots.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bă, apinh Ih 'nĕ jô̆ yo kơ lu sư, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ băt lu sư oei pơm kiơ ôh.” Na lu linh ei pơpơn dih băl wă kơ băt bu gơh iŏk ao Yêsu, bu iŏk ao ayơ, bu iŏk ao ayơ. Lu sư asong băl ao Yêsu thoi noh.

English: And the people stood looking on. But even the rulers with them sneered, saying, “He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the chosen of God.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t ei wă lăng đe pơlôch Yêsu. Lu đe 'bok tih Juđê che bơle kơ Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Sư gơh pơklaih đe sơ̆, na dang ei dah Sư 'Bok Krist tơpă mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih wă pơm Pơtao bơ̆n lei lê̆ Sư pơklaih akâu Sư kơdih lăng.”

English: The soldiers also mocked Him, coming and offering Him sour wine
Bahnar: Lu linh che bơle kơ Yêsu mơ̆n. Lu sư năm tơ Yêsu pơm ăn kơ Sư sik athei et.

English: and saying, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan thoi âu: “Dah Ih Pơtao bơngai Juđê tơpă, lei Ih pơklaih akâu Ih kơdih lăng.”

English: And an inscription also was written over Him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Bahnar: Đe chih tơ gơ'bang iĕ kơpal kơ̆l Sư thoi âu: 'Bok 'nâu Pơtao đe Juđê.

English: Then one of the criminals who were hanged blasphemed Him, saying, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us.”
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bơngai yoch noh mă đe pơ̆ng hơdai păng Sư, na minh 'nu pơma pơjăm Sư thoi âu: “Ih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơm Pơtao nhôn hă, na lei Ih kuă kơ kiơ pơklaih akâu Ih kơdih, đơ̆ng noh pơklaih nhi hai?”

English: But the other, answering, rebuked him, saying, “Do you not even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah bôl sư minh 'nu noh khă sư thoi âu: “E ưh kơ hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hă? Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n âu wă lôch kơ đe pơ̆ng bơ̆n yua kơ đe jô̆ bơngai yoch.

English: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward of our deeds; but this Man has done nothing wrong.”
Bahnar: Đe pơ̆ng pơlôch ba trŏ boih yua kơ ba pơm tơdrong yoch tơpă. Mă-lei Sư âu ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ ôh.”

English: Then he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom.”
Bahnar: Na bơngai ei khan kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ Yêsu, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ hŏ lăp Ih pơm Pơtao nhôn ning-mônh.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “Assuredly, I say to you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh khan kơ ih tơpă, năr âu hloi boih ih gô oei hơdai păng Inh tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Now it was about the sixth hour, and there was darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr dơ̆ng 'bôh glĭp kơ măng mu pă đei hơdah jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak truh tơ pêng jơ kơsơ̆.

English: Then the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.
Bahnar: Na che đe dăng pơgăn tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm kư̆m tơhek chuơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk mơ̆n.

English: And when Jesus had cried out with a loud voice, He said, “Father, ‘into Your hands I commit My spirit.’ ” Having said this, He breathed His last.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ 'Bă, Inh pơjao ăn kơ Ih Bơhngol Inh.” Na lăp Sư pơma đang boih, na Yêsu kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m hloi.

English: So when the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous Man!”
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh 'bôh dôm tơdrong Yêsu lôch noh na sư ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Bơngai 'nâu Sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kiơ ôh.”

English: And the whole crowd who came together to that sight, seeing what had been done, beat their breasts and returned.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla mă năm lăng tơdrong ei lu sư 'bôh Yêsu lôch thoi noh, na lu sư ơh sơ'ngon tơpă, na tŭr kơtơh brŏk hloi tơ anih hnam sư kơdih.

English: But all His acquaintances, and the women who followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơngai juăt păng Yêsu, lu sư mơ'nah bơngai drŏ-kăn mă kiơ̆ Sư đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, lu sư dơ̆ng đơ̆ng ataih 'biơ̆ wă răp lăng dôm tơdrong đe pơm kơ Yêsu.

English: Now behold, there was a man named Joseph, a council member, a good and just man.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Armơthê lăm dêh Juđê, anăn sư Yôsep, sư khŭl bơngai kră sek tơlang kơ đe ră mă-lei sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: He had not consented to their decision and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who himself was also waiting for the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Na kơplah lu bôl sư sek tơlang kơ Yêsu khan wă pơlôch Sư hei, Yôsep ưh kơ wă mơ̆t đon lu đe noh ôh. Sư hơdai wang chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r mơ̆n.

English: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
Bahnar: Yôsep năm tơ Pilat wă apinh iŏk 'bŭ atâu Yêsu.

English: Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a tomb that was hewn out of the rock, where no one had ever lain before.
Bahnar: Lăp Yôsep apinh đang boih na sư tơjur iŏk atâu Yêsu đơ̆ng 'long pơglang, na sư lôm atâu Yêsu păng minh blah che kok. Klaih kơ noh sư năm 'măn atâu Yêsu tơ lăm bơsat mă đe bŏk lăm tơmo. Bơsat noh đe tam mă đei 'măn bu ôh.

English: That day was the Preparation, and the Sabbath drew near.
Bahnar: Na năr ei trŏ kơ năr đe hơmet lê̆ hơdrol tôm tơdrong wă yua lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat dơning. Kơsơ̆ năr 'nei boih Yôsep 'măn atâu Yêsu tơ lăm bơsat.

English: And the women who had come with Him from Galilee followed after, and they observed the tomb and how His body was laid.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai drŏ-kăn mă kiơ̆ Yêsu đơ̆ng dêh Galilê ki, lu sư kư̆m kiơ̆ Yôsep kơplah sư năm 'măn atâu Yêsu tơ lăm bơsat mơ̆n. Thoi noh na lu sư băt anih Yôsep 'măn atâu Yêsu.

English: Then they returned and prepared spices and fragrant oils. And they rested on the Sabbath according to the commandment.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư brŏk tơ hnam chă hơmet pơgang 'bâu phu wă năm pik tơ akâu Yêsu. Kơplah năr pơdơh Sa'bat lu sư kư̆m pơdơh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain other women with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.
Bahnar: Lăp 'brưch hơdah til pơgê năr mônh, lu drŏ-kăn ei chĕp ba pơgang 'bâu phu mă đêl lu sư hơmet lê̆ noh na năm tơ bơsat.

English: But they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh 'măng tơmo mă klơ̆p bơsat noh tơpơih boih.

English: Then they went in and did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
Bahnar: Na lu sư mơ̆t lăng lăm bơsat ei 'bôh jua kơ atâu Yêsu.

English: And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that behold, two men stood by them in shining garments.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh tơdrong noh na lu sư sơleng kơ đon. Lăp pă 'biơ̆ kơ 'nei 'bôh blư hloi kơ 'bar 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng jê̆ lu sư. Bre sư hrŭk ao kok rang hơdah.

English: Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the earth, they said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-kăn ei hli dêh tơpă na lu sư bon tơ teh. Na bre linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm chă bơngai arih tơ anih đe lôch?

English: He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee
Bahnar: Sư ưh pă oei tơ âu boih yua kơ Sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch boih. Na iĕm hăm 'blŏk kơ tơdrong Sư bơtho iĕm tơ dêh Galilê ki ưh?

English: saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư khan đe gô jao Sư Kon Bơngai kơ lu bơngai yoch, na lu sư gô pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr Sư gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: And they remembered His words.
Bahnar: Na lu sư 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ nơ̆r Yêsu bơtho thoi noh ki.

English: Then they returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
Bahnar: Na lu sư hơloh brŏk roi dôm tơdrong noh kơ lu mơjĭt-mônh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu hăm đĭ kơ lu bôl sư mơ̆n.

English: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them, who told these things to the apostles.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-kăn mă 'bôh tơdrong noh hei, anăn lu sư Mari đơ̆ng Pơlei Mađơla, Jôanna, hăm Mari mĕ bre Jôsê hăm Yakơ; păng kư̆m đei lu bơngai drŏ-kăn nai dơ̆ng mơ̆n kiơ̆ lu sư.

English: And their words seemed to them like idle tales, and they did not believe them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu ngêh kơ lu drŏ-kăn ei hơlĕnh đĕch, na lu sư ưh kơ lui.

English: But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and he departed, marveling to himself at what had happened.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs iung kơdâu năm tơ bơsat. Sư kŭp nger lăng tơ lăm bơsat ei, sư 'bôh che kok đêl đe lôm akâu Yêsu oei 'bơ̆t ei, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh akâu Yêsu ôh. Na sư brŏk tơ hnam tơtĭnh lăng sơleng kơ đon.

English: Now behold, two of them were traveling that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was seven miles from Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Kơplah năr ei đei 'bar 'nu bôl lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Emmaut. Đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ pơlei 'nei dang mơjĭt-mônh kơsô̆.

English: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư oei năm rok trong bre sư pơma dơnuh rah gah tơdrong Yêsu 'nao lôch

English: So it was, while they conversed and reasoned, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.
Bahnar: 'bôh blư hloi kơ Yêsu yak hơdai bre sư.

English: But their eyes were restrained, so that they did not know Him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre sư ưh kơ kơnăl kơ Yêsu ôh.

English: And He said to them, “What kind of conversation is this that you have with one another as you walk and are sad?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet bre sư: “Kơplah biĕm yak rok trong hei biĕm pơma dơnuh tơdrong kiơ?” Na bre sư bơngoi, dơ̆ng hloi.

English: Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You the only stranger in Jerusalem, and have You not known the things which happened there in these days?”
Bahnar: Na gah minh 'nu, anăn sư Klôpaih, tơl Yêsu thoi âu: “Dôm lu kon pơlei Jêrusalem hăm lu bơngai tơmoi oei tơ ei, lu sư băt đĭ tôm tơdrong truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem brei mơsơ̆, na pă Ih đĕch dah kiơ bơngai tơmoi wih đơ̆ng noh boih ră mă-lei tam băt kơ tơdrong noh?”

English: And He said to them, “What things?” So they said to Him, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a Prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet dơ̆ng: “Tơdrong kiơ kih?” Na bre sư khan: “Tơdrong Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret, Sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Sư hơgei tơpă bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei păng ăn kơ Sư gơh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang mơ̆n. Na đĭ-đăng lu kon tơring tơrang wang ư-ang kơ Sư.

English: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death, and crucified Him.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi tih bơ̆n păng lu đe kră pơgơ̆r lu bơ̆n jao Sư kơ 'bok tih Pilat athei pơlôch Sư. Na đơ̆ng noh lu sư pơ̆ng pơlôch lê̆ Sư tơ 'long pơglang.

English: But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.
Bahnar: Nhôn ngêh kơ Sư wă ăn kơ dêh char Isơrael rơngei ră, mă-lei đe pơlôch Sư boih. Đei pêng năr kơ 'nâu boih Sư lôch.

English: Yes, and certain women of our company, who arrived at the tomb early, astonished us.
Bahnar: Na lu drŏ-kăn bôl nhôn, lu sư roi kơ nhôn tơdrong hlĭch. Pơgê hrôih hei lu sư năm tơ bơsat Yêsu

English: When they did not find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said He was alive.
Bahnar: mă-lei lu sư chă lăng akâu Yêsu ră ưh kơ 'bôh ôh. Na lu sư brŏk roi kơ nhôn khan sư 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei roi kơ lu sư khan Yêsu iung arih đơ̆ng lôch boih.

English: And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but Him they did not see.”
Bahnar: Lu bôl nhôn nai, lu sư kư̆m kơdâu năm lăng tơ bơsat mơ̆n ră mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh akâu Yêsu tơ lăm bơsat ei kư̆m thoi lĕ kơ lu đe drŏ-kăn noh roi hei mơ̆n. Lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh Yêsu iung arih tơ yơ.”

English: Then He said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bre sư thoi âu: “Ơ lu bơngai kơhlôh, biĕm anat tơpă kơ lui dôm tơdrong lu bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?”
Bahnar: Đe pơlôch 'Bok Krist thoi noh trŏ tơpă boih, na dang ei Sư iung arih wă tŏk tơ plĕnh ti pơgơ̆r.”

English: And beginning at Moses and all the Prophets, He expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng noh Yêsu tơblang kơ bre sư dôm tơdrong đơ̆ng sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Sư, mă đơ̆ng Môis mă truh tơ đĭ lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: Then they drew near to the village where they were going, and He indicated that He would have gone farther.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lăp wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Emmaut ră, na Yêsu nhen lĕ kơ wă yak tơ nai.

English: But they constrained Him, saying, “Abide with us, for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.” And He went in to stay with them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre noh pơtơm Sư khŏm khŏm khan: “Ih năm 'bĭch hơdai păng nhi 'biơ̆ wăi, yua kơ dang ei đĭ kơsơ̆ boih.” Na Yêsu chu bre sư.

English: Now it came to pass, as He sat at the table with them, that He took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.
Bahnar: Na Sư tơoei hơdai păng bre sư wă sŏng sa. Na Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na phĕ asong kơ bre sư 'bĕng mi ei.

English: Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight.
Bahnar: Na 'bơ̆t ei bre sư 'nao kơnăl kơnăi kơ Yêsu. Lăp kơnăl na jua pă 'bôh hloi.

English: And they said to one another, “Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”
Bahnar: Bre sư pơma dih băl khan: “Sư tơblang kơ ba tơdrong lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah bơ̆n oei yak hơdai rok trong hei ba mah đơđŭk hiôk jơhngơ̆m hloi iih?”

English: So they rose up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bre sư gruih iung brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Bre sư năm tơ lu mơjĭt-mônh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu hăm lu bôl sư na 'bôh lu sư oei akŭm dih băl.

English: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
Bahnar: Na lu bôl sư roi kơ bre sư khan: “Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu iung arih tơpă boih, Simôn 'nao 'bôh Sư hei.”

English: And they told about the things that had happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread.
Bahnar: Na bre sư kư̆m roi ăn kơ lu bôl sư gah tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu yak hơdai bre sư kơplah rok trong hei mơ̆n, na bre sư kơnăl kơ Yêsu kơplah Sư oei phĕ 'bĕng mi.

English: Now as they said these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them, and said to them, “Peace to you.”
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư oei roi tơdrong noh hei ră 'bôh blư kơ Yêsu dơ̆ng hơdai lu sư. Na Yêsu khan: “Oei hiôk bĕ lu iĕm.”

English: But they were terrified and frightened, and supposed they had seen a spirit.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơdrăt hli tơrơ yua kơ lu sư ngêh kơ atâu.

English: And He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm hli păng ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch?

English: Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have.”
Bahnar: Iĕm lăng rơka jơ̆ng ti Inh na iĕm kơnăl kơ Inh tơpă. Iĕm pel lăng akâu Inh wăi. Dah atâu ưh kơ đei akâu akar thoi Inh âu ôh.”

English: When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.
Bahnar: Lăp Sư khan thoi noh na Sư tơ'bôh hloi kơ lu sư jơ̆ng ti Sư.

English: But while they still did not believe for joy, and marveled, He said to them, “Have you any food here?”
Bahnar: Lu sư hiôk chơt tơpă, mă-lei kư̆m oei sơleng kơ đon 'biơ̆ mơ̆n yua kơ lu sư tam mă lui tơpă. Thoi noh na Yêsu jet lu sư: “Iĕm hăm đei tơmam sa tơ âu dah ưh?”

English: So they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.
Bahnar: Na lu sư ăn kơ Yêsu ka hlôi sĭn boih.

English: And He took it and ate in their presence.
Bahnar: Yêsu iŏk ka noh sa hloi 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: Then He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms concerning Me.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Hơtai Inh oei hơdai păng iĕm ki Inh kư̆m roi kơ iĕm tơdrong Inh wă lôch iung arih dơ̆ng. Dôm tơdrong đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Môis, sơ̆p hla bơar lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng sơ̆p hla bơar Tơdrong Hơri Sơ̆ mă khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Inh, dôm tơdrong noh bơ̆n gô 'bôh tơpă.”

English: And He opened their understanding, that they might comprehend the Scriptures.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu ăn kơ đon lu sư hlôh wao sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Tơdrong đe chih lê̆ hơdrol noh sơ̆ thoi âu: 'Bok Krist gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat na lôch, kơtĕch pêng năr Sư iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Na đe gô bơtho đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak athei đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih yoch lu sư, yua kơ Inh lôch tang lu sư.

English: And you are witnesses of these things.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'bôh Inh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch hăm 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh pơm đơ̆ng sơ̆, na wă kơ iĕm năm roi kơ đe tơdrong Inh dơ̆ng.

English: Behold, I send the Promise of My Father upon you; but tarry in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kư̆m thoi lĕ 'Bă Inh pơkă wă ăn kơ iĕm mơ̆n. Mă-lei iĕm athei oei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem khŏm khŏm tơ̆p mă 'bôh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đơ̆ng plĕnh jur tơ iĕm 'mơ̆i, na iĕm jing pran hăm nuih tơpă chă bơtho đe.”

English: And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu anhăk lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Bethani na Sư yơ̆r ti krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei athei tơgŭm lu sư.

English: Now it came to pass, while He blessed them, that He was parted from them and carried up into heaven.
Bahnar: Na kơplah Sư oei krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Sư tơ plĕnh achăng lê̆ lu sư.

English: And they worshiped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ei sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ Yêsu. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư brŏk hloi tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. Amen.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm rim năr wă ư-ang kơ Sư.
